original: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag / ji ltar bshad pa 'di zhes bya //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag / ji ltar bshad pa 'di zhes bya //
translated: as they have been explained, are like this.

original: rnam par dag pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-eighth chapter, on purity, in The Treatise on the Pith Instructions on Prajñāpāramitā, Called The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / sbyor ba ni ;
analyzed: // / sbyor ba ni ;
translated: The Application🔽The application to form and so forth, to its impermanence and so forth,🔽to its incompleteness and its completion,🔽to the application that stops conduct,🔽to the absence of attachment to it,

original: gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // spyod pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba dang // de la chags pa med nyid dang // mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // bya dka' rnam gsum sbyor ba dang // skal pa ji bzhin 'bras thob pas //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // spyod pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba dang // de la chags pa med nyid dang // mi 'gyur byed po med nyid dang // bya dka' rnam gsum sbyor ba dang // skal pa ji bzhin 'bras thob pas //
translated: to its changelessness and its being without a creator,🔽to the application to the three kinds of difficult practices,🔽and to the attainment of the result in accordance with one’s fortune

original: 'bras yod 'dod pa de dang ni //
analyzed: 'bras yod 'dod pa de dang ni //
translated: are asserted to be the existence of the result.🔽The application to the absence of dependence on another

original: gzhan la rag las min gang dang // snang ba rnam bdun shes byed do //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las min gang dang // snang ba rnam bdun shes byed do // zhes pa la /
translated: and to the seven appearances is to be known.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
translated: Subhūti asked,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum la ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum la ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
translated: “How should bodhisattvas practice with the mother?”🔽The reply, “If they do not practice with form and so forth up to omniscience, they practice with the mother,” is the application to form and so forth.

original: de'i lan gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi spyod na yum la spyod do zhes pa ni gzugs sogs kyi sbyor ba'o //🔽de mi @239a * //
analyzed: de'i lan gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi spyod na yum la spyod do zhes pa ni gzugs sogs kyi sbyor ba'o //🔽de mi @239a * //
translated: “That is not form” and so forth🔽is the application to its impermanence and so forth.

original: rtag sogs kyi sbyor ba ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen par rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal bdag yod med /🔽sdug pa dang mi sdug par mi spyod na yum la spyod do //🔽rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yongs su rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa la mi spyod na'o //
analyzed: rtag sogs kyi sbyor ba ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen par rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal bdag yod med / sdug pa dang mi sdug par mi spyod na yum la spyod do // rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yongs su rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa la mi spyod na'o //
translated: The application of permanence and so on is not to engage with form up to omniscience as permanent or impermanent, as blissful or painful, as self or not self, as attractive or unattractive.🔽The application of completion and noncompletion is not to engage with form up to omniscience as complete or incomplete.

original: chags pa dang ma chags pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar chags pa dang ma chags pa'o zhes bya bar mi sbyor na'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang ma chags pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar chags pa dang ma chags pa'o zhes bya bar mi sbyor na'o //
translated: The application of attachment and nonattachment is not to engage with form up to omniscience as attachment or nonattachment.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni nam mkha' la bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang 'phel 'grib med pa'i dpes yum la 'gyur ba med pa dang / byed pa po med pa'i sbyor ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu la bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang chags sdang med pa'i dpes byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa la chags sdang med pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni nam mkha' la bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang 'phel 'grib med pa'i dpes yum la 'gyur ba med pa dang / byed pa po med pa'i sbyor ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu la bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang chags sdang med pa'i dpes byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa la chags sdang med pa dang /
translated: The application of the absence of an agent is the absence of attachment and aversion in the bodhisattva's conduct toward the mother, illustrated by the example of an illusory person, who feels neither attachment nor aversion when praised or blamed.

original: bya dka' rnam gsum gyi sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: bya dka' rnam gsum gyi sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the three difficult tasks is as follows.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa //
translated: Subhuti said:

original: yum bsgom pa ni nam mkha' bsgom pa lags te /
analyzed: yum bsgom pa ni nam mkha' bsgom pa lags te /
translated: Mother, to meditate on you is to meditate on space,

original: nam mkha' la ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med do //
translated: for in space there is no form up to no omniscience.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyis bskal pa tshad med grangs med par bzhugs nas /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyis bskal pa tshad med grangs med par bzhugs nas /
translated: The buddhas of the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, have resided for immeasurable and countless eons,

original: sems can tshad med grangs med pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la bkod kyang sems can gyi khams la bri'ang med gang ba'ang med de /
analyzed: sems can tshad med grangs med pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la bkod kyang sems can gyi khams la bri'ang med gang ba'ang med de /
translated: Although they establish countless, immeasurable sentient beings in the expanse of nirvana without remainder, the realm of sentient beings neither increases nor decreases.

original: sems can gdod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can gdod ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because sentient beings are pure from the beginning.

original: bshad kyang de bzhin ma bshad kyang de bzhin no //🔽skal ba ji bzhin 'bras thob pas //🔽'bras bu yod par 'dod pa'i sbyor ba ni de nas dge slong cig gis chos thams cad skye ba'am 'gag pa'am kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa la tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa lnga /
analyzed: bshad kyang de bzhin ma bshad kyang de bzhin no // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras thob pas // 'bras bu yod par 'dod pa'i sbyor ba ni de nas dge slong cig gis chos thams cad skye ba'am 'gag pa'am kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa la tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa lnga /
translated: Whether it is explained or not, it is just as it is.

original: rgyun zhugs la sogs pa 'phags pa'i gang zag thob pa'i yum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rgyun zhugs la sogs pa 'phags pa'i gang zag thob pa'i yum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: The application of the assertion of the existence of results in accordance with fortune is as follows: Then a certain monk, in regard to all phenomena being without arising, ceasing, affliction, or purification, paid homage to the mother who attains the five aggregates such as morality, the noble persons such as stream-enterers, and so forth.

original: gzhan la rag las pa ma yin pa'i sbyor pa ni brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa ma yin pa'i sbyor pa ni brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: The application of not relying on others is as stated by Indra:

original: bdag gis yum de la ji lta bu zhig brtson par bgyi /
analyzed: bdag gis yum de la ji lta bu zhig brtson par bgyi /
translated: How should I strive in that mother?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: nam mkha' stong pa nyid la khyod brtson par 'dod dam /
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa nyid la khyod brtson par 'dod dam /
translated: “Do you wish to strive in the emptiness of space?”

original: snang ba rnam bdun gyi sbyor ba ni brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: snang ba rnam bdun gyi sbyor ba ni brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: The application of the seven appearances is as Śatakratu said,

original: yum la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bdag gis ji lta bu zhig bsrung bar bgyi /
analyzed: yum la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la bdag gis ji lta bu zhig bsrung bar bgyi /
translated: “How should I guard the bodhisattva who practices the mother?”

original: @239b rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: @239b rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: rmi lam nas sprul pa'i bar gyi brdzun la khyod bsrung bar 'dod dam /
analyzed: rmi lam nas sprul pa'i bar gyi brdzun la khyod bsrung bar 'dod dam /
translated: “Do you wish to guard the lies from dreams up to emanations?”

original: rigs kyi bu yum de nyid la gnas na bsrung ba'i mchog go //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu yum de nyid la gnas na bsrung ba'i mchog go //
translated: “Son of good family, if you abide in the mother herself, that is the supreme guarding.”

original: mnyam pa nyid ni /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni /
translated: Equality

original: gzugs la sogs la rlom med pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs la rlom med pa //
translated: is not conceiving of forms and so on.

original: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: rnam bzhi de yi mnyam pa nyid //
translated: The four are the equality of that.

original: ces pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du de rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: ces pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du de rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: This is not conceiving of forms up to omniscience as a dream,

original: rmi lam gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rmi lam gyis rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: not conceiving of a dream as a dream,

original: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: and not conceiving of a dream as a dream.

original: sprul pa'i bar rlom sems su mi byed na yum la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i bar rlom sems su mi byed na yum la brtson pa'o //
translated: Up to not conceiving of emanations as emanations is striving in the mother.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'di na 'khod pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas rnams yum ming 'di nyid dang tshig 'di nyid dang yi ge 'di nyid kyis ston cing rab 'byor dang lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'ba' zhig
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'di na 'khod pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas rnams yum ming 'di nyid dang tshig 'di nyid dang yi ge 'di nyid kyis ston cing rab 'byor dang lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'ba' zhig
translated: Then, by the power of the Buddha, the gods and humans in this assembly saw the buddhas in the worlds of the ten directions teaching with this very name, this very phrase, and this very syllable of the mother, and they saw only Subhūti and Śakra, Lord of the Gods

original: zhu ba mthong bar gyur /
analyzed: zhu ba mthong bar gyur /
translated: asking questions.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang byams pa'ang 'di nyid la brten nas sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang byams pa'ang 'di nyid la brten nas sangs rgya'o //
translated: The buddhas of the three times and Maitreya also attained buddhahood in dependence on just this.

original: byams pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'di ltar chos mi ston pa dang ston pa ni /
analyzed: byams pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'di ltar chos mi ston pa dang ston pa ni /
translated: After Maitreya fully awakened to buddhahood, he taught the Dharma in this way:

original: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
translated: Form is neither permanent nor impermanent,🔽Beyond extremes, pure,🔽Unarisen, unceasing, and so forth,🔽Like space, free from attachment,🔽Liberated from grasping,🔽Inherently inexpressible,

original: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di don brjod pa yis //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di don brjod pa yis //
translated: Because it is expressed with this meaning,🔽And because it is the supreme of all expressions.

original: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //
translated: And it is to be completely pure, without arising.🔽It is to cut off the lower realms, and to actualize

original: ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni //
translated: The result.

original: mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid //
analyzed: mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid //
translated: It is to be non-conceptual with regard to🔽Signs, and to be unattached.🔽It is to be free from the connection

original: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //
analyzed: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //
translated: With the entity and the name.

original: shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
translated: It is the non-arising of consciousness.

original: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //🔽sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
analyzed: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma // sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
translated: It is the moment of complete knowledge.🔽It is the four moments of knowing🔽Dharma, subsequent acceptance,🔽And subsequent knowing with regard to

original: chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi ni //
analyzed: chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi ni //
translated: The truths of suffering and so forth.

original: kun shes nyid la mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: kun shes nyid la mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of seeing is the four moments of complete knowledge.

original: zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la 'dod khams kyi nyon mongs pa bcu dang bral ba ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la 'dod khams kyi nyon mongs pa bcu dang bral ba ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa /
translated: The freedom from the ten afflictions of the desire realm with regard to the four noble truths is the acceptance of knowing dharma.

original: de'i shul du gnyen po skyes pas na chos shes pa /
analyzed: de'i shul du gnyen po skyes pas na chos shes pa /
translated: The arising of the antidote in the wake of that is the knowing of dharma.

original: khams gong ma gnyis kyi khong khro ma gtogs pa dgu dgu dang bral ba ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa /
analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis kyi khong khro ma gtogs pa dgu dgu dang bral ba ni rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa /
translated: The freedom from the nine afflictions of the two higher realms, excluding anger, is the subsequent acceptance.

original: de'i shul du gnyen po skyes pa ni rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shul du gnyen po skyes pa ni rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: The subsequent knowledge is the antidote that arises after that.

original: de ltar bzhi ni nyan thos kyi mthong lam mo //🔽byams pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen @240a * //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi ni nyan thos kyi mthong lam mo // byams pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen @240a * //
translated: These four are the path of seeing of the śrāvakas.

original: gyi bar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gyi bar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'am /
translated: The loving one does not teach the Dharma as permanent or impermanent,

original: bde sdug gam /
analyzed: bde sdug gam /
translated: as happy or suffering,

original: bdag yod med dam /
analyzed: bdag yod med dam /
translated: as existent or nonexistent,🔽as attractive or unattractive,🔽as peaceful or not peaceful,

original: sdug mi sdug dang / zhi ma zhi dang / bcings grol dang / dus gsum zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug mi sdug dang / zhi ma zhi dang / bcings grol dang / dus gsum zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: as bound or liberated,🔽or as the three times, from form up to omniscience.

original: ji ltar ston na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rnam par dag go //
analyzed: ji ltar ston na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rnam par dag go //
translated: If it is asked how it is taught, it is taught as pure,

original: yongs su dag go //
analyzed: yongs su dag go //
translated: completely pure,🔽and so on, up to the pure Dharma.

original: nam mkha' la skye 'gag med /
analyzed: nam mkha' la skye 'gag med /
translated: Just as space is without arising and ceasing,

original: gos pa med gzung du med pa bsnyad du med brjod du med dmigs su med /
analyzed: gos pa med gzung du med pa bsnyad du med brjod du med dmigs su med /
translated: without being defiled, ungraspable, inexpressible, indescribable, and imperceptible,

original: de bzhin du yum la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du yum la mi dmigs so //
translated: in the same way, the mother is imperceptible.

original: nad mi 'byung ba'i phan yon ni //
analyzed: nad mi 'byung ba'i phan yon ni //
translated: The benefit of not having a disease is

original: mig gi nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro la sogs pa'o //
translated: that the disease of the eyes will not arise, and so on.

original: ngan song chad pa ni dmyal ba la sogs par mi ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song chad pa ni dmyal ba la sogs par mi ltung ba'o //
translated: The benefit of not falling into the lower realms is not falling into the hells and so on.

original: 'bras bu mngon du bya ba la mi rtog pa ni mngon mtho dang nges legs lam zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon du bya ba la mi rtog pa ni mngon mtho dang nges legs lam zhen pa'o //
translated: Nonconceptuality with regard to the fruition to be actualized is the path of attachment to high rebirth and definite goodness.

original: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel ba ni dmigs pa bcu gcig gis ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel ba ni dmigs pa bcu gcig gis ma gos pa'o //
translated: Lack of connection with signs is not being tainted by the eleven references.

original: dngos dang ming gnyis po la shes pa mi skye ba ni de ltar 'du shes par yang mi byed /
analyzed: dngos dang ming gnyis po la shes pa mi skye ba ni de ltar 'du shes par yang mi byed /
translated: The nonarising of cognition with regard to both the thing and the name is not to make such discriminations.

original: de ltar mi rtog de ltar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtog de ltar mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not to conceptualize in such a way and not to focus in such a way.

original: gzhi shes kyi bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi shes kyi bsdu ba ni /
translated: The summary of the knowledge of the basis is as follows.

original: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang // yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang // yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
translated: Thus this and also this and also this are the three.

original: de ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin //🔽zhes pa 'di dang ni rnam mkhyen no //
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin // zhes pa 'di dang ni rnam mkhyen no //
translated: They are taught completely in the three contexts.

original: yang 'di ni lam shes so //
analyzed: yang 'di ni lam shes so //
translated: This is the knowledge of all aspects and also this is the knowledge of the path.

original: yang 'di yin te gzhi shes so //
analyzed: yang 'di yin te gzhi shes so //
translated: Also this is the knowledge of the basis.

original: gnas med pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
analyzed: gnas med pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-ninth chapter, the chapter on the absence of a basis.

original: // / rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la zhus lan bco brgyad ston pa las rnam pa ni /
analyzed: // / rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la zhus lan bco brgyad ston pa las rnam pa ni /
translated: The eighteen questions and answers that teach the complete and perfect realization of all aspects are as follows.

original: gzhi shes pa yi khyad par gyis //
analyzed: gzhi shes pa yi khyad par gyis //
translated: The difference is due to the knowledge of the basis.🔽

original: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
translated: The aspects are the characteristics of the knowledge of the bases.

original: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
translated: Because of the three kinds of omniscience,

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: there are three kinds of aspects.

original: ces pa la gzhi shes pa'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun ni /🔽med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung nas //
analyzed: ces pa la gzhi shes pa'i rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun ni / med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung nas //
translated: The twenty-seven aspects of the knowledge of the bases are as follows:🔽From the aspect of nonexistence up to

original: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
translated: the aspect of imperturbability.

original: bden pa so so la bzhi la //
analyzed: bden pa so so la bzhi la //
translated: Four for each truth,

original: lam la de ni bco lngar 'dod //
analyzed: lam la de ni bco lngar 'dod //
translated: fifteen for the path.

original: ces pa las sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni med pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / dben pa dang thub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa las sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni med pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / dben pa dang thub pa med pa'o //
translated: The bases of suffering are nonexistence, sameness, isolation, and imperturbability.

original: kun 'byung gi gzhi ni gnas med pa dang / nam mkha' dang / brjod du med pa dang / ming med pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi gzhi ni gnas med pa dang / nam mkha' dang / brjod du med pa dang / ming med pa'o //
translated: The bases of origin are nonabiding, space, inexpressibility, and namelessness.

original: 'gog pa'i gzhi ni 'gro ba med pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa dang / skad cig ma dang / skye med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i gzhi ni 'gro ba med pa dang / mi 'phrogs pa dang / skad cig ma dang / skye med do //
translated: The bases of cessation are non-going, non-taking, non-momentariness, and non-arising.🔽The bases of the path are non-apprehension, non-grasping, non-production, and non-cessation.

original: lam gyi bco lnga ni byed pa po med pa dang / shes pa po med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / rmi lam dang / @240b sgra brnyan dang / mi g-yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang /
analyzed: lam gyi bco lnga ni byed pa po med pa dang / shes pa po med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / rmi lam dang / @240b sgra brnyan dang / mi g-yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang /
translated: the absence of an agent, the absence of a knower, the absence of movement, the absence of fear, dreams, echoes, optical illusions, mirages, illusions,

original: rmongs pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / rlom pa med pa dang / yum ni g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / rlom pa med pa dang / yum ni g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: the absence of confusion, the absence of affliction, the absence of purification, the absence of reference points, the absence of mental constructs, the absence of conceit, and the absence of movement.

original: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu so drug ni /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i rnam pa sum cu so drug ni /
translated: The thirty-six aspects of the knowledge of the path are:

original: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
translated: cause, path, suffering, and cessation, respectively.

original: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
analyzed: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
translated: They are known as eight, seven,

original: lnga dang bcu drug ces grags so //🔽zhes pa las /
analyzed: lnga dang bcu drug ces grags so //🔽zhes pa las /
translated: five, and sixteen.

original: kun 'byung gi brgyad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang / zhi ba dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi brgyad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang / zhi ba dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: The eight aspects of the truth of the origin of suffering are: being free from desire, being free from the afflictions, being peaceful, being free from desire, being free from anger, being free from ignorance, being free from afflictions,

original: sems can med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa'o //
translated: and being free from sentient beings.

original: lam gyi bdun ni rab tu spangs pa dang / mtha' gnyis su mi 'gyur ba dang / tha mi dad pa dang / nyams pa med pa dang / rtogs pa med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / nam mkha'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bdun ni rab tu spangs pa dang / mtha' gnyis su mi 'gyur ba dang / tha mi dad pa dang / nyams pa med pa dang / rtogs pa med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / nam mkha'o //
translated: The seven aspects of the truth of the path are: being completely abandoned, not being subject to the two extremes, being indivisible, being without decline, being without conceptualization, being immeasurable, and being like space.

original: sdug bsngal gyi lnga ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi lnga ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The five aspects of the truth of suffering are: being impermanent, being suffering, being empty, being without self, and being without characteristics.

original: 'gog pa'i bcu drug ni stong pa bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bcu drug ni stong pa bcu drug go //
translated: The sixteen aspects of the truth of cessation are the sixteen emptinesses.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa brgyad dang bcu tham pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa brgyad dang bcu tham pa ni /
translated: The eight aspects of the knowledge of all aspects and the ten aspects of the knowledge of paths are as follows:

original: kun mkhyen pa nyid gsum bye brag gis //
analyzed: kun mkhyen pa nyid gsum bye brag gis //
translated: The three knowledges are distinguished

original: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung nas //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung nas //
translated: , beginning with the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa //
analyzed: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam pa //
translated: The last is the Buddhahood itself.🔽The disciples, the Bodhisattvas,

original: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin du //
analyzed: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin du //
translated: and the Buddhas are respectively

original: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
analyzed: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
translated: endowed with thirty-seven, thirty-four,

original: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //🔽ces pa la /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed // ces pa la /
translated: and thirty-nine aspects.

original: nyan thos dang mthun pa'i sum cu rtsa bdun ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnams so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang mthun pa'i sum cu rtsa bdun ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnams so //
translated: The thirty-seven aspects that are in common with the disciples are the thirty-seven branches of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun pa'i sum cu rtsa bzhi ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang mthun pa'i sum cu rtsa bzhi ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu /
translated: The thirty-four aspects that are in common with the Bodhisattvas are the ten perfections,

original: rnam thar brgyad /
analyzed: rnam thar brgyad /
translated: the eight deliverances,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu /
translated: the nine serial absorptions,

original: rnam thar sgo gsum /
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum /
translated: the three gates of total liberation,

original: tshad med bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshad med bzhi'o //
translated: and the four immeasurable ones.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa sum cu so dgu ni stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa bzhi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa sum cu so dgu ni stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa bzhi /
translated: The thirty-nine aspects of the Buddha are the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad /
translated: the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha,

original: brjod pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: brjod pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid /
translated: the suchness of all expressions,

original: chos thams cad la mnga' bsgyur ba'i rang byung gi ye shes /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mnga' bsgyur ba'i rang byung gi ye shes /
translated: and the self-arisen gnosis that has mastery over all phenomena.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas yum ni de dag lags so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas yum ni de dag lags so //
translated: The mother of the Buddha who knows all aspects is just those.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i le'u ste sum cu pa'o /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i le'u ste sum cu pa'o /
translated: This is the thirtieth chapter, on the absence of reference points.

original: // / le'u 'di nas sbyor ba nyi shu /🔽yon @241a * //
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas sbyor ba nyi shu / yon @241a * //
translated: From this chapter onward, there are twenty applications.

original: tan bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: tan bcu bzhi'o //
translated: There are fourteen qualities.

original: sbyor ba po rten gyi gang zag gi chos lnga ni //
analyzed: sbyor ba po rten gyi gang zag gi chos lnga ni //
translated: The five qualities of the person who is the basis for the applications are

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
translated: Honoring the buddhas,

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
translated: planting the roots of virtue in them,

original: dge ba'i bshes kyis mgon bcas pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes kyis mgon bcas pa //
translated: being protected by the spiritual friend,

original: 'di nyan pa yi snod yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyan pa yi snod yin no //
translated: and being a vessel for listening to this.🔽Relying on the Buddha, asking questions,

original: sangs rgyas bsten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pa //
translated: practicing generosity, ethics, and so forth,

original: len dang 'dzin la sogs pa dang // zhes pa la /
analyzed: len dang 'dzin la sogs pa dang // zhes pa la /
translated: receiving, holding, and so forth,

original: yum gang gi rna lam du grag pa ni sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la bsnyen bkur byas /
analyzed: yum gang gi rna lam du grag pa ni sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la bsnyen bkur byas /
translated: The mother who is heard in the ears is one who has served countless buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed /
translated: She has planted the roots of virtue in the tathāgatas.

original: de lta dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'o //
translated: She is completely taken care of by the spiritual friend.

original: bsten nas the tshom gyi don zhus pa ni mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: bsten nas the tshom gyi don zhus pa ni mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The fearlessness is the asking of questions about the meaning of the doubts.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The proper mental attention is the practice of the six perfections.

original: sbyor ba nyi shu ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyi shu ni /
translated: The twenty kinds of application are:

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because of the non-abiding of form, etc.

original: de la gnas pa bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la gnas pa bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the negation of the abiding in that.

original: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
analyzed: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
translated: Because of the profundity of the reality of those.

original: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the difficulty of fathoming those.

original: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun rings rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun rings rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the immeasurability of those, and because of the realization after a long time with great hardship.

original: lung bstan phyir mi ldog pa dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
analyzed: lung bstan phyir mi ldog pa dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
translated: Because of the prediction, the irreversibility, the definite emergence, the absence of obstacles, the nearness of enlightenment, the swiftness, and because of the non-increase and non-decrease of the benefit of others.

original: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //🔽gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
analyzed: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong // gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
translated: Because of the non-perception of dharma and adharma, etc.🔽Because of the non-perception of the inconceivable form, etc.

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
translated: Because of the non-imagination of the sign of form, etc., and of the nature of that.

original: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas // zhes pa la /
translated: and it is pure, together with the boundary.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba ni brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa'i sbyor ba ni brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: The application of not dwelling on form and so on is as stated by Śatakratu:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la ji ltar gnas pa dang ji ltar brtson par bgyi /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la ji ltar gnas pa dang ji ltar brtson par bgyi /
translated: How should one dwell and how should one strive in the perfections and so on?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied:

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi gnas na /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi gnas na /
translated: If one does not dwell on form and so on up to omniscience,

original: yum la brtson te /
analyzed: yum la brtson te /
translated: one should strive in the mother.

original: de cis na /
analyzed: de cis na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la sogs pa sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sngon gyi mtha' la sogs par mi dmigs so //
translated: Because form and so on are not observed in the past and so on.

original: gnas pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la sbyor bar yang mi byed mi sbyor bar yang mi byed de rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽zab pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa zab pa'i phyir yum zab po //
analyzed: gnas pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la sbyor bar yang mi byed mi sbyor bar yang mi byed de rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // zab pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa zab pa'i phyir yum zab po //
translated: The application of the negation of dwelling is that one does not apply oneself to form and so on, nor does one not apply oneself, because the nature is not observed.🔽The application of profundity is that the mother is profound because form and so on are profound.

original: gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir yum gting dpag dka'o //
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la sogs pa gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir yum gting dpag dka'o //
translated: The application of being difficult to fathom is that the mother is difficult to fathom because form and so on are difficult to fathom.

original: tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la @241b sogs pa tshad med pa'i phyir yum tshad med do //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs la @241b sogs pa tshad med pa'i phyir yum tshad med do //
translated: The application of the immeasurable is that the Mother is immeasurable because form and so on are immeasurable.

original: zab ces bya ba dang / gting dpag dka' zhes bya ba dang / tshad med ces bya bar yang mi spyod na yum la spyod do //
analyzed: zab ces bya ba dang / gting dpag dka' zhes bya ba dang / tshad med ces bya bar yang mi spyod na yum la spyod do //
translated: If one does not engage in the so-called profound, the so-called difficult to fathom, and the so-called immeasurable, one engages in the Mother.🔽The seven applications of the occasion are as follows.

original: gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba bdun ni sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba bdun ni sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: de skad bshad pa la mi 'jigs mi dngang ba de /
analyzed: de skad bshad pa la mi 'jigs mi dngang ba de /
translated: To explain this without fear or terror

original: tshegs chen po yun ring po'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: tshegs chen po yun ring po'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: is the application of great difficulty and long duration.

original: lung bstan gyi sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: lung bstan gyi sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the prophecy is as follows.

original: las dang po pa la bshad nas mi 'jigs mi dngang na de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis las mi 'da' bar lung ston to //
analyzed: las dang po pa la bshad nas mi 'jigs mi dngang na de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis las mi 'da' bar lung ston to //
translated: If one explains this to beginners without fear or terror, one will not pass beyond one or two tathāgatas and will receive a prophecy.

original: bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba ni rmi lam na yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa bzang na da lta mngon sum gcer mthong du 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni rtags so //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba ni rmi lam na yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa bzang na da lta mngon sum gcer mthong du 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed pa ni rtags so //
translated: The application of the uninterrupted is as follows. If one dreams of holding the Mother and so on, and if one engages in the present direct perception of holding the Mother and so on, that is the sign.

original: nges 'byung gi sbyor ba ni dgon pa thag ring po nas 'ong tsam na yum gyi sa mtshams mthong bas 'jigs pa yid la mi byed pa'i dpes 'khor pa las nges par 'byung ba dang / bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba ni rgya mtsho chen po ltar 'gro ba la mtshan ma ma mthong na nye ba'i dpes rtags med rtags su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges 'byung gi sbyor ba ni dgon pa thag ring po nas 'ong tsam na yum gyi sa mtshams mthong bas 'jigs pa yid la mi byed pa'i dpes 'khor pa las nges par 'byung ba dang / bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba ni rgya mtsho chen po ltar 'gro ba la mtshan ma ma mthong na nye ba'i dpes rtags med rtags su bstan pa'o //
translated: The application without obstacles is like the example of not seeing signs when going to the great ocean, and is taught as a sign without a sign.

original: byang chub la nye ba'i sbyor ba ni dpyid dus su rtsi shing kha 'bus pa'i dpes /
analyzed: byang chub la nye ba'i sbyor ba ni dpyid dus su rtsi shing kha 'bus pa'i dpes /
translated: The application of approaching enlightenment is like the example of plants sprouting in the spring season.

original: byang chub myur ba'i sbyor ba ni sbrum ma zla ba tshang pa'i dpes byang chub myur bar thob pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub myur ba'i sbyor ba ni sbrum ma zla ba tshang pa'i dpes byang chub myur bar thob pa'o //
translated: The application of quickly attaining enlightenment is like the example of a pregnant woman whose time is full, and is the quick attainment of enlightenment.

original: gzhan don gyi sbyor ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan don gyi sbyor ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: The application for the benefit of others is that the bodhisattva is engaged for the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti asked:

original: yum ji ltar na bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa lags kyi lan ni /
analyzed: yum ji ltar na bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa lags kyi lan ni /
translated: Mother, how is the perfection of meditation?

original: 'phel med 'grib med kyi sbyor ba ni nam gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du 'phel ba dang 'grib par mi mthong ba'i tshe sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel med 'grib med kyi sbyor ba ni nam gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du 'phel ba dang 'grib par mi mthong ba'i tshe sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The application of neither increase nor decrease is when meditation is complete, at the time when increase and decrease are not seen from form to omniscience.

original: chos dang chos min la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang dus gsum dang khams gsum dang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na bsgom pa rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: chos dang chos min la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang dus gsum dang khams gsum dang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na bsgom pa rdzogs pa dang /
translated: The application of not seeing phenomena and non-phenomena and so forth is when meditation is complete, at the time when phenomena and non-phenomena, virtue and non-virtue, the three times, the three realms, form, and so forth up to omniscience are not seen.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la bsam gyis mi khyab par shes na bsgom pa rdzogs pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs dang gzugs kyi mtshan ma dang / gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog na de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la sogs shing bsgom pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la bsam gyis mi khyab par shes na bsgom pa rdzogs pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba ni gzugs dang gzugs kyi mtshan ma dang / gzugs kyi rang bzhin du mi rtog na de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la sogs shing bsgom pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The nonconceptual application is the completion of the meditation when one does not conceive of form, the sign of form, or the nature of form.

original: 'bras bu rin po che ster ba ni yum las phar phyin nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rin po che ster ba ni yum las phar phyin nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: The bestowal of the precious result is the perfection of the transcendent perfections up to omniscience as taught in the Mother Perfection of Wisdom sutras.

original: dag pa'i sbyor ba ni @242a * //
analyzed: dag pa'i sbyor ba ni @242a * //
translated: The pure application is

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the purity of form up to omniscience.

original: sa mtshams kyi sbyor ba ni yum 'dri ba la sogs pa la bar chad 'byung bas brin yang myur du bri ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa mtshams kyi sbyor ba ni yum 'dri ba la sogs pa la bar chad 'byung bas brin yang myur du bri ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The application of the boundary is the swift writing and so on of the Mother Perfection of Wisdom sutras and so on when obstacles arise from the questions and so on.

original: bdud kyi mthus bcom pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi mthus bcom pa la sogs pa /
translated: The application of the power of the demon is the power of the demon that destroys the perfection of wisdom and so on.

original: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi ni 'dri ba la sogs pa la bdud la sogs pas mi tshugs pa ni bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi ni 'dri ba la sogs pa la bdud la sogs pas mi tshugs pa ni bdud kyi mthu bcom pa'o //
translated: 1) Not being harmed by demons, etc. when questioned, etc. is “the power of demons destroyed.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa ni byin gyis rlob pas mi tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa ni byin gyis rlob pas mi tshugs pa'o //
translated: 2) Not being harmed by the Buddha’s intention is “not being harmed by the Buddha’s blessing.”

original: mngon sum du mdzad pa ni 'dri ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du mdzad pa ni 'dri ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: 3) Actualization is “questioning, etc.”

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba ni yum 'dri na sangs rgyas la nye ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba ni yum 'dri na sangs rgyas la nye ba'o //
translated: 4) Being close to perfect enlightenment is “being close to the Buddha” when the Mother is questioned.

original: don chen po nyid la sogs pa ni nam yang ngan song du mi skye pha rol tu phyin pa dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don chen po nyid la sogs pa ni nam yang ngan song du mi skye pha rol tu phyin pa dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: 5) Greatness of purpose, etc. is “never being reborn in the lower realms” and “never being separated from the perfections.”🔽The qualities of practicing the Mother are as follows:

original: yum spyad pa'i yon tan ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas /
analyzed: yum spyad pa'i yon tan ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas /
translated: After the Tathagata’s Parinirvana,

original: lho phyogs dang yum warta ni dang / byang phyogs su 'khor rnam pa bzhi yum 'dri ba la sogs pa dang me tog la sogs pa mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: lho phyogs dang yum warta ni dang / byang phyogs su 'khor rnam pa bzhi yum 'dri ba la sogs pa dang me tog la sogs pa mchod pa byas te /
translated: in the south and in the land of Varti, and in the north, the four retinues will question the Mother, etc., and will make offerings of flowers, etc.

original: nam yang ngan song du mi ltung ba dang lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa thob nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: nam yang ngan song du mi ltung ba dang lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa thob nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: They will never fall into the lower realms, and having attained the perfections of gods and humans, they will work for the welfare of sentient beings through the six perfections.

original: de cis na yum lnga brgya tha ma la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed de /
analyzed: de cis na yum lnga brgya tha ma la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byed de /
translated: Why is that? In the final five hundred years, they will perform the deeds of a Buddha.

original: dam pa'i chos 'dul ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'dul ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Vinaya of the sublime Dharma?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de cis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa sangs rgyas kyis dgongs la sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de cis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa sangs rgyas kyis dgongs la sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Why is that? The perfection of wisdom is the intention of the Buddha, and the intention of the Buddha is the perfection of wisdom.

original: zag pa med pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i yon tan thams cad rdzogs pa ni /
translated: The perfection of all uncontaminated qualities

original: sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rdzogs pa'o //
translated: is the perfection of generosity up to omniscience.🔽One becomes a speaker

original: smra ba'i skyes bur gyur pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gtam smra ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i skyes bur gyur pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gtam smra ba'o //
translated: who speaks about omniscience.🔽One becomes indivisible,

original: mi phyed pa ni bdud sdig can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni bdud sdig can gyis bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: in that one cannot be harmed by Māra.

original: dga' ba mchog tu gyur pa ni yum 'dri ba la sogs pa byed pa ni dga' ba dang bde ba'i nyams chen po skye ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba mchog tu gyur pa ni yum 'dri ba la sogs pa byed pa ni dga' ba dang bde ba'i nyams chen po skye ba'o //
translated: Supreme joy is the great experience of joy and bliss that arises from making love to the mother and so forth.

original: dam bcas pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin sgrub pa ni sems bskyed kyi dus su ji ltar khas blangs pa de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin sgrub pa ni sems bskyed kyi dus su ji ltar khas blangs pa de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: Fulfilling one's promise is to benefit sentient beings with the six perfections in accordance with the commitments made at the time of generating bodhichitta.

original: rgya chen po 'dzin pa ni yum gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa rgya chen po btang bas 'bras bu rgya chen po 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po 'dzin pa ni yum gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa rgya chen po btang bas 'bras bu rgya chen po 'thob pa'o //
translated: Embracing the vast is to attain the vast result by giving the vast gifts of the mother and so forth.

original: nges par rnyed pa'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: nges par rnyed pa'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of certainty are

original: btsal na nges par rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: btsal na nges par rnyed pa'o //
translated: definitely attained when sought.

original: byang phyogs kyi rgyud kyi le'u ste so gcig pa'o /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi rgyud kyi le'u ste so gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-first chapter on the northern transmission.

original: // / skyon ni bcu tshan @242b bzhir bcas pa //
analyzed: // / skyon ni bcu tshan @242b bzhir bcas pa //
translated: The faults are ten groups of ten,

original: drug tu nges par rtogs pa yin //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: drug tu nges par rtogs pa yin // zhes pa la /
translated: definitely realized as six.

original: bcu tshan dang po ni spobs pa ha cang mchi ba'i bdud ni /
analyzed: bcu tshan dang po ni spobs pa ha cang mchi ba'i bdud ni /
translated: The first group of ten is the māra of excessive eloquence.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dka' ba'i 'du shes kyis spyod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dka' ba'i 'du shes kyis spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of the six perfections with the idea of difficulty is the demon of the idea of difficulty.

original: spobs pa myur ba'i bdud ni 'dri ba la sogs pa'i tshan khugs su spyad nas des kyang rlom sems su byed pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa myur ba'i bdud ni 'dri ba la sogs pa'i tshan khugs su spyad nas des kyang rlom sems su byed pa'o //
translated: The demon of quick eloquence is the one who, having practiced the questions and so on, becomes conceited by them.

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len ni phan tshun glal zhing 'dri ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len ni phan tshun glal zhing 'dri ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The bodily addictions are yawning, stretching, and so on.

original: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni sems g-yengs shing 'dri ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len ni sems g-yengs shing 'dri ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mental addictions are the distraction of the mind, and so on.

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i kha ton ni dge sems kyis ma zin pa'i chos spyod do //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i kha ton ni dge sems kyis ma zin pa'i chos spyod do //
translated: The recitation that is produced by what is improper is the religious practice not embraced by the thought of enlightenment.

original: phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni bdag gi ming dang lung yang ma bstan 'di'i don yang mi rtogs so snyam ste stan las langs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni bdag gi ming dang lung yang ma bstan 'di'i don yang mi rtogs so snyam ste stan las langs pa'o //
translated: The sign of turning away is the thought, “He has not taught me the name or the prediction, and I do not understand the meaning of this,” and then getting up from one’s seat.

original: rtsa ba bor nas yal 'dab tshol ba'i dpes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yum bor ba ni rgyu las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba bor nas yal 'dab tshol ba'i dpes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yum bor ba ni rgyu las nyams pa'o //
translated: The example of the one who throws away the root and seeks the branches is the loss of the cause, the one who throws away the mother of the knowledge of all the modes.

original: khyis jo bo bor nas las mi las kha zas tshol ba'i dpes kha zas mchog las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: khyis jo bo bor nas las mi las kha zas tshol ba'i dpes kha zas mchog las nyams pa'o //
translated: The example of the dog who abandons the master and seeks food from a worker is the degeneration from the supreme food.

original: glang po rnyed nas rjes tshol gyi dpes theg pa mchog las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: glang po rnyed nas rjes tshol gyi dpes theg pa mchog las nyams pa'o //
translated: The example of seeking the footprints of an elephant after having found it is the degeneration from the supreme vehicle.

original: rgya mtsho chen po tshol ba ba lang gi rmig rjes kyi dpes ched du bya ba las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po tshol ba ba lang gi rmig rjes kyi dpes ched du bya ba las nyams pa'o //
translated: The example of seeking the great ocean in the footprint of an ox is the degeneration from the aim.

original: bcu tshan gnyis pa rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa nyams pa'i dpes /
analyzed: bcu tshan gnyis pa rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa nyams pa'i dpes /
translated: The second set of ten examples is the degeneration of the connection between cause and effect.

original: lha'i dbang po'i khang bzangs byed pa nyi ma dang zla ba'i tshad byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po'i khang bzangs byed pa nyi ma dang zla ba'i tshad byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the king of the gods building a palace and measuring it with the sun and moon.

original: gong na med pa nyams pa'i dpes 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po lta ba la mkhar gyi rgyal po dang phrad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gong na med pa nyams pa'i dpes 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po lta ba la mkhar gyi rgyal po dang phrad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The example of the degeneration of the unsurpassed is like the universal monarch meeting with the king of the fortress.

original: yum mang po la rnam par rtog pa ni yi ger 'dri ba la sogs pa la gzhan gyis g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: yum mang po la rnam par rtog pa ni yi ger 'dri ba la sogs pa la gzhan gyis g-yengs pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of many mothers is being distracted by others in writing and so on.

original: ro mchog las nyams pa ni /
analyzed: ro mchog las nyams pa ni /
translated: The degeneration from the supreme taste is

original: ro brgyad dang ldan pa'i kha zas bor nas drug cu pa'i kha zas ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ro brgyad dang ldan pa'i kha zas bor nas drug cu pa'i kha zas ba lta bu'o //
translated: The loss of the food of the eight liberations is like the loss of food of the sixty.

original: yon tan mchog las nyams pa ni nor bu rin po che nor bu mching bu dang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan mchog las nyams pa ni nor bu rin po che nor bu mching bu dang snyoms pa'o //
translated: The loss of the jewel of the supreme qualities is like the loss of the jewel of the precious gem.

original: yi ger 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa ni chos nyid kyi don ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ger 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa ni chos nyid kyi don ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: The loss of the writing is like the loss of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa ni thabs khyad du gsod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa ni thabs khyad du gsod pa'o //
translated: The loss of the non-existent is like the loss of the contempt for means.

original: yul la sogs pa yid la byed pa ni grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa yid la byed pa ni grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The loss of the object, etc., is like the loss of the object of the village, town, etc.

original: rnyed pha dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang ba las nyams pa ni 'jig rten chos brgyad la shor ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed pha dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang ba las nyams pa ni 'jig rten chos brgyad la shor ba'o //
translated: The loss of the taste of gain, honor, and praise is like the loss of the eight worldly dharmas.

original: bdud kyi las kyi le'u ste sum cu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyi le'u ste sum cu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the thirty-second chapter, on the activities of Mara, from The Jewel Garland of Buddhist Discourses.

original: // / bcu tshan gsum pa 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po gang yang rung ba 'dun pa dang snyom las kyis zin pas nyams pa dang / 'dun pa'i yul tha @243a * //
analyzed: // / bcu tshan gsum pa 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po gang yang rung ba 'dun pa dang snyom las kyis zin pas nyams pa dang / 'dun pa'i yul tha @243a * //
translated: The third set of ten: The loss of the one who explains or the one who listens, whether due to laziness or lack of interest, is like the loss of the one who is not interested in the Dharma.

original: dad pas nyams pa dang / 'dod chen chung ba dang 'dod chen chung ba ma yin pas nyams pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan mi ldan dang / dge mi dge dang / stong pa dang len par mi 'dod pa dang / sbyin pa dang ser sna dang mgo smos pas go ba dang /
