original: rnam par brtags pas dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis shes pa dang mi shes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pas dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis shes pa dang mi shes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: those who have degenerated through faith, those who have degenerated through having little desire or through having much desire, those who have the qualities of training or do not, those who are virtuous or nonvirtuous, those who do not wish to take up emptiness, those who are generous or stingy, those who understand through mere mention or through analysis, those who know or do not know the twelve branches of excellent speech, those who possess or do not possess the six perfections.

original: bcu tshan bzhi pa /
analyzed: bcu tshan bzhi pa /
translated: The fourth set of ten:

original: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / gzungs thob ma thob dang / yi ge 'drir 'dod mi 'dod dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ma bral dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba la phyir phyogs pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba la yid bde ba skyes pa dang /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / gzungs thob ma thob dang / yi ge 'drir 'dod mi 'dod dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang bral ma bral dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba la phyir phyogs pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba la yid bde ba skyes pa dang /
translated: those who possess or do not possess skill in means, those who have or have not obtained retention, those who wish or do not wish to write out the letters, those who are or are not free from the desire for desire realm objects, those who turn away from going to lower rebirths and those who delight in going to higher rebirths,

original: gcig pur 'dug pa dang 'khor la dga' ba dang / 'dod pa nye bar 'brel pa dang / de sbyin par mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa sgrub pa la de skabs mi 'byed pa dang / chom rkun la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i sa phyogs su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: gcig pur 'dug pa dang 'khor la dga' ba dang / 'dod pa nye bar 'brel pa dang / de sbyin par mi 'dod pa dang / 'dod pa sgrub pa la de skabs mi 'byed pa dang / chom rkun la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i sa phyogs su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba dang /
translated: The activities of Mara are: to be attached to solitude and to crowds, to be attached to desires, to not want to give, to not make time to fulfill desires, to go to places that are disturbed by thieves and so forth, and to not go.

original: khyim la 'dris par byed pa'i bdud kyi las dang / kha zas dkon pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / bdud kyi 'byed pa dang / bcos ma nye bar bsgyur ba dang / ji lta ba ma yin pas slu ba'o //
analyzed: khyim la 'dris par byed pa'i bdud kyi las dang / kha zas dkon pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / bdud kyi 'byed pa dang / bcos ma nye bar bsgyur ba dang / ji lta ba ma yin pas slu ba'o //
translated: The activities of Mara are: to be familiar with the household, to go to places where food is scarce, to be divided by Mara, to be transformed by Mara, and to be deceived by what is not as it is.

original: de cis na yum la gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med /
analyzed: de cis na yum la gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med /
translated: Why is it that in the Mother, from form up to omniscience, there is nothing?

original: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are no noble persons there.

original: yum la bar chad 'ong ba'i dpe ni nor bu rin po che la dgra mang ba'i dpes bstan /
analyzed: yum la bar chad 'ong ba'i dpe ni nor bu rin po che la dgra mang ba'i dpes bstan /
translated: The example of obstacles coming to the Mother is taught by the example of many enemies of a precious jewel.

original: las dang po pa la bdud 'byung gi / sbyangs pa can la mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: las dang po pa la bdud 'byung gi / sbyangs pa can la mi 'byung ste /
translated: Mara arises for beginners, but not for those who are trained.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad srung ba mdzad do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad srung ba mdzad do //
translated: All the buddhas of the ten directions protect it.

original: mtshan nyid mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: The brief teaching of the characteristics:

original: gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
analyzed: gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
translated: The object of knowledge is indicated by the characteristics.

original: shes bya de yang shes pa dang // khyad par byed dang rnam gsum po //
analyzed: shes bya de yang shes pa dang // khyad par byed dang rnam gsum po //
translated: That object of knowledge, the knower, the distinction maker, and the three

original: ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid do //
translated: are the essence and the characteristics.

original: de la shes rab pha rol phyin ma ni yum /
analyzed: de la shes rab pha rol phyin ma ni yum /
translated: Here, Prajñāpāramitā is the mother,

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas ni sras yin par ston pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas ni sras yin par ston pa ni /
translated: and the buddhas of the ten directions are the sons.

original: dper na bud med cig la bu mang du yod la /
analyzed: dper na bud med cig la bu mang du yod la /
translated: For example, a woman has many sons.

original: de rnams ji ltar byas na bdag cag gi ma ma 'di yun ring du 'tsho ba bar chad med par 'gyur snyam zhing bkur sti byed de /
analyzed: de rnams ji ltar byas na bdag cag gi ma ma 'di yun ring du 'tsho ba bar chad med par 'gyur snyam zhing bkur sti byed de /
translated: They think, How can we make our grandmother live long without obstacles? and they honor her.

original: ci nas bdag cag bskyed pa 'jig rten ston pa'o snyam mo //
analyzed: ci nas bdag cag bskyed pa 'jig rten ston pa'o snyam mo //
translated: She is the one who gave birth to us, the teacher of the world.

original: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang yum gyis bskyed 'jig rten bstan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bsam gtan nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du @243b bstan pas sangs rgyas su brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang yum gyis bskyed 'jig rten bstan pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bsam gtan nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du @243b bstan pas sangs rgyas su brjod do //
translated: The teaching of the world is the perfection of wisdom, from the concentrations up to omniscience, which is called “buddhahood.”

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni yum 'di la brten nas gzhi dang lam dang rnam pa skye med du shes pas so //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni yum 'di la brten nas gzhi dang lam dang rnam pa skye med du shes pas so //
translated: The characteristic of knowledge is that, based on this mother, one knows the ground, the path, and the aspects as non-arisen.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni nyan rang gi lam las khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni nyan rang gi lam las khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of distinction is that it is superior to the paths of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' yum bstan nas sems can gyi don byed pas so //
analyzed: byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' yum bstan nas sems can gyi don byed pas so //
translated: The characteristic of function is that the bodhisattvas, having been taught by the mother, benefit sentient beings.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i rang bzhin dang / byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i rang bzhin dang / 'jig rten gyi spyod pa dang mi mthun pa la sogs pa ste mdor bstan no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i rang bzhin dang / byang chub kyi sems skye ba'i rang bzhin dang / 'jig rten gyi spyod pa dang mi mthun pa la sogs pa ste mdor bstan no //
translated: The characteristic of essence is that it is the nature of afflictions not arising, the nature of the arising of the mind of enlightenment, and that it is incompatible with worldly conduct, and so on. This is the brief teaching.

original: gzhi shes kyi mtshan nyid bcu drug ni /
analyzed: gzhi shes kyi mtshan nyid bcu drug ni /
translated: The sixteen characteristics of the knowledge of the basis are:🔽The appearance of the Tathagata, the nature of the world not being destroyed, the mental activity of sentient beings, the aspect of inexhaustibility,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // mi zad pa yi rnam pa dang // des bsdus pa dang phyir lta dang // chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // mi zad pa yi rnam pa dang // des bsdus pa dang phyir lta dang // chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang //
translated: the inclusion of those, the outward looking, the attached and so forth, the vast, the state of greatness, the immeasurables,

original: rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems bltar med dang shes pa dang// g-yo ba la sogs zhes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //
analyzed: rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems bltar med dang shes pa dang// g-yo ba la sogs zhes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //
translated: the teaching of consciousness, the unseeable mind, the knowledge, the moving and so forth, and also the others.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa zhes //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa zhes //
translated: These are called the aspects of suchness.

original: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs dang // gzhan bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di //🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skabs kyi //🔽gzhi shes mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs dang // gzhan bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di // thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skabs kyi // gzhi shes mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
translated: The Muni has explained the realization of suchness and the teaching of others.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: This is explained as the characteristic of the knowledge of the basis in the context of omniscience.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni yum 'dis stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa bskyed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni yum 'dis stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa bskyed do //
translated: The appearance of the Tathagata is the generation of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses and so forth by this mother.

original: 'jig rten bstan pa ni yum gyis phung po lnga 'jig rten du bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten bstan pa ni yum gyis phung po lnga 'jig rten du bstan to //
translated: The teaching on the world is that the Mother teaches the five aggregates as the world.

original: 'jig rten 'jig med ni yum phung po lnga ste 'jig dang blang dor la sogs par mi ston /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig med ni yum phung po lnga ste 'jig dang blang dor la sogs par mi ston /
translated: The non-destruction of the world is that the Mother does not teach the five aggregates as destructible or as something to be adopted or rejected.

original: cis na gang la bstan par bya ba'i gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du dmigs su med do //
analyzed: cis na gang la bstan par bya ba'i gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du dmigs su med do //
translated: Why is that? Because from form up to omniscience, there is nothing to be observed as something to be taught.

original: sems can sems kyi spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas yum la brten nas /
analyzed: sems can sems kyi spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas yum la brten nas /
translated: The conduct of the minds of sentient beings is that the Thus-Gone One, based on the Mother,

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du mi dmigs te /
translated: does not observe form up to omniscience.

original: yum nyid kyang mi dmigs na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du lta ci smos /
analyzed: yum nyid kyang mi dmigs na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du lta ci smos /
translated: If even the Mother is not observed, what need is there to speak of observing form up to omniscience?

original: bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yengs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas yum la brten nas chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yengs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas yum la brten nas chos nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: The collected and the distracted is that the Thus-Gone One, based on the Mother, does not observe even the nature of phenomena,

original: bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yengs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yengs pa lta ci smos /
translated: so what need is there to speak of the collected and the distracted?

original: mi zad pa'i rnam pa ni zad pa dang 'gog pa la sogs pa mkhyen to //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i rnam pa ni zad pa dang 'gog pa la sogs pa mkhyen to //
translated: The aspect of inexhaustibility is the knowledge of exhaustion, cessation, and so forth.

original: chags bcas sogs ni sems dang sems las byung ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir dug gsum dang bcas pa mi dmigs so//
analyzed: chags bcas sogs ni sems dang sems las byung ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir dug gsum dang bcas pa mi dmigs so//
translated: The three poisons are not perceived in the mind that is associated with attachment and so on, because the mind and mental factors are not perceived.

original: @244a * // sogs khongs kyi 'bral ba med pa ni phrad pa med pa'i phyir dug gsum dang 'bral ba med pa'o //
analyzed: @244a * // sogs khongs kyi 'bral ba med pa ni phrad pa med pa'i phyir dug gsum dang 'bral ba med pa'o //
translated: The three poisons are not separated from the mind that is associated with attachment and so on, because they are not united.

original: rgya che ni sems de dngos po med pas rgya che chung la sogs pa 'phel 'grib med do //
analyzed: rgya che ni sems de dngos po med pas rgya che chung la sogs pa 'phel 'grib med do //
translated: The mind is not extensive, because it is not substantial.

original: chen por gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa mi gzigs so //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa mi gzigs so //
translated: The mind is not great, because it is devoid of intrinsic reality and is not seen to arise or cease.

original: tshad med pa ni sems kyi rgyud rten med pas tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni sems kyi rgyud rten med pas tshad med pa'o //
translated: The mind is not immeasurable, because the continuum of mind is without support.

original: rnam shes bstan du med pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir sems med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes bstan du med pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir sems med par shes pa'o //
translated: The mind is not taught to be visible, because it is known to be without mind, being empty of its own characteristic.

original: sems bltar med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas kyang sems de snang bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bltar med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan lngas kyang sems de snang bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The mind is not seen, because that mind is not seen by the five eyes of the buddhas.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa shes pa ni 'phro 'du la sogs pa lung ma bstan bcu bzhi la brten pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa shes pa ni 'phro 'du la sogs pa lung ma bstan bcu bzhi la brten pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of movement and so forth is based on the fourteen neutral states of emanation and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa de bzhin nyid kyis rnam par shes pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang 'gyur ba med cing la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa de bzhin nyid kyis rnam par shes pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang 'gyur ba med cing la sogs pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of suchness other than that is the suchness of form up to omniscience, the unmistaken suchness, the unchanging suchness, and so on.

original: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs ni phung po nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'o ;
analyzed: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs ni phung po nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'o ;
translated: The Sage's realization of suchness is the realization of the suchness of the aggregates up to omniscience.

original: /'jig rten ston pa'i le'u ste sum cu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: /'jig rten ston pa'i le'u ste sum cu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-third chapter on the teaching of the world.

original: // / le'u 'di nas lam shes kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid /
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas lam shes kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid /
translated: From this chapter onwards, there are four characteristics of the knowledge of the path: the characteristic of the knowledge of the path, the characteristic of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bzhi'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bzhi'o //
translated: and the special characteristic.

original: lam shes kyi mtshan nyid bcu drug ni /
analyzed: lam shes kyi mtshan nyid bcu drug ni /
translated: The sixteen characteristics of the knowledge of the path are as follows:

original: stong nyid mtshan ma med pa dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang ; / skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid rnam par 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: stong nyid mtshan ma med pa dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang ; / skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid rnam par 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog //
translated: The absence of mental formations, and non-conceptuality,

original: rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la //
analyzed: rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la //
translated: The absence of differentiation, and the absence of characteristics—🔽These are the defining characteristics of the mother.

original: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyi ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyi ni //
translated: In the context of the knowledge of the path,

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
translated: They are explained to be the defining characteristics of knowledge.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lha'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: lha'i bus gsol pa /
translated: The Devaputra said:

original: yum zab mo'i mtshan nyid gang lags zhus pa'i lan yum gyi mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang skye 'gag med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa dang /
analyzed: yum zab mo'i mtshan nyid gang lags zhus pa'i lan yum gyi mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang skye 'gag med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa dang /
translated: The answer to the question about the defining characteristics of the profound mother is that the defining characteristics of the mother are emptiness, the absence of characteristics, the absence of wishes, the absence of mental formations, non-arising, non-ceasing, and so forth, the absence of defilement and purity,

original: dngos po med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang bcu gnyis /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang bcu gnyis /
translated: the absence of entities, the absence of essence, and the absence of the essence of non-entities—these twelve.

original: dpe nam mkha' 'khrug pa med pa ni lha dang lha ma yin gyis mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe nam mkha' 'khrug pa med pa ni lha dang lha ma yin gyis mi 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: The example is the sky, which is undisturbed by gods and demigods.

original: 'du byed pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyis 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyis 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is from form to omniscience, which is unconditioned.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni nam mkha' la mtshan nyid smra ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni nam mkha' la mtshan nyid smra ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Nonconceptuality is the sky, and to speak of characteristics in the sky is not correct.

original: mtshan nyid med pa ni gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes @244b pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ni gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes @244b pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The absence of characteristics is that form is the characteristic of being suitable as form, and so on up to the knowledge of all aspects being the characteristic of direct perception.

original: de yang mtshan nyid med par mngon par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid med par mngon par sangs rgyas so //
translated: That is also fully awakened to as without characteristics.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid bcu drug ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid bcu drug ni /
translated: The sixteen characteristics of the knowledge of all aspects are:

original: de ni nyid kyi chos brten nas //
analyzed: de ni nyid kyi chos brten nas //
translated: It is based on its own dharma.

original: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byed med dang // kun 'jug mkhyen pa gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum dang //🔽bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
analyzed: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byed med dang // kun 'jug mkhyen pa gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum dang // bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
translated: 2. the knowledge of the all-pervading, the teaching of the non-seen, the emptiness of the world, the manifestation of the inexpressible,

original: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
translated: 3. the knowledge of the inconceivable, the teaching of peace, the cessation of the world’s ideas,

original: rnam pa thams cad nyid brten nas //🔽shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad nyid brten nas // shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
translated: 4. the support of all aspects,

original: zhes pa la /🔽yum la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa drin du gzo bas /
analyzed: zhes pa la / yum la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa drin du gzo bas /
translated: is explained as the characteristic of knowledge.

original: gang nas gshegs pa'i lam de nyid nas bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //🔽byed pa ni chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa la brten te /
analyzed: gang nas gshegs pa'i lam de nyid nas bsnyen bkur byed pa'o // byed pa ni chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa la brten te /
translated: The worship of the Mother and the repayment of the Tathagata’s kindness are the worship of the path by which he came.

original: byed pa po med pa'i phyir ma byas pas sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i phyir ma byas pas sangs rgyas so //
translated: The action is the Buddhahood which is not made by anyone, because all dharmas are without characteristics.

original: kun 'jug mkhyen pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'jug mkhyen pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la 'jug pa med pa'i brdas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of engagement is the engagement of the Buddha's wisdom, which is without activity, in all phenomena, symbolized by the absence of engagement.

original: mthong ba po med par ston pa ni chos thams cad gsog gsob snying po med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba po med par ston pa ni chos thams cad gsog gsob snying po med pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the absence of a seer is that all phenomena are empty, hollow, and insubstantial.

original: ma mthong ba ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of nonseeing is the teaching that there is no seeing of form up to omniscience.

original: ci'i phyir de rnams ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa lags /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rnams ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa lags /
translated: Why is it taught because of not seeing those?

original: lan ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe yum gyis de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed cing ston pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe yum gyis de bzhin gshegs pa bskyed cing ston pa'o //
translated: The reply is that when consciousness that observes form up to omniscience does not arise, the mother gives rise to and teaches the Tathagata.

original: 'jig rten du ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du stong zhes bya bar 'jig rten du ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du stong zhes bya bar 'jig rten du ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching in the world is the teaching in the world that form up to omniscience is empty.

original: 'jig rten du phung po lnga stong zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten du phung po lnga stong zhes brjod do //
translated: The five aggregates are said to be empty in the world.

original: 'jig rten na ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du 'jig rten na stong zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du 'jig rten na stong zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: In the world, the Teacher teaches that from form to omniscience is empty.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab par ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab par ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the inconceivable is the teaching that from form to omniscience is inconceivable.

original: dben par ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dben par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dben par ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dben par ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of isolation is the teaching that from form to omniscience is isolated.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong par ston pa ni /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong par ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of emptiness that transcends extremes is

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar mtha' las 'das pa stong pa zhes bya bar ston pa'o //
translated: the teaching that from form to omniscience is emptiness that transcends extremes.

original: ngo bo nyid stong par ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston pa'o //🔽dngos po @245a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong par ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston pa'o // dngos po @245a * //
translated: The teaching of emptiness of essential nature is the teaching that from form to omniscience is emptiness of essential nature.

original: med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong par ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston pa'o /
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong par ston pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya bar ston pa'o /
translated: The teaching of emptiness of the essential nature of non-entity is the teaching that from form to omniscience is emptiness of the essential nature of non-entity.

original: 'jig rten zhi bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhi bar ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of peace in the world is

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi 'jig rten zhi bar zhes bya ba ston to //🔽'jig rten stong pa nyid ni gzugs nas rnam /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi 'jig rten zhi bar zhes bya ba ston to // 'jig rten stong pa nyid ni gzugs nas rnam /
translated: The world from form to omniscience is taught to be peaceful.

original: mkhyen gyi bar stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mkhyen gyi bar stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the world is the emptiness of form up to omniscience.

original: 'du shes 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: 'du shes 'gog pa ni /
translated: The cessation of perception is

original: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol gyi 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol gyi 'du shes med /
translated: the absence of the perception of this world and the next.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid mdor bstan ni /
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid mdor bstan ni /
translated: The brief teaching of the characteristics of distinction is:

original: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyi //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyi //
translated: The distinction is distinguished by the inconceivable and so forth,

original: khyad zhugs bden pa'i spyod yul can //🔽skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis //
analyzed: khyad zhugs bden pa'i spyod yul can // skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis //
translated: having the domain of the truth,🔽and the explanation of the characteristics of distinction is

original: khyad par mtshan nyid bshad pa yin //
analyzed: khyad par mtshan nyid bshad pa yin //
translated: in sixteen moments.

original: zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: The inconceivable appearances of the relative,

original: don dam gyi chos nyid /
analyzed: don dam gyi chos nyid /
translated: the ultimate dharmatā,

original: mkhyen pa'i ye shes /
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i ye shes /
translated: the wisdom of omniscience,

original: sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi thugs rje bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and the inconceivable compassion of the buddhas, and so on.🔽The inconceivable, the unequaled,

original: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang bgrang las yang dag 'das //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang bgrang las yang dag 'das //
translated: the immeasurable, and the uncountable

original: 'phags pa kun sdud mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun sdud mkhas pa yis //
translated: are the domain of the wise who gather the āryas.

original: rig bya thun mong med shes rig / shes myur nyung dang mang med dang // sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang // dmigs pa rten dang bcas pa dang // mtha' dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myong med pa'i khyad par gyis //🔽bcu drug bdag nyid shes par bya //
analyzed: rig bya thun mong med shes rig / shes myur nyung dang mang med dang // sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang // dmigs pa rten dang bcas pa dang // mtha' dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myong med pa'i khyad par gyis // bcu drug bdag nyid shes par bya //
translated: the complete, the embracing,🔽and the distinctive lack of savoring.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: These are to be known as the sixteen aspects.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam pa las 'das pa'o//
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam pa las 'das pa'o//
translated: Of these, the inconceivable is beyond thought.

original: dpag tu med pa ni dpag par mi nus pa'o //🔽gzhal du med pa ni gzhal bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni dpag par mi nus pa'o // gzhal du med pa ni gzhal bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable cannot be measured.🔽The incomparable cannot be compared.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ni mnyam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ni mnyam pa med pa'o //
translated: The unequalled is without equal.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u ste so bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u ste so bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-fourth chapter, on the Unequalled.

original: // /'phags pa kun sdud pa ni yum du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du 'dus te /
analyzed: // /'phags pa kun sdud pa ni yum du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du 'dus te /
translated: The noble perfection of wisdom in eight thousand lines includes the five perfections up to omniscience.

original: de cis na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: de cis na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par chags pa med par nye bar gnas so //
translated: Why is that? Because form up to omniscience is present without being grasped and without being clung to.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽“This mother is present without grasping or clinging to form up to omniscience.”

original: yum 'di gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar 'dzin chags med pa gnas pa lags zhes pa'i lan rab 'byor gyis gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la 'dzin chags mthong ngam zhes pa'i lan gsol pa //
analyzed: yum 'di gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar 'dzin chags med pa gnas pa lags zhes pa'i lan rab 'byor gyis gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la 'dzin chags mthong ngam zhes pa'i lan gsol pa //
translated: The reply to the question, “Subhūti, do you see grasping or clinging to form up to omniscience?”

original: ma mthong lags so //
analyzed: ma mthong lags so //
translated: was, “I do not see it.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: ngas kyang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
analyzed: ngas kyang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang dag par rjes su ma mthong /
translated: “I also do not see form up to omniscience.

original: ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin /
translated: Because I do not see it, I do not grasp it.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin pas nye bar mi len to //
translated: Because I do not grasp it, I do not take it up.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pas kyang yongs su gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa @245b dang chags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pas kyang yongs su gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa @245b dang chags par mi bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas who practice this mother should also not grasp, cling, or be attached.”

original: mkhas pas rig pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: mkhas pas rig pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bus gsol pa /
translated: The gods who live in the desire and form realms said to the wise one,🔽“Subhūti, you have spoken well.

original: yum 'di ltar zab pa 'di ltar phra ba 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba 'di la mos pa ni /
analyzed: yum 'di ltar zab pa 'di ltar phra ba 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba 'di la mos pa ni /
translated: To have interest in this mother of the conquerors, which is so profound, so subtle, so difficult to fathom, is to have the interest of the wise.

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa'o la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa'o la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mother is so profound, so subtle, so difficult to understand, and those who believe in her have served the Victorious Ones in the past.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni stong gsum gyi dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang spobs pa gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa'i gdugs gcig gi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni stong gsum gyi dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang spobs pa gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa'i gdugs gcig gi bzod pa'o //
translated: The uncommon is the knowledge and eloquence of those who follow the faith of the billion-world universe, and that is the acceptance of a bodhisattva in a single day.

original: myur ba ni rigs kyi bu yum la spyod pa ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: myur ba ni rigs kyi bu yum la spyod pa ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgya'o //
translated: The swift is the son of family who practices the mother and quickly becomes a perfect buddha.

original: bri ba dang gang ba med pa ni yum 'di la brten nas 'phags pa thams cad byung ba yang bri ba dang gang ba mi gda'o zhes nas gzhan du 'khod do //
analyzed: bri ba dang gang ba med pa ni yum 'di la brten nas 'phags pa thams cad byung ba yang bri ba dang gang ba mi gda'o zhes nas gzhan du 'khod do //
translated: The absence of decrease and increase is that, based on this mother, all the noble ones appear, but there is no decrease or increase.

original: sgrub pa ni yum 'dri ba la sogs pa'i mos pa byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang dga' ldan gyi gnas dang mi'i nang du sngon yum spyad pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni yum 'dri ba la sogs pa'i mos pa byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang dga' ldan gyi gnas dang mi'i nang du sngon yum spyad pa'o //
translated: The practice is that those who are devoted to writing and so forth about the mother have practiced the mother in the past in other buddhafields, in the Tushita palace, and in the human realm.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa ni sngon gyi mthar phar phyin nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yongs su ma dris brtag pa ma byas pas 'di bstan pa'i tshe nem nur la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa ni sngon gyi mthar phar phyin nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yongs su ma dris brtag pa ma byas pas 'di bstan pa'i tshe nem nur la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The correct establishment is that, at the beginning, without having asked questions about the perfections up to omniscience, one will have doubts and so forth when this is taught.

original: da lta spyod pa'i tshe the tshom du gyur nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la ma bslabs mthun par ma byas pas theg pa dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da lta spyod pa'i tshe the tshom du gyur nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la ma bslabs mthun par ma byas pas theg pa dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of present conduct, having become doubtful, one will not train in the perfections and so forth, and will not act in accordance with them, and so will become of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: 'dus pa'i le'u ste so lnga pa'o /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i le'u ste so lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-fifth chapter on the assembly.

original: // / gru zhig pa'i tshe mi ro la sogs pa la 'jug pa dang ma 'jus pa'i dpes dmigs pa'i khyad par dang / rdza so btang ba dang ma btang bar chu blugs pa'i dpes rten gyi khyad par dang / gru zag lhan ma byas pa dang byas pa'i dpes mtha' dag pa'i khyad par dang /
analyzed: // / gru zhig pa'i tshe mi ro la sogs pa la 'jug pa dang ma 'jus pa'i dpes dmigs pa'i khyad par dang / rdza so btang ba dang ma btang bar chu blugs pa'i dpes rten gyi khyad par dang / gru zag lhan ma byas pa dang byas pa'i dpes mtha' dag pa'i khyad par dang /
translated: The example of a person who, when a boat is wrecked, either does or does not grasp a corpse, and so forth, is the distinction of the object. The example of water poured into a baked or unbaked pot is the distinction of the basis. The example of a boat that is or is not repaired is the distinction of the whole.

original: rgan po la mis brten pa dang ma brten pa'i dpes yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par dang / spyir gyi zhus lan thabs dang shes rab kyis zin na byang chub sems dpa' ma zin na theg pa 'og ma'o //
analyzed: rgan po la mis brten pa dang ma brten pa'i dpes yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par dang / spyir gyi zhus lan thabs dang shes rab kyis zin na byang chub sems dpa' ma zin na theg pa 'og ma'o //
translated: In general, if the questions and answers are embraced by method and wisdom, they are of the bodhisattvas; if not, they are of the lower vehicles.

original: gru'i le'u ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: gru'i le'u ste drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixth chapter on the boat.

original: // / ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: // / ro myang ba med pa'i khyad par ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: The difference in the absence of relishing is as follows. Subhūti said:

original: las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: “How should a beginner bodhisattva train in the six perfections?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied:

original: las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob par 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen brten na des pha rol tu phyin pa rnams byang chub tu sngos shig / gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la rtog par ma byed cing /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la slob par 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen brten na des pha rol tu phyin pa rnams byang chub tu sngos shig / gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la rtog par ma byed cing /
translated: “A beginner bodhisattva who wishes to train in the six perfections should rely on a spiritual friend. He will then be told to dedicate the perfections to enlightenment and not to conceptualize anything from form to omniscience.

original: de cis na yongs su ma brtags pa'i gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do//
analyzed: de cis na yongs su ma brtags pa'i gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do//
translated: Why is this? Because it is the unanalyzed form, etc., up to omniscience that causes the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: @246a * // rigs kyi bu gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig /'dod pa med pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: @246a * // rigs kyi bu gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la 'dod pa ma bskyed cig /'dod pa med pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub po //
translated: Son of noble family, do not develop any desire for form, etc., up to omniscience. The absence of desire is unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The defining characteristics of activity are as follows:🔽Beneficial, blissful, protective,🔽and a refuge for humans,

original: phan dang bde dang skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang // gnas dang dgon dang gling dang ni //
analyzed: phan dang bde dang skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang // gnas dang dgon dang gling dang ni //
translated: a resting place, an island, and

original: yongs 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang ; / lhun gyis grub dang theg gsum ni //
analyzed: yongs 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang ; / lhun gyis grub dang theg gsum ni //
translated: a guide, spontaneous, and the three vehicles

original: tha ma'i rnam pa'i mdzad pa yin //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: tha ma'i rnam pa'i mdzad pa yin // zhes pa la /
translated: are the activities of the final aspect.

original: 'jig rten gyi don gyi byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug sems can gyi sdug bsngal dgrol ba'i phyir ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi don gyi byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug sems can gyi sdug bsngal dgrol ba'i phyir ston pa'o //
translated: With regard to this, the activity for the benefit of the world is the bodhisattva teaching the six perfections in order to liberate sentient beings from suffering.

original: phan pa ni sems can 'gro ba'i rgyud lnga nas bton cing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa ni sems can 'gro ba'i rgyud lnga nas bton cing mi 'jigs pa'i thang bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'o //
translated: Benefit is to establish sentient beings, who are extracted from the five transmigrations, in the bliss of fearlessness, which is nirvana.

original: bde ba ni sems can sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba las bkrol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni sems can sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba las bkrol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'o //
translated: Happiness is to liberate sentient beings from suffering and mental dissatisfaction and to establish them in nirvana.

original: skyob pa ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal bskyab par bya ba'i phyir chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: skyob pa ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal bskyab par bya ba'i phyir chos ston pa'o //
translated: Protection is to teach the Dharma in order to protect sentient beings from suffering.

original: skyabs ni sems can skye rga na 'chi las dgrol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs ni sems can skye rga na 'chi las dgrol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'o //
translated: Refuge is to liberate sentient beings from birth, aging, sickness, and death and to establish them in nirvana.

original: rten gyi chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston te /
analyzed: rten gyi chos thams cad 'dre ba med par chos ston te /
translated: The Dharma of support is to teach the Dharma without mixing all phenomena.

original: gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni 'brel pa med pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dre ba med pa gang yin pa de ni 'brel pa med pa /
translated: The absence of mixing of form is the absence of connection.

original: 'brel med gang yin pa de ni skye 'gag med par chos ston /
analyzed: 'brel med gang yin pa de ni skye 'gag med par chos ston /
translated: The absence of connection is to teach the Dharma as unborn and unceasing.

original: de bzhin du rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro //
translated: The same applies up to omniscience.

original: dpung gnyen ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dpung gnyen ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The protector is the other shore of form up to omniscience, which is not form, etc.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis te zhes pa ni chos zhi ba bzang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis te zhes pa ni chos zhi ba bzang po'o //
translated: The good peace of phenomena is the statement, “There is no conceptualization whatsoever on the other shore of form up to omniscience.”

original: gling ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: gling ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: The island is the severance of the prior and subsequent limits of form up to omniscience.

original: snang ba ni ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs kyi mun pas zil gyis non pa'i sems can rnams la shes rab kyis snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs kyi mun pas zil gyis non pa'i sems can rnams la shes rab kyis snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: The light is the illumination of beings who are overcome by the darkness of the eggshell of ignorance with the light of wisdom.

original: sgron ma ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug byin gyi rlabs bzhi sems can la ston pa'o //
analyzed: sgron ma ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug byin gyi rlabs bzhi sems can la ston pa'o //
translated: The lamp is the teaching of the six perfections and the four blessings to sentient beings.

original: ded dpon ni sems can tshul ma yin pa bzhi la zhugs pa rnams phyin ci log las bzlog nas byang chub la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: ded dpon ni sems can tshul ma yin pa bzhi la zhugs pa rnams phyin ci log las bzlog nas byang chub la 'god pa'o //
translated: The caravan leader is the one who, having turned sentient beings who have entered the four wrong paths away from error, establishes them in enlightenment.

original: yongs su 'dren pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med par chos ston to //
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med par chos ston to //
translated: The one who guides teaches sentient beings the Dharma, saying, “Form and so on, up to and including omniscience, are not produced and do not cease. They are not afflicted and are not purified.”

original: lam ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar nam mkha'i ngang tshul can no zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: lam ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar nam mkha'i ngang tshul can no zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: The one who guides teaches sentient beings the Dharma, saying, “The path and form and so on, up to and including omniscience, are of the character of space.”

original: lhun gyis grub pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi @246b bar gyi stong pa nyid na 'gro ba med pa ste mi 'gro mi 'ong zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi @246b bar gyi stong pa nyid na 'gro ba med pa ste mi 'gro mi 'ong zhes bya bar sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: The one who guides teaches sentient beings the Dharma, saying, “The spontaneous and the empty and form and so on, up to and including omniscience, do not go and do not come.”

original: theg pa gsum gyi byed pa ni byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du chos thams cad ni 'gro 'ong med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi byed pa ni byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du chos thams cad ni 'gro 'ong med pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: The one who guides teaches sentient beings the Dharma, saying, “All phenomena, from the twelve factors of dependent origination up to and including omniscience, are of the character of not going and not coming.

original: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngang tshul de las mi 'da'o //
translated: They do not transcend that character.”

original: ngo bo nyid kyi le'u ste sum cu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi le'u ste sum cu bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the thirty-seventh chapter, on the essence, in this commentary called The Ornament of the Essence, a commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way.

original: // / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: // / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristics of the essence

original: nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po yis //
analyzed: nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po yis //
translated: and the discordant classes and antidotes.🔽Solitude, difficulty, certainty,🔽intentional object, non-apprehension,🔽the prohibition of attachment,🔽and what is called the objective support,

original: dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya dang mi dmigs dang // mngon par zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya ba gang yin dang // mi mthun thogs pa med dang ni //
analyzed: dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya dang mi dmigs dang // mngon par zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya ba gang yin dang // mi mthun thogs pa med dang ni //
translated: the discordant, the unobstructed,🔽and the groundless, the directionless, the birthless,

original: gzhi med 'gro med skye med dang // de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: gzhi med 'gro med skye med dang // de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs pa //
translated: and the non-apprehension of suchness.

original: ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid //🔽mtshan nyid lta bur mtshon pas na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid // mtshan nyid lta bur mtshon pas na //
translated: These are the sixteen natures.🔽They are considered the four characteristics

original: mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin // zhes pa la /
translated: like characteristics.

original: le'u 'di nas ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bcu ston pa las dben pa bzhi ni nyon mongs pas dben pa dang / de'i rtags kyis dben pa dang / tshul dang rnam pas dben pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la mos ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: le'u 'di nas ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bcu ston pa las dben pa bzhi ni nyon mongs pas dben pa dang / de'i rtags kyis dben pa dang / tshul dang rnam pas dben pa ni byang chub sems dpa' la mos ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Here, from this chapter, ten natures are taught. Among them, the four solitudes are: solitude from afflictions, solitude from their signs, solitude from manner and aspect, which is the nature of devotion to the bodhisattva.

original: dka' ba ni sems can gyi don du go cha gen  pa la go cha de ni gzugs dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dka' ba ni sems can gyi don du go cha gen  pa la go cha de ni gzugs dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: That armor is not related to form,

original: gzugs kyang med go cha yang med pas gzugs dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyang med go cha yang med pas gzugs dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: because form does not exist and armor does not exist, so it is not related to form.

original: de bzhin du rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro //
translated: The same goes up to omniscience.

original: nges pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa theg pa 'og mar mi ltung ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa theg pa 'og mar mi ltung ba'o //
translated: Certainty is not falling into the lower vehicles for one who possesses the thought of awakening.

original: ched ni de ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ched ni de ci'i phyir na /
translated: The purpose is for what reason?

original: sems can dang ye shes nyung zad nyi tshe'i don gyi phyir ma yin /
analyzed: sems can dang ye shes nyung zad nyi tshe'i don gyi phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not for the sake of a small, limited number of sentient beings and a small, limited amount of wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ched du'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ched du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of all sentient beings, for the sake of omniscience.

original: mi dmigs pa ni yum sgom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni yum sgom pa'i tshe /
translated: Nonapprehension is when one meditates on the mother,

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du sgom pa rnam par sgom pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du sgom pa rnam par sgom pa'o //
translated: meditating on form up to omniscience is fully meditating.

original: mngon par zhen pa bkag pa ni yum la spyod pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par chags pa med dam zhes yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa bkag pa ni yum la spyod pa'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la mngon par chags pa med dam zhes yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: The prohibition of manifest clinging is to be thoroughly investigated when practicing the Perfection of Wisdom, from the perfections up to the knowledge of all modes, whether there is manifest attachment or not.

original: dmigs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol ba'i bsam pas 'khrul ba la sogs pa la shes pas gzugs la sogs pa la rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol ba'i bsam pas 'khrul ba la sogs pa la shes pas gzugs la sogs pa la rnam par mi rtog pa ste /

original: de cis na gzugs nyid stong ba stong pa nyid gzugs de gnyis kyi de bzhin nyid gcig pa'o //🔽chags pa med pa'i le'u ste sum cu brgyad pa'o /

translated: How is that? Form itself is emptiness, emptiness itself is form. The suchness of those two is one.

original: // / mi mthun pa ni 'dod pa dang @247a * //
analyzed: // / mi mthun pa ni 'dod pa dang @247a * //

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gzugs /

analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med do zhes pa ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa lags so zhes pa'i lan gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dang de bzhin nyid

original: dbyer med pas /

analyzed: rtogs sla rtul pos rtogs dkar bzhed //

analyzed: nges 'byed kyi rjes shes ni / dro ba rnams kyi dmigs pa 'dir //
translated: The subsequent knowledge of the stage of definite differentiation🔽is explained as having ten aspects.🔽It is asserted that all sentient beings

original: de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //
analyzed: de dag nyid la sems mnyam sogs //

analyzed: de cis na sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yongs su ma bzung ngo //
