original: byams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
analyzed: byams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
translated: loving kindness, body and so forth,🔽and not being accompanied by the five obscurations,🔽destroying all latent tendencies,🔽and having mindfulness, alertness,🔽clean clothes and so forth,

original: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang // bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang // lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang // bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang // lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
translated: and not having parasites in the body,

original: gya gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
analyzed: gya gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
translated: and having a mind that is not crooked,🔽taking up the training, being without stinginess and so forth,🔽going together with reality,🔽seeking the hells for the sake of sentient beings,🔽not being led astray by others,

original: len dang ser sna med sogs dang // chos nyid ldan par 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal tshol dang // gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la //
analyzed: len dang ser sna med sogs dang // chos nyid ldan par 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal tshol dang // gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la //
translated: and not being deceived by the demon who shows another path,

original: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i @248b spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i @248b spyod pa ste /
translated: And the conduct pleasing to the buddhas,

original: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis //
analyzed: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis //
translated: These twenty signs🔽On the stages of heat, peak, forbearance,

original: drod dang rtse mo bzod pa dang // chos mchog dag la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo bzod pa dang // chos mchog dag la gnas pa yi //
translated: And the supreme mundane state,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
translated: The bodhisattva is irreversible.

original: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
translated: One should know the characteristics

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: Of the irreversible bodhisattva.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med pa'o //
translated: Here, “turning away from form and so on” means that from form up to omniscience do not exist.

original: de cis na gang la gnas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de cis na gang la gnas par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because they do not have an essence in which one could abide.

original: the tshom zad pa ni phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze'i ngor mi lta /
analyzed: the tshom zad pa ni phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze'i ngor mi lta /
translated: “The exhaustion of doubt” means that one does not look to non-Buddhist ascetics and brahmins,

original: bkra shis dang dge mtshan gyis dag par mi byed /
analyzed: bkra shis dang dge mtshan gyis dag par mi byed /
translated: one does not purify oneself through auspicious rites and good omens,

original: lha gzhan la phyag la sogs pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha gzhan la phyag la sogs pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: and one does not bow down to other gods and so on.

original: mi dal ba zad pa ni mi khom pa'i gnas brgyad bud med dang dgur mi skye'o //
analyzed: mi dal ba zad pa ni mi khom pa'i gnas brgyad bud med dang dgur mi skye'o //
translated: “The exhaustion of nonleisure” means that one is not born as a woman or in any of the eight states lacking leisure.

original: bdag nyid dge ba la gnas shing gzhan dag 'god pa la mi dge ba bcu bdag gis kyang spangs gzhan yang spong du 'dzud /
analyzed: bdag nyid dge ba la gnas shing gzhan dag 'god pa la mi dge ba bcu bdag gis kyang spangs gzhan yang spong du 'dzud /
translated: One has oneself abandoned the ten nonvirtues and one causes others to abandon them.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang mi dge ba la mi 'jug na sad pa na lta ci smos /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang mi dge ba la mi 'jug na sad pa na lta ci smos /
translated: One does not engage in nonvirtue even in dreams, let alone while awake.

original: gzhan gyi rten can sbyin shes ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rten can sbyin shes ni //
translated: The generosity and so on that are based on others

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni gzhan gyi don du bsngo ba'o ;
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis ni gzhan gyi don du bsngo ba'o ;
translated: are dedicated to the benefit of others.

original: / zab mo'i chos la som nyi med pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: / zab mo'i chos la som nyi med pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas the tshom med pa'o //
translated: One is without doubt about the profound Dharma, because one does not see anything from form to omniscience.

original: byams lus sogs ni lus ngag yid gsum gyi las 'jam pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byams lus sogs ni lus ngag yid gsum gyi las 'jam pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One is loving, with a gentle body and so on, because one has gentle physical, verbal and mental actions.

original: sgrib pa lnga dang mi 'grogs pa ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dang rmugs pa dang gnyis rgod pa dang 'gyod pa the tshom dang lnga med pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga dang mi 'grogs pa ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dang rmugs pa dang gnyis rgod pa dang 'gyod pa the tshom dang lnga med pa'o //
translated: One is not accompanied by the five hindrances, because one is free of the five: sensual desire, malice, lethargy and sleep, excitation and regret and doubt.

original: bag la nyal 'joms pa ni rnam pa thams cad du bag la nyal med pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal 'joms pa ni rnam pa thams cad du bag la nyal med pa'o //
translated: The destruction of latent tendencies is the absence of any latent tendencies whatsoever.

original: dran shes bzhin gyis zin pa ni 'gro zhing 'ong yang nor pa'i sems kyis mi 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dran shes bzhin gyis zin pa ni 'gro zhing 'ong yang nor pa'i sems kyis mi 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Being mindful and vigilant means that when you go out or come back, you do not do so with a distracted mind.

original: gos la sogs pa gtsang ma ni gos kyi chags la smad du med pa yin ;
analyzed: gos la sogs pa gtsang ma ni gos kyi chags la smad du med pa yin ;
translated: Clean clothes and so on means that your clothes are not despised as filthy.

original: gtsang zhing dri nga ba med /
analyzed: gtsang zhing dri nga ba med /
translated: You are clean and do not smell bad.

original: nad nyung ba yin no //
analyzed: nad nyung ba yin no //
translated: You have few illnesses.

original: lus la srin bu mi 'byung ba ni mi'i lus la srin bu'i rigs stong phrag brgyad cu za ba yod pa de 'jig rten las 'phags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas de la mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lus la srin bu mi 'byung ba ni mi'i lus la srin bu'i rigs stong phrag brgyad cu za ba yod pa de 'jig rten las 'phags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas de la mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: You do not have parasites in your body means that the eighty-four thousand types of parasites that live in the human body do not appear in you because of your transcendent roots of virtue.

original: gya gyu med pa'i sems ni lus ngag yid gsum drang bas gya gyu med pa yin /
analyzed: gya gyu med pa'i sems ni lus ngag yid gsum drang bas gya gyu med pa yin /
translated: A mind free of deceit means that your body, speech, and mind are straightforward and free of deceit.

original: sbyangs pa'i sdom pa 'dzin pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis lhur len pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i sdom pa 'dzin pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis lhur len pa ma yin gyi /
translated: You take up the vows of asceticism means that you do not pursue the twelve ascetic practices for the sake of gain and honor.

original: byang chub kyi don byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi don byed do //
translated: You work for the sake of enlightenment.

original: ser sna med sogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna med sogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'o //
translated: The absence of stinginess and so on is the absence of the counteragents to the transcendences.

original: chos nyid ldan par 'gro ba ni blo brtan pa yin zab pa yin gus par nyan pa yin /🔽de thams cad shes rab @249a * //
analyzed: chos nyid ldan par 'gro ba ni blo brtan pa yin zab pa yin gus par nyan pa yin / de thams cad shes rab @249a * //
translated: The bodhisattva's steadfastness is his going to the reality of things, his profundity is his listening with respect, and his nonconceptualization is his nonapprehension of the two.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsgrubs shing chos nyid dang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsgrubs shing chos nyid dang sbyor ba'o //
translated: All of these are accomplished by the transcendence of wisdom and are applied to reality.

original: sems can don du dmyal tshol ni /
analyzed: sems can don du dmyal tshol ni /
translated: The bodhisattva's search for hell is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du bdud sdig can gyis sems can dmyal bar byang chub sems dpa' 'ang skyes te sdug bsngal tsha ba rtsub pa mang po bstan nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i drung du bdud sdig can gyis sems can dmyal bar byang chub sems dpa' 'ang skyes te sdug bsngal tsha ba rtsub pa mang po bstan nas /
translated: Mara, the evil one, appears before the bodhisattva as a hell being, manifesting many sharp pains and torments.

original: byang sems phyir mi ldog pa kun kyang 'di ltar gyur gyi zer yang byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: byang sems phyir mi ldog pa kun kyang 'di ltar gyur gyi zer yang byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba'o //
translated: He says, All irreversible bodhisattvas are like this, but the bodhisattva does not abandon the spirit of enlightenment.

original: gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub pa ni bdud sdig can gyis byang chub sems dpa'i drung du sngon khyod kyis pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yongs su sbyang ba byas pa 'di thams cad nor ba yin gyi bshags par gyis shig / khyod
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkri bar mi btub pa ni bdud sdig can gyis byang chub sems dpa'i drung du sngon khyod kyis pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yongs su sbyang ba byas pa 'di thams cad nor ba yin gyi bshags par gyis shig / khyod
translated: Not being led by others means that even though Mara, the Evil One, comes to the Bodhisattva and says, “All this practice of yours, from the perfections to omniscience, is mistaken; you must confess it!

original: kyis thob pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin zhes zer yang the tshom la sogs pa mi za ba'o //
analyzed: kyis thob pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin zhes zer yang the tshom la sogs pa mi za ba'o //
translated: You have attained nothing of the teachings of the Buddha,” still the Bodhisattva does not waver.

original: lam gzhan nye bar ston pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lam gzhan nye bar ston pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Not following another path means that he does not enter the paths of the Disciples, etc., without depending on others, such as the perfections.

original: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa ni byang chub kyi lam la bar du gcod pa'i bdud ngo shes pa'o ;
analyzed: bdud ces bya bar rtogs pa ni byang chub kyi lam la bar du gcod pa'i bdud ngo shes pa'o ;
translated: Recognizing Mara means that he recognizes Mara when he tries to create obstacles to the path of enlightenment.

original: / mthong lam gyi rtags mdor bstan pa ni /
analyzed: / mthong lam gyi rtags mdor bstan pa ni /
translated: The signs of the path of insight are briefly indicated:🔽On the path of insight, there are four moments of acceptance and

original: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi ni //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi ni //
translated: knowledge.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
translated: The Bodhisattva is irreversible🔽from the Great Vehicle.

original: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
translated: Should be understood as the characteristics.

original: rgyas pa ni /
analyzed: rgyas pa ni /
translated: The extensive explanation is:🔽The reversal of the perception of form and so on,

original: gzugs sogs 'du shes ldog pa dang // sems brtan theg pa dman pa la //
analyzed: gzugs sogs 'du shes ldog pa dang // sems brtan theg pa dman pa la //
translated: The stability of mind, the lower vehicle,

original: rnam log bsam gtan la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: rnam log bsam gtan la sogs pa'i //
translated: The reversal of the aspects of concentration and so on,🔽The complete exhaustion of the branches,

original: yan lag yongs su zad pa dang // lus sems yang ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: yan lag yongs su zad pa dang // lus sems yang ba nyid dang ni //
translated: The lightness of body and mind,🔽The skillful conduct of desire,🔽The constant practice of celibacy,

original: 'dod pa spyod pa thabs mkhas dang // rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid dang // 'tsho ba rnam par dag nyid dang / phung sogs par chad byed rnams la //
analyzed: 'dod pa spyod pa thabs mkhas dang // rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid dang // 'tsho ba rnam par dag nyid dang / phung sogs par chad byed rnams la //
translated: The purity of livelihood,🔽The accumulations, powers and so on,

original: tshogs dang dbang sogs bcas pa dang // g-yul 'gyed ser sna la sogs pa //
analyzed: tshogs dang dbang sogs bcas pa dang // g-yul 'gyed ser sna la sogs pa //
translated: The battle, stinginess and so on,

original: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba la //
analyzed: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba la //
translated: The application and subsequent application,🔽The individual cessation of abiding,

original: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
analyzed: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
translated: The non-apprehension of even an atom of phenomena,

original: sa gsum la ni gang gnas pa //
analyzed: sa gsum la ni gang gnas pa //
translated: Whoever abides in the three realms,

original: rang gi la nges pa nyid //
analyzed: rang gi la nges pa nyid //
translated: The certainty of one's own,

original: chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
analyzed: chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
translated: The giving of one's life for the sake of the Dharma,

original: de 'dra skad cig bcu drug ni //
analyzed: de 'dra skad cig bcu drug ni //
translated: Such are the sixteen moments,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
translated: The irreversible bodhisattva,

original: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya // zhes pa la /
translated: should be understood as the characteristics.

original: gzugs sogs 'du shes ldog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi 'du shes log pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sogs 'du shes ldog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi 'du shes log pa'o //
translated: The reversal of the discriminations of form, etc. is the reversal of the discriminations of form up to omniscience.

original: sbyor lam gyi rtags bstan pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu pa'o /
analyzed: sbyor lam gyi rtags bstan pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the forty-first chapter, on the signs of the path of preparation, in this Ornament of Precious Liberation, a Wish-Fulfilling Gem of Sublime Dharma.

original: // / sems brtan pa ni bdud sdig can byang chub @249b sems dpa' la mos pa zlog cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: // / sems brtan pa ni bdud sdig can byang chub @249b sems dpa' la mos pa zlog cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The steadfastness of mind is the bodhisattva's unshakable conviction that the evil Mara is unable to turn him away from omniscience, which is equal to space.

original: dngos po med pa de'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ci zhig bya zhes zer yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med kyang de ma rtogs pa'i sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sems brtan pos spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ci zhig bya zhes zer yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med kyang de ma rtogs pa'i sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sems brtan pos spyod pa'o //
translated: Even if Mara says, All things are essenceless, so what is the point of practicing the perfections for the sake of that non-existent object? the steadfast bodhisattva practices the perfections and so forth for the sake of sentient beings who have not realized that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: theg pa dman pa las log pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa dman pa las log pa ni /
translated: The reversal from the Lesser Vehicle is the bodhisattva's unshakable conviction that he will not attain the nirvana of the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: phyir ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa zhes bgyi /
translated: The bodhisattva who has reversed from the Lesser Vehicle is called irreversible.

original: mi ldog pa la ldog pa zhes bgyi ba ni nyan rang las phyir log pas na phyir ldog pa'o //
analyzed: mi ldog pa la ldog pa zhes bgyi ba ni nyan rang las phyir log pas na phyir ldog pa'o //
translated: The non-returner is so called because he has turned away from the disciples and the self-awakened ones.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag yongs su zad pa ni bsam gtan bzhi tshad med pa bzhi gzugs med pa bzhi ni byang chub kyi phyogs la zhugs pas 'bras bu yongs su mi 'dzin rgyun zhugs la sogs pa mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag yongs su zad pa ni bsam gtan bzhi tshad med pa bzhi gzugs med pa bzhi ni byang chub kyi phyogs la zhugs pas 'bras bu yongs su mi 'dzin rgyun zhugs la sogs pa mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of the branches of the concentrations, etc. is the fact that, by entering into the factors of enlightenment, he does not grasp the fruits of the stream-winner, etc., and does not actualize them.

original: lus sems yang nyid ni gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du lhur len pa ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: lus sems yang nyid ni gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du lhur len pa ma yin zhes so //
translated: The lightness of body and thought is the fact that he does not take pleasure in form up to the Buddhas.

original: 'dod la spyod pa thabs mkhas ni //
analyzed: 'dod la spyod pa thabs mkhas ni //
translated: The skillful use of the sense-desires

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim na gnas kyang thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan la nye bar ston to la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim na gnas kyang thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan la nye bar ston to la sogs pa'o //
translated: is the fact that the Bodhisattva, although living in the household life, through his skill in means manifests the sense-desires in order to develop living beings.

original: rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par tshangs par spyod cing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang yang chags sems med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par tshangs par spyod cing stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang yang chags sems med pa'o //
translated: Always celibate means that he is always celibate, and even if the trichiliocosm were filled with the seven jewels, he would have no attachment.

original: de la chos skyong ni gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje la sogs pa rnams rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: de la chos skyong ni gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje la sogs pa rnams rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: There, the Dharma protectors are yakshas such as Vajrapani who constantly follow him.

original: 'tsho ba rnam par dag nyid ni //
analyzed: 'tsho ba rnam par dag nyid ni //
translated: Purity of livelihood means

original: bud med ze slong ba dang bu tsha pho mo la sogs pa dang tshe ring ba la sogs pa cho 'phrul mi byed do //
analyzed: bud med ze slong ba dang bu tsha pho mo la sogs pa dang tshe ring ba la sogs pa cho 'phrul mi byed do //
translated: he does not perform miracles such as having a son or daughter, or living a long life, in order to obtain food and so on.

original: phung sogs par chad byed rnams kyi sbyor ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: phung sogs par chad byed rnams kyi sbyor ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The bodhisattva does not engage in the preparation for the aggregates and so on,

original: phung po khams kyi sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba mi byed de //
analyzed: phung po khams kyi sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba mi byed de //
translated: nor does he engage in the subsequent practice of the aggregates and elements.

original: des ni phung po la sogs pa stong par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni phung po la sogs pa stong par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he realizes the aggregates and so on as empty.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi byed de /
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi byed de /
translated: He does not engage in the activities of stories about kings, etc.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas bzang ba dang ngan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthon ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas bzang ba dang ngan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthon ngo //
translated: Because he abides in the emptiness of intrinsic nature, he does not see good or bad.

original: rkun po'i sbyor ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pas blang ba'am dbrog pa med do //
analyzed: rkun po'i sbyor ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pas blang ba'am dbrog pa med do //
translated: As for the activity of thieves, since they are empty of their own characteristics, there is nothing to take or steal.

original: dmag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba ni chos nyid la byams sdang med do //
analyzed: dmag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba ni chos nyid la byams sdang med do //
translated: As for the activity of stories about armies, in reality there is no love or hate.

original: grong gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas te yang dag pa'i mtha' yin pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med do //🔽ser @250a * //
analyzed: grong gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas te yang dag pa'i mtha' yin pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med do // ser @250a * //
translated: He does not abide in the activity of stories about towns, because they are the limit of reality, without increase or decrease.

original: sna med sogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bar du ma mchis par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: byang chub ji lta de bzhin du //

analyzed: rmi lam na'ang 'phel lo //

analyzed: ngas ni gang gis lan ldon pa dang klan pa ma mthong ngo //

analyzed: sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //

analyzed: de la dag par bya ba'i phyir //

analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid //

translated: This is the forty-fourth chapter, on the Goddess of the Ganges.

original: // / sems can gyi don du thabs la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: // / sems can gyi don du thabs la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in means for the sake of sentient beings.🔽Its object, application,

original: 'di yi yul dang sbyor ba dang // dgra rnams las ni 'das pa dang // mi gnas ji bzhin shugs dang ni //
analyzed: 'di yi yul dang sbyor ba dang // dgra rnams las ni 'das pa dang // mi gnas ji bzhin shugs dang ni //
translated: overcoming of adversaries, nonabiding, as it is, and power,🔽uncommon characteristics, nonattachment, nonapprehending,🔽extinction of signs and vows,🔽its marks, the immeasurables, and skill in means

original: thun mong ma yin mtshan nyid dang // ma chags pa dang mi dmigs dang // mtshan ma smon lam zad pa dang // de yi rtags dang tshad med dang // thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin mtshan nyid dang // ma chags pa dang mi dmigs dang // mtshan ma smon lam zad pa dang // de yi rtags dang tshad med dang // thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu // zhes pa la /
translated: are the ten aspects.

original: yul dang sbyor ba'i thabs la mkhas pa ni stong pa nyid la 'dris par bya'i mngon du ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: yul dang sbyor ba'i thabs la mkhas pa ni stong pa nyid la 'dris par bya'i mngon du ni mi bya'o //
translated: Skill in means for the object and application is as follows. One should be familiar with emptiness but not actualize it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar ro //
translated: up to the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: gzugs la sogs pa stong par shes par bya ba'i dus yin gyi mngon du bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa stong par shes par bya ba'i dus yin gyi mngon du bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the time to understand that form and so on are empty, but it is not the time to actualize it.

original: dgra rnams las 'das pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni skyes bu dpa' ba zhig gis 'brog dgon par gnyen 'dun mang po khid  de dgra'i tshogs pas kyang dpa' ba mang po sprul nas bde bar khyim du 'ong ba'i dpes sems can rnams 'khor ba las sgrol lo
analyzed: dgra rnams las 'das pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni skyes bu dpa' ba zhig gis 'brog dgon par gnyen 'dun mang po khid  de dgra'i tshogs pas kyang dpa' ba mang po sprul nas bde bar khyim du 'ong ba'i dpes sems can rnams 'khor ba las sgrol lo
translated: Skill in the means of transcending enemies is like the example of a hero who leads a large group of relatives through a wilderness and a multitude of enemies who emanate many heroes and come home safely.

original: // gnas pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i dpes ni bya nam mkha' la 'phur nas der yang mi gnas sa la yang mi ltung ba'i dpes /
analyzed: // gnas pa med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i dpes ni bya nam mkha' la 'phur nas der yang mi gnas sa la yang mi ltung ba'i dpes /
translated: The example of skill in the means of non-abiding is like the example of a bird flying in the sky, not abiding there and not falling to the ground.

original: mtshan ma la yang mi spyod mtshan ma med pa mngon du yang mi byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma la yang mi spyod mtshan ma med pa mngon du yang mi byed do //
translated: One does not engage in signs and does not manifest signlessness.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shugs 'phel ba'i dpe mda' brgyud mar long btags pas sa la ltung ba'i skabs mi 'byed pa'i dpes tshogs ma rdzogs par stong nyid dam pa thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shugs 'phel ba'i dpe mda' brgyud mar long btags pas sa la ltung ba'i skabs mi 'byed pa'i dpes tshogs ma rdzogs par stong nyid dam pa thob par mi byed do //
translated: The example of the increase of the power of the roots of virtue is like the example of an arrow shot with a bowstring, which does not have the opportunity to fall to the ground.

original: thun mong ma yin par thabs la mkhas pa ni snying rjes sems can gyi don byed pa la skyo du ba med par sems can 'di dag ni byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis la 'du shes can te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin par thabs la mkhas pa ni snying rjes sems can gyi don byed pa la skyo du ba med par sems can 'di dag ni byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis la 'du shes can te /
translated: The uncommon skill in means is that, through compassion, one acts for the sake of sentient beings without becoming weary.

original: de spang ba'i phyir rnam thar sgo gsum ston pa'o //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir rnam thar sgo gsum ston pa'o //
translated: In order to abandon that, one teaches the three doors of liberation.

original: ma chags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas phyin ci log bzhi la spyod pas de spang ba'i phyir rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
analyzed: ma chags pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas phyin ci log bzhi la spyod pas de spang ba'i phyir rnam thar sgo gsum mo //
translated: The skill in means of nonattachment is that, since these sentient beings have engaged in the four errors for a long time, in order to abandon that, one teaches the three doors of liberation.

original: mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dmigs pa'i nyes pa de dag med par bya'o snyam ste chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni gzugs nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar dmigs pa'i nyes pa de dag med par bya'o snyam ste chos ston pa'o //
translated: The skill in means of nonapprehending is that, thinking, “I will eliminate the faults of apprehending form up to the distinct attributes of a buddha,” one teaches the dharma.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas mtshan ma la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas mtshan ma la spyod pa ste /
translated: The skill in means of signlessness is that, since these sentient beings have engaged in signs for a long time, in order to abandon that, one teaches the three doors of liberation.

original: bud med dang skyes pa dang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi mtshan ma la spyod pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi mtshan ma la spyod pa spong ba'o //
translated: It is the rejection of the practice of the signs of women, men, forms, etc. to omniscience.

original: smon pa med pa'i @252a * //🔽thabs la mkhas pa ni sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas smon lam la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i @252a * // thabs la mkhas pa ni sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas smon lam la spyod pa ste /
translated: Skill in the wishless

original: brgya byin la mngon par dga' ba gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mngon par dga' ba'i smon lam gyi nyes pa spang ba'i phyir smon pa med pa'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin la mngon par dga' ba gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mngon par dga' ba'i smon lam gyi nyes pa spang ba'i phyir smon pa med pa'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: is the teaching of the wishless Dharma in order to abandon the fault of the wish for the long-term practice of aspirations by these sentient beings, who are delighted with Sakra, etc. up to delighted with forms, etc. to omniscience.🔽Skill in the immeasurable

original: tshad med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni snying rje'i dbang gis ji skad du dris pa'i lan ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni snying rje'i dbang gis ji skad du dris pa'i lan ston pa'o //
translated: is the teaching of the reply to the question through the power of compassion.

original: rnam thar sgo gsum gyi thabs la mkhas pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu lnga pa'o /
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum gyi thabs la mkhas pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the forty-fifth chapter, on the skill in the three doors of liberation.

original: // / sbyor lam gyi rtse mo la bzhi las rtags dang rnam par 'phel ba la sogs pa bzhis ston /
analyzed: // / sbyor lam gyi rtse mo la bzhi las rtags dang rnam par 'phel ba la sogs pa bzhis ston /
translated: The peak of the path of preparation is taught by four topics, such as the signs and the increase of aspects, etc.🔽The signs are:

original: rtags ni / rmi lam na yang tshes rnams kun //
analyzed: rtags ni / rmi lam na yang tshes rnams kun //
translated: In dreams, all signs

original: rmi lam lta bur lta la sogs //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bur lta la sogs //
translated: are seen as like dreams, etc.

original: rtse mor phyin pa'i sbyor ba'i rtags //
analyzed: rtse mor phyin pa'i sbyor ba'i rtags //
translated: The signs of the yoga of having reached the peak

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu bzhed //🔽ces pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu bzhed // ces pa la /
translated: are considered to be of twelve kinds.

original: rmi lam lta bur mthong ba'i rtags ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na chos thams cad rmi lam nas /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bur mthong ba'i rtags ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na chos thams cad rmi lam nas /
translated: The signs of seeing things as being like a dream are that in the state of dreaming one sees all phenomena as being like a dream

original: sprul pa'i bar lta bur mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i bar lta bur mthong ba'o //
translated: up to being like a magical creation.

original: 'dod bzad pa'i rtags ni khams gsum dang nyan rang gi byang chub rmi lam na yang mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod bzad pa'i rtags ni khams gsum dang nyan rang gi byang chub rmi lam na yang mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The sign of the exhaustion of desire is that one does not desire the three realms or the enlightenment of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas even in a dream.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ni sangs rgyas 'khor mang pos bskor ba mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ni sangs rgyas 'khor mang pos bskor ba mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing a tathāgata is seeing a buddha surrounded by a great retinue.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul mthong ba ni nam mkha' la 'phags shing sprul pa 'gyed pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul mthong ba ni nam mkha' la 'phags shing sprul pa 'gyed pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing the magical power of a tathāgata is seeing him fly up into the sky and emanate magical creations.

original: chos ston pa mthong ba ni grong la sogs pa bcom pa mthong nas rmi lam mam sad pa na'ang chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur bstan snyam pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston pa mthong ba ni grong la sogs pa bcom pa mthong nas rmi lam mam sad pa na'ang chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur bstan snyam pa'o //
translated: Seeing the teaching of the dharma is seeing a town and so on being destroyed and thinking that all phenomena are like a dream, whether in a dream or when one has awakened.

original: snying rje phun sum tshogs pa ni rmi lam mam sad pa na ngan song gsum mthong na de lta bu'i ming yang med par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje phun sum tshogs pa ni rmi lam mam sad pa na ngan song gsum mthong na de lta bu'i ming yang med par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa'o //
translated: The sign of the perfection of compassion is that when one sees the three lower realms in a dream or in the waking state, one strives to eliminate them.

original: bden pa'i tshig grub pa ni grong khyer tshig pa mthong na de la bden pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig grub pa ni grong khyer tshig pa mthong na de la bden pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The sign of the perfection of truth is that when one sees a burning house, one speaks the truth.

original: mthu phun sum tshogs pa'i rtags ni skyes pa dang bud med mi ma yin pas zin pa mthong na bden pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mthu phun sum tshogs pa'i rtags ni skyes pa dang bud med mi ma yin pas zin pa mthong na bden pa brjod pa'o //
translated: The sign of the perfection of power is that when one sees a man or woman possessed by a nonhuman spirit, one speaks the truth.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i rtags la gsum las /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i rtags la gsum las /
translated: There are three signs of the absence of pride.

original: yon tan gyi gzhi las byung ba dang / ming gi gzhi las byung ba dang / dben pa'i gzhi las byung ba'i bdud kyi phye 'thor las nga rgyal mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi gzhi las byung ba dang / ming gi gzhi las byung ba dang / dben pa'i gzhi las byung ba'i bdud kyi phye 'thor las nga rgyal mi skye ba'o //
translated: One does not give rise to pride from the basis of qualities, from the basis of names, or from the basis of solitude.

original: pha rol gnon pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni ston pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gnon pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni ston pa'o //
translated: The spiritual teacher who is a conqueror of the enemy is the Lord Buddha; the six perfections up to the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha are the teaching.

original: sgron ma blo shes pa shes rab bo //
analyzed: sgron ma blo shes pa shes rab bo //
translated: The lamp is the mind; the light is wisdom.

original: des bstan pa'i shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i rtags ni shes @252b rab pha rol phyin pa la mtshan nyid med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'o //🔽rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'i rtags ni bdag tu 'dzin pas 'khor zhing 'khyams pas bdag med pa ni rnam par byang ba de rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'o //
analyzed: des bstan pa'i shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i rtags ni shes @252b rab pha rol phyin pa la mtshan nyid med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad la spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'o // rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'i rtags ni bdag tu 'dzin pas 'khor zhing 'khyams pas bdag med pa ni rnam par byang ba de rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'o //
translated: The sign of the perfection of wisdom taught by that is that just as the perfection of wisdom is without a characteristic, so all dharmas are without a general or specific characteristic.

original: rnam par 'phel ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba ni /
translated: The sign of being close to perfect enlightenment is that since one wanders in cyclic existence through the apprehension of a self, the absence of a self is purification, and that is close to perfect enlightenment.🔽The increase of the wholesome root is shown in the next verse.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo snyed //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo snyed //
translated: As many beings as there are in Jambudvipa,

original: sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge ba sogs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge ba sogs //
translated: the wholesome root of worshipping the Buddha and so on,🔽having taken that as an example,

original: dper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //
analyzed: dper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //
translated: multiplied a hundred times,

original: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do //🔽zhes pas 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo la sogs pa mchod pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba ni stong gsum gyi sems can ji snyed pa thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te /🔽sangs rgyas pa de dag la rim gro byas pa dang / de dag dge ba bcu nas dgra bcom pa'i bar la bkod pa bas /
analyzed: rnam 'phel bcu drug bdag nyid do // zhes pas 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo la sogs pa mchod pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba ni stong gsum gyi sems can ji snyed pa thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te / sangs rgyas pa de dag la rim gro byas pa dang / de dag dge ba bcu nas dgra bcom pa'i bar la bkod pa bas /
translated: The increase is sixteenfold.🔽By worshipping the beings of Jambudvipa, etc., the roots of virtue increase.

original: rigs kyi bus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa la sogs pa byas na bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bus shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa la sogs pa byas na bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The merit of the Bodhisattva who teaches the perfection of wisdom to others is greater than the merit of the person who establishes all the beings of the three-thousand-fold world systems in the ten ways of wholesome action, etc., up to the state of a worthy one.

original: de cis na thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur /
analyzed: de cis na thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur /
translated: Why is that? Because all of them become worthy of gifts.

original: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms don yod par za ba'o //
analyzed: yul 'khor gyi bsod snyoms don yod par za ba'o //
translated: They eat the alms of the country without it being in vain.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa ni nor bu rin po che rnyed nas bor na sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur pa'i dpes yum yid la byed pa mi dor ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa ni nor bu rin po che rnyed nas bor na sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur pa'i dpes yum yid la byed pa mi dor ba'o //
translated: The example of the precious gem that is found and then lost and becomes the cause of suffering shows that one should not give up the practice of the Mother.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: The acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas is as follows: Subhūti said,

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
translated: “Do you practice the perfection of wisdom in forms up to omniscience?

original: de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
analyzed: de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice the perfection of wisdom in the suchness of those?

original: de ma yin pa gzhan zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
translated: Do you practice the perfection of wisdom in something other than those?

original: bka' stsal ba de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bka' stsal ba de ni ma yin no //
translated: The Buddha replied, “No, that is not so.”

original: rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gang spyod pa dang gang gis spyod pa de mthong snyam na /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gang spyod pa dang gang gis spyod pa de mthong snyam na /
translated: Subhūti thought, “If I do not see the perfection of wisdom, the one who practices, and what it is that they practice,

original: gsol ba / ma mthong lags so //
analyzed: gsol ba / ma mthong lags so //
translated: he said, “I do not see them.”

original: ma mthong ba de nyid mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba de nyid mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'o //
translated: That very non-seeing is the attainment of the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: byang chub par byed pa dang / byang chub par byed pa dang / byang chub par bya ba mi dmigs pa mi gang gis byang chub par bya ba la sogs pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub par byed pa dang / byang chub par byed pa dang / byang chub par bya ba mi dmigs pa mi gang gis byang chub par bya ba la sogs pa yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The one who does not apprehend the one who awakens, awakening, and what is to be awakened is the one who does not see the one who awakens, and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i le'u ste zhe drug pa'o /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i le'u ste zhe drug pa'o /
translated: The benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī are explained in two parts:🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.🔽The Benefits of Upholding the Dhāraṇī in General🔽The first part is explained in two ways:🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.

original: // / dge ba bcu la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i stong gsum gyi sems can rnams dge ba bcu tshad med pa bzhi /
analyzed: // / dge ba bcu la sogs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i stong gsum gyi sems can rnams dge ba bcu tshad med pa bzhi /
translated: The Benefits of Upholding the Dhāraṇī in General🔽The first part is explained in two ways:🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.🔽The Benefits of Upholding the Dhāraṇī in General🔽The first part is explained in two ways:

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la bkod pa bas /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la bkod pa bas /
translated: the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.🔽The Benefits of Upholding the Dhāraṇī in General🔽The first part is explained in two ways:🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.

original: rigs kyi bu yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The Benefits of Upholding the Dhāraṇī in General🔽The first part is explained in two ways:🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.

original: @253a * // lha'i rigs thams cad 'ong ba ni rigs kyi bu yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i drung du lha'i bu rnams nye bar 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: @253a * // lha'i rigs thams cad 'ong ba ni rigs kyi bu yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i drung du lha'i bu rnams nye bar 'ong ba'o //
translated: The Benefits of Upholding the Dhāraṇī in General🔽The first part is explained in two ways:

original: bdud kyi bar chad yong ba'i gang zag bcu gnyis ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi bar chad yong ba'i gang zag bcu gnyis ni /
translated: the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.🔽The Benefits of Upholding the Dhāraṇī in General🔽The first part is explained in two ways:🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.

original: ma mos pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / dge bshes dang bral ba dang / yum ma yin pa la slob pa dang / yum ma yin pa la bsngags pa dang / zab mo'i gting mi rtogs zer ba dang / rang la bstod pa dang /
analyzed: ma mos pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / dge bshes dang bral ba dang / yum ma yin pa la slob pa dang / yum ma yin pa la bsngags pa dang / zab mo'i gting mi rtogs zer ba dang / rang la bstod pa dang /
translated: The Benefits of Upholding the Dhāraṇī in General🔽The first part is explained in two ways:🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in general and🔽the benefits of upholding the dhāraṇī in particular.

original: gzhan la brnyas pa dang / ming rus kyis dregs pa dang / nyan thos brnyes pa dang / mgo 'gre ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' nang rtsod pa dang / zhing khyad par can la rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la brnyas pa dang / ming rus kyis dregs pa dang / nyan thos brnyes pa dang / mgo 'gre ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' nang rtsod pa dang / zhing khyad par can la rtsod pa'o //
translated: Despising others, being proud of one's name and clan, despising the Sravakas, being quarrelsome, and being quarrelsome among the Bodhisattvas, and about the special fields.

original: mthu bcom pa ni rigs kyi bu yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa la bdud zug rngu langs nas bar chod byas kyang mi tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: mthu bcom pa ni rigs kyi bu yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa la bdud zug rngu langs nas bar chod byas kyang mi tshugs pa'o //
translated: As for the destruction of power, Mara is pained by the sons of the Victorious One who uphold the Mother Scripture, and so on, and tries to create obstacles for them, but he cannot.

original: ston pa dang mtshungs pa ni rigs kyi bu yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa la ni ston pa dang mtshungs par lta ste gru gcig tu zhugs pa /🔽bslab pa mnyam pa'o //🔽spyod pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: ston pa dang mtshungs pa ni rigs kyi bu yum 'dzin pa la sogs pa la ni ston pa dang mtshungs par lta ste gru gcig tu zhugs pa / bslab pa mnyam pa'o // spyod pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: As for being like the Teacher, the sons of the Victorious One who uphold the Mother Scripture, and so on, are seen as being like the Teacher, as if they were on the same boat.

original: // / bslab pa mnyam pa ni stong pa bco brgyad gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar stong pa'o //
analyzed: // / bslab pa mnyam pa ni stong pa bco brgyad gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar stong pa'o //
translated: The equality of training is the eighteen kinds of emptiness, from the emptiness of form up to the emptiness of omniscience.

original: de la rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhuti said, Kausika, if a Bodhisattva who has newly set out in the vehicle sees and hears this, he will doubt and be fearful and will not be able to believe in it.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar zad pa dang mi skye ba dang stong pa dang rang bzhin med par slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du slob pa lags sam zhes pa'i lan zad pa dang mi skye ba dang dben pa dang ngo bo nyid med
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar zad pa dang mi skye ba dang stong pa dang rang bzhin med par slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du slob pa lags sam zhes pa'i lan zad pa dang mi skye ba dang dben pa dang ngo bo nyid med
translated: If one trains in the extinction, nonarising, emptiness, and naturelessness of form up to omniscience, is one training in the knowledge of all aspects?🔽The answer is, “If one trains in extinction, nonarising, isolation, and naturelessness, is one training in the Mother?

original: pa la slob na yum la slob pa lags sam zer ba de khyod kyis gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid la zad pa dang mi skye ba dang stong pa dang rang bzhin med pa dang dben pa'i rang bzhin mthong ngam dris pas ma mthong
analyzed: pa la slob na yum la slob pa lags sam zer ba de khyod kyis gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid la zad pa dang mi skye ba dang stong pa dang rang bzhin med pa dang dben pa'i rang bzhin mthong ngam dris pas ma mthong
translated: ” “Have you seen the suchness of form up to omniscience as having the nature of extinction, nonarising, emptiness, naturelessness, and isolation?”🔽“No, I have not.”

original: lags so // sangs rgyas kyi rigs can du 'gyur ba ni de ltar slob pa de pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
analyzed: lags so // sangs rgyas kyi rigs can du 'gyur ba ni de ltar slob pa de pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
translated: Those who have the buddha lineage train in the perfection of wisdom in that way, training in the perfections up to omniscience by way of nonapprehending.

original: sangs rgyas thob pa'i rgyu mtshan ni mkhar gyi rgyal po bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i las bsags pa nyung ba'i dpes yum la slob pa dka'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thob pa'i rgyu mtshan ni mkhar gyi rgyal po bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i las bsags pa nyung ba'i dpes yum la slob pa dka'o //
translated: The reason for attaining buddhahood is that it is difficult to train in the Mother, as illustrated by the example of the king of a fort accumulating less karma than a universal monarch.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i sems mi skye ba ni de ltar spyod pa la ni ser sna la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi mthun pa'i sems mi skye ba ni de ltar spyod pa la ni ser sna la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The mind that is incompatible with the perfections does not arise, because when one practices in that way, stinginess and so forth do not occur.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa ni yum la spyod pa de gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa ni yum la spyod pa de gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: Not grasping form and so forth means that one who practices the Mother does not fully grasp from form up to omniscience.

original: dge ba thams cad sdud pa ni 'jig tshogs kyi lta bar lta ba thams cad 'dus pas rjes 'gro dang / srog gi dbang po @253b 'gags na dbang po gzhan 'gags pas ldog pa'i dpes yum du dge ba thams cad 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba thams cad sdud pa ni 'jig tshogs kyi lta bar lta ba thams cad 'dus pas rjes 'gro dang / srog gi dbang po @253b 'gags na dbang po gzhan 'gags pas ldog pa'i dpes yum du dge ba thams cad 'dus pa'o //
translated: Gathering all virtue means that all virtue is included in the Mother, as illustrated by the example of the cessation of other faculties when the life faculty ceases, because all views are included in the view of the transitory collection.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thob pa ni yum yod na dge ba thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thob pa ni yum yod na dge ba thams cad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Attaining perfection means that when the Mother exists, all virtue is perfected.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rang la rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang rang la rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'o //
translated: It is close to perfect enlightenment, because it is close to the enlightenment of the disciples and hermit buddhas and to perfect enlightenment.

original: bslab pa mnyam pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: bslab pa mnyam pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the equality of training, the thirty-eighth chapter of the Dharma teaching of “The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.”

original: // / nges pa ni /
analyzed: // / nges pa ni /
translated: The certainty

original: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //
analyzed: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //
translated: of not abandoning the welfare of sentient beings,

original: kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyis //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyis //
translated: of the three knowledges, and of the qualities,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //
translated: is the unsurpassable perfection.

original: nges pa zhes ni rab tu brjod //🔽ces pa ni brgya byin 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: nges pa zhes ni rab tu brjod // ces pa ni brgya byin 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: This is the certainty.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar thob pas kyang dag pa gzhan zil gyis gnon na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar thob pas kyang dag pa gzhan zil gyis gnon na /
translated: Śakra thought, “If, by attaining the perfections up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, one surpasses all other pure beings,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub lta ci smos /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to speak of unsurpassable enlightenment?

original: sems can gang bla na med pa'i byang chub la mos shing dmigs pa las /
analyzed: sems can gang bla na med pa'i byang chub la mos shing dmigs pa las /
translated: Any sentient being who aspires to and focuses on unsurpassable enlightenment

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos rang 'byung gi chos zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / sems kun du gnas pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos rang 'byung gi chos zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / sems kun du gnas pa ni /
translated: May the qualities of the Buddha, the qualities of omniscience, the qualities of self-arising, the uncontaminated qualities, be perfected.🔽The mind that abides is like an analogy for the four continents, a thousand,

original: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper byas nas //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper byas nas //
translated: two or three thousand.

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
translated: By the many merits

original: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrag pa yin //
analyzed: ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrag pa yin //
translated: the samadhi is proclaimed.

original: zhes pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa dang / spyod pa yun ring po sbyangs pa'i sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba ni tshad gzung bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa dang / spyod pa yun ring po sbyangs pa'i sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba ni tshad gzung bar mi nus kyi /
translated: The rejoicing in the first generation of the mind and the training in the conduct for a long time cannot be measured,

original: stong gsum gyi rdul phra rab de rnams kyi rgya mtsho chen po rnams skra'i nyag ma re res blangs nas tshad gzung bar yang mi nus so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi rdul phra rab de rnams kyi rgya mtsho chen po rnams skra'i nyag ma re res blangs nas tshad gzung bar yang mi nus so //
translated: but the great oceans of the atoms in the billion worlds cannot be measured by each strand of hair.

original: gzung rtog gi mdor bstan ni /
analyzed: gzung rtog gi mdor bstan ni /
translated: The summary of the conceptualization of the apprehended:

original: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa dang // gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor de //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa dang // gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor de //
translated: The conceptualization of engagement and reversal, and the individual conceptualization of the apprehended.

original: dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul //
analyzed: dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul //
translated: The nature of the nine is said to be

analyzed: min pa'i bdag nyid dag ces bya // zhes pa la /
translated: the nature of the non-existent object.

original: 'jug ldog gi rnam rtog gi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug ldog gi rnam rtog gi dbye ba'o //

analyzed: yul ji lta ba ma yin pa ni phyin ci log ste /

original: rnam rtog gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of the concepts.
