analyzed: 'dzan rtog mdor bstan pa ni / sems can rdzas dang btags yod pa //
translated: The brief explanation of the concepts of grasping:🔽The concepts of sentient beings are asserted to be

original: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: the grasping of substantial and imputed existence.

original: so so'i skye bo 'phags dbye bas //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'phags dbye bas //
translated: The division of ordinary beings and āryas

original: so sor de dag dgu bdag nyid //
analyzed: so sor de dag dgu bdag nyid //
translated: is each of them having a nature of nine.

original: gal te gzung don de bzhin med //🔽de dag gang gis 'dzin par 'dod //
analyzed: gal te gzung don de bzhin med // de dag gang gis 'dzin par 'dod //
translated: If the object of apprehension does not exist in that way,

original: ces pa la /
analyzed: ces pa la /
translated: by what are they asserted to be apprehended?

original: so so'i skye bo'i rnam rtog rdzas su 'dod pa dang / 'phags pa'i rnam rtog btags pa gnyis ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i rnam rtog rdzas su 'dod pa dang / 'phags pa'i rnam rtog btags pa gnyis ni dbye ba'o //
translated: The division of the concepts of ordinary beings asserted to be substantial and the concepts of āryas asserted to be imputed.

original: gzung ba med par 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gzung ba med par 'dzin pa ni //
translated: The apprehension of the non-existent object

original: phyin ci log ste rnam rtog go //
analyzed: phyin ci log ste rnam rtog go //
translated: is the error, the concept.

original: @254a * // de re re la'ang dgu dgu'o //
analyzed: @254a * // de re re la'ang dgu dgu'o //
translated: Each of them has nine.

original: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rnam rtog rgyas bshad ni //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rnam rtog rgyas bshad ni //
translated: The extensive explanation of the concepts of engagement:

original: ngo bo nyid dang rigs dang ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rigs dang ni //
translated: Nature, lineage,🔽Correct achievement of the path,🔽Nonerroneous object of knowledge,🔽Adverse factors and antidotes,

original: lam ni yang dag 'grub pa dang // shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang // de yi las byas 'bras bu la //🔽'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //
analyzed: lam ni yang dag 'grub pa dang // shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang // de yi las byas 'bras bu la // 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //
translated: Realization by oneself, function,🔽And activity of the result of that.

original: rnam rtog der ni rnam dgur 'dod //
analyzed: rnam rtog der ni rnam dgur 'dod //
translated: The conceptualization of engagement is ninefold.

original: ces pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam rtog ni rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: ces pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam rtog ni rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Conceptualization of nature is as stated by Subhuti:🔽How can an illusion-like mind become enlightened?

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i sems ji ltar 'tshang rgya lags kyi lan khyod kyis sgyu ma dang sgyu ma lta bu'i sems dang / de las gzhan pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i sems ji ltar 'tshang rgya lags kyi lan khyod kyis sgyu ma dang sgyu ma lta bu'i sems dang / de las gzhan pa yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
translated: Do you see illusion, an illusion-like mind, and anything other than that as real?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ma mthong lags /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ma mthong lags /
translated: Subhuti replied, I do not see.

original: de cis na kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam byang gi chos thams cad med cing mi dmigs pas sangs rgya ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: de cis na kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam byang gi chos thams cad med cing mi dmigs pas sangs rgya ba ma mchis so //
translated: Why? Because all phenomena of affliction and purification do not exist and are not observed, there is no enlightenment.

original: de cis na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni shin tu dben pa'o //
analyzed: de cis na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni shin tu dben pa'o //
translated: Why is that? Because from form up to omniscience is utterly void.

original: rigs la rnam par rtog pa ni nam mkha' dang sprul pa dang gzugs brnyan dang 'khrul 'khor la nye ring med pa'i dpes byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa ni nyan rang dang ring la /
analyzed: rigs la rnam par rtog pa ni nam mkha' dang sprul pa dang gzugs brnyan dang 'khrul 'khor la nye ring med pa'i dpes byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa ni nyan rang dang ring la /
translated: The conception of the family is that the bodhisattva’s conduct in the mother is not distant from the listeners and solitary realizers, and

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: he does not think that he is close to perfect enlightenment.

original: de cis na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du rnam par mi rtog pas so //
analyzed: de cis na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du rnam par mi rtog pas so //
translated: Why is that? Because from form up to omniscience is nonconceptual.

original: lam 'grub pa la mi rtog pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: lam 'grub pa la mi rtog pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Nonconceptuality in accomplishing the path.🔽Subhūti asked, “If all phenomena are nonconceptual, how do the six kinds of beings and the noble such as stream enterers arise?”

original: chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog na 'gro ba rigs drug rgyun zhugs la sogs pa'i 'phags pa ji ltar byung ba lag pa zhes pa'i lan rigs drug ni 'khrul ba las byung la /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog na 'gro ba rigs drug rgyun zhugs la sogs pa'i 'phags pa ji ltar byung ba lag pa zhes pa'i lan rigs drug ni 'khrul ba las byung la /
translated: The answer is that the six kinds of beings arise from delusion,

original: rgyun zhugs la sogs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa las yin no //
analyzed: rgyun zhugs la sogs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa las yin no //
translated: and the stream enterers and so on arise from nonconceptuality.

original: le'u bzhi bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: CHAPTER XLIX

original: // / shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul ba'i rtog pa ni sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: // / shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul ba'i rtog pa ni sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: The conception of a non-erroneous object of cognition is stated by Śāriputra:

original: rigs kyi bu yum la spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi snying po la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu yum la spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi snying po la spyod pa lags so //
translated: Son of noble family, to practice the mother is to practice the essence of the perfections up to omniscience.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa la snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du snying po la spyod pa lta ci smos /🔽mi mthun pa'i gnyen po'i rnam rtog ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa la snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du snying po la spyod pa lta ci smos / mi mthun pa'i gnyen po'i rnam rtog ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod kyang /
translated: If even the non-apprehension of an essence in the practice of the mother by a bodhisattva is so, what need is there to speak of practicing the essence of form up to omniscience?🔽The conception of an incompatible antidote is stated by Subhūti:

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa ni dka' ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa ni dka' ba byed pa'o //
translated: Even though a bodhisattva practices the mother, not actualizing the limit of reality is difficult to do.

original: rang gi rtog pa'i rnam rtog ni rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rang gi rtog pa'i rnam rtog ni rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: The conception of one's own thought is stated by Subhūti:

original: yum la spyod kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed @254b pa ni dka' ste /
analyzed: yum la spyod kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed @254b pa ni dka' ste /
translated: Even though one practices the mother, not actualizing the limit of reality is difficult.

original: de bas kyang sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub la dgong par 'dod pa ni dka'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub la dgong par 'dod pa ni dka'o //
translated: It is even more difficult to want to establish all sentient beings in unexcelled enlightenment.

original: de cis na nam mkha' med pa dang stong pa dang dben pa dang gsog dang gsob bzhin du sems can med pa'i don byed pa ni nam mkha' dang rtsod par 'dod pa nam mkha' 'dul bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de cis na nam mkha' med pa dang stong pa dang dben pa dang gsog dang gsob bzhin du sems can med pa'i don byed pa ni nam mkha' dang rtsod par 'dod pa nam mkha' 'dul bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Why is that? If one wants to argue with space, which is non-existent, empty, isolated, void, and hollow, and wants to subdue space,

original: de cis na chos thams cad dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de cis na chos thams cad dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because all phenomena are isolated.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon drug ni lha rnams phyag 'tshal ba dang / sangs rgyas dgongs pa dang / bdud kyi bar chad kyis mi tshugs pa dang / lha'i bu spro ba skyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ched du brjod pa mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i phan yon drug ni lha rnams phyag 'tshal ba dang / sangs rgyas dgongs pa dang / bdud kyi bar chad kyis mi tshugs pa dang / lha'i bu spro ba skyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ched du brjod pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: The six benefits of realizing that are: the gods pay homage, the buddhas think of you, you are not harmed by Māra’s obstacles, the devaputras encourage you, the tathāgatas make proclamations,

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas shing byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas shing byang chub pa'o //
translated: and you abide in suchness and attain enlightenment.

original: byed pa'i rnam rtog ni de bzhin nyid kyang med de de las gzhan pa med na /
analyzed: byed pa'i rnam rtog ni de bzhin nyid kyang med de de las gzhan pa med na /
translated: The concept of an agent is as follows: If suchness does not exist, and there is nothing other than that,

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas sangs rgyas nas chos bstan nas lung ston pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas nas sangs rgyas nas chos bstan nas lung ston pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no one who, having remained in suchness, having become a buddha, having taught the Dharma, gives predictions.

original: chags pa med pa'i le'u ste lnga bcu pa'o /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i le'u ste lnga bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the fiftieth chapter, on the “Freedom from Attachment.”

original: // / las su bya ba'i rnam rtog ni rab 'byor ni ci dang ci ston pa de thams cad stong pa nyid las brtsams shing chos ston pas na /
analyzed: // / las su bya ba'i rnam rtog ni rab 'byor ni ci dang ci ston pa de thams cad stong pa nyid las brtsams shing chos ston pas na /
translated: The conceptualization of things to be done is as follows: Subhūti teaches whatever he teaches by beginning with emptiness.

original: sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yang med na sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du yang med na sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod pa lta ci smos /
translated: If even generosity up to omniscience do not exist, what need is there to speak of practicing generosity and so on?

original: 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis gnas pa des byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis gnas pa des byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i char yang mi phod do //
translated: The conceptualization of results is as follows: Subhūti, the noble one, says that the bodhisattva’s practice of the mother does not even approach it.

original: de la dge slong brgya drug cu tsam mchod pa phul nas lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong brgya drug cu tsam mchod pa phul nas lung bstan pa'o //
translated: There, about sixty monks made offerings and received predictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthong lam dngos la drug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthong lam dngos la drug ste /
translated: The actual path of seeing of the bodhisattva has six parts.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu dang / gzhan zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / byang chub yin pa dang / rten 'brel rang bzhin med pa la zad pa dang / yod par 'dod pa la byang chub med pa dang / 'khrul ba la 'khrul par ngo shes pa yum du yum yod na pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu dang / gzhan zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / byang chub yin pa dang / rten 'brel rang bzhin med pa la zad pa dang / yod par 'dod pa la byang chub med pa dang / 'khrul ba la 'khrul par ngo shes pa yum du yum yod na pha rol tu phyin pa drug rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of enlightenment, the knowledge of cessation and the knowledge of non-arising, enlightenment itself, the absence of inherent existence in dependent origination, the absence of enlightenment in the assertion of existence, and the recognition of error as error.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu gsum ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu gsum ni /
translated: The three causes of enlightenment are:🔽The teaching of enlightenment to others,🔽the dedication of its causes,

original: byang chub la gzhan ston pa dang // de yi rgyu ni yongs gtod dang // de 'thob bar chad med pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: byang chub la gzhan ston pa dang // de yi rgyu ni yongs gtod dang // de 'thob bar chad med pa'i rgyu //
translated: and the cause of attaining it without obstruction.

original: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: These are the characteristics of great merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa de /
translated: The bodhisattva practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang dga' ldan gyi gnas dang / mi'i nang nas tshe 'phos pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dang dga' ldan gyi gnas dang / mi'i nang nas tshe 'phos pa'o //
translated: passes away from the buddha-field, the Tuṣita heaven, and the human realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: He plants the roots of virtue in the Tathāgata.

original: sangs rgyas mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: He manifests the Buddha.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la spyad pas theg pa 'og mar mi ltung pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la spyad pas theg pa 'og mar mi ltung pa'o //
translated: By practicing the perfections and so on, one does not fall into the lower vehicles.

original: @255a * // yongs su gtad pa ni kun dga' bo /
analyzed: @255a * // yongs su gtad pa ni kun dga' bo /
translated: The entrusting is to Ananda.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di khyod la gtad kyi chud ma gsan par zung shig /'di bzung na dus gsum gyi byang chub gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di khyod la gtad kyi chud ma gsan par zung shig /'di bzung na dus gsum gyi byang chub gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is entrusted to you; do not lose it, but hold it! If you hold it, you will hold the enlightenment of the three times.

original: nga ston pa yin pa bzhin du 'di yang ston pa yin no //
analyzed: nga ston pa yin pa bzhin du 'di yang ston pa yin no //
translated: Just as I am a teacher, so is this.

original: 'di la mchod pa la sogs pa byas na dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang nga la mchod pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mchod pa la sogs pa byas na dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas dang nga la mchod pa byas pa yin no //
translated: If you make offerings and so on to this, you make offerings to the buddhas and me of the three times.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad 'di las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad 'di las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: All buddhas of the three times come from this.

original: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas spyad kyang zad par ma gyur pa mdzod yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas spyad kyang zad par ma gyur pa mdzod yin no //
translated: The treasury of the buddhas dwelling in the ten directions, whose practices have not yet been exhausted, is this.

original: bsod nams mang ba ni stong gsum gyi sems can dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod pa bas yum tshig 'ga' zhig skad cig gam yud tsam byang chub sems dpa' la byin na bsod nams che'o //
analyzed: bsod nams mang ba ni stong gsum gyi sems can dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod pa bas yum tshig 'ga' zhig skad cig gam yud tsam byang chub sems dpa' la byin na bsod nams che'o //
translated: The great merit is that if one gives a Bodhisattva just a few words of the Mother for a moment or a short time, the merit is greater than if one were to establish the sentient beings of a billion-world universe in Arhatship.

original: gang yang mthong ba med pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid mthong ba ni mthong lam brdas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang mthong ba med pa'i tshul gyis de kho na nyid mthong ba ni mthong lam brdas bstan pa'o //
translated: The seeing of thatness in the manner of non-seeing is the path of seeing, which is indicated by the word “seeing.”

original: zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising are

original: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'o //
translated: the elimination of defilements and nonarising.

original: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de //
analyzed: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de //
translated: These are called the wisdom of enlightenment.

original: zad med skye med phyir de dag / gom rims bzhin du shes par bya //
analyzed: zad med skye med phyir de dag / gom rims bzhin du shes par bya //
translated: They are to be known as the steps of nonexhaustion and nonarising.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad yum las byung yang zad par ma gyur te /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad yum las byung yang zad par ma gyur te /
translated: Although all the Buddhas of the three times have arisen from the Mother, they have not been exhausted.

original: bsam gtan nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar ma zad mi zad zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: From the dhyanas up to the unshared qualities of the Buddha, they are not exhausted, are not being exhausted, and will not be exhausted.

original: de cis na skye ba'ang med na zad par mi 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: de cis na skye ba'ang med na zad par mi 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: Why is this? If they do not arise, what need is there to speak of their not being exhausted?

original: yongs su gtad pa'i le'u ste nga gcig pa'o /
analyzed: yongs su gtad pa'i le'u ste nga gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the forty-first chapter, on the Entrustment.

original: // / rten 'brel rang bzhin med pa la zad pa dang skye ba mi 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: // / rten 'brel rang bzhin med pa la zad pa dang skye ba mi 'thad pa ni /
translated: The Invalidation of Exhaustion and Production in the Absence of a Nature

original: 'gog pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
analyzed: 'gog pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
translated: In the nature that is not cessation,

original: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: With the path called “seeing,”

original: rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
analyzed: rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
translated: What kind of conceptualization is exhausted?

original: skye med rnam pa ci zhig thob //
analyzed: skye med rnam pa ci zhig thob //
translated: What kind of non-production is attained?

original: ces pa ni gzugs nas rten 'brel gyi bar du mi zad pa dang zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni gzugs nas rten 'brel gyi bar du mi zad pa dang zad mi shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, from form up to dependent origination, one should accomplish the perfection of wisdom through the inexhaustible and the inexhaustible.

original: yod par 'dod pa la grol ba mi 'thad pa ni /
analyzed: yod par 'dod pa la grol ba mi 'thad pa ni /
translated: The Invalidation of Liberation in the Assertion of Existence

original: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la //🔽shes bya la yang ston pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la // shes bya la yang ston pa yi //
translated: Other phenomena also exist,🔽And the Teacher’s obscurations

original: sgrib pa zad par brjod pa gang //
analyzed: sgrib pa zad par brjod pa gang //
translated: With respect to objects of knowledge are said to be exhausted.

original: 'di la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //
analyzed: 'di la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //
translated: I find this amazing.

original: shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' phyir ldog pa thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa dang zad pa med pa ma rtogs pas phyir ldog pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' phyir ldog pa thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye ba med pa dang zad pa med pa ma rtogs pas phyir ldog pa'o //
translated: All bodhisattvas who turn back do so because they have not realized the non-arising and non-exhaustion of dependent origination.

original: 'khrul pa med pa la 'khrul bar ngo shes pa'i yum ni /🔽'di la bsal ba ci yang med //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa la 'khrul bar ngo shes pa'i yum ni / 'di la bsal ba ci yang med //
translated: The mother who recognizes the error of non-error is as follows:🔽There is nothing at all to remove

original: bsnan par bya ba cung zad med //
analyzed: bsnan par bya ba cung zad med //
translated: and not the slightest thing to add.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: See the perfect in the perfect.

original: yang dag @255b mthong na rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag @255b mthong na rnam par grol //
translated: When seeing the perfect, one is liberated.

original: zhes pas / byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pas /
analyzed: zhes pas / byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pas /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas who practice the mother

original: byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa /
analyzed: byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa /
translated: do not see the twelve kinds of agents, from form to omniscience, as permanent or impermanent,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal /
translated: happy or suffering,

original: bdag dang bdag med /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med /
translated: self or selfless,

original: zhi ba dang ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: zhi ba dang ma zhi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /

analyzed: de cis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong //
translated: Why is that? Because they do not see the perfection of wisdom up to the unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: chos gang gis mthong bar gyur pa de yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang gis mthong bar gyur pa de yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see that dharma by which he would see.

original: mi zad pa'i le'u ste lnga bcu gnyis so /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i le'u ste lnga bcu gnyis so /
translated: This is the fifty-second chapter, on the Inexhaustible.

original: // / yum du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad rdzogs pa ni /
analyzed: // / yum du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad rdzogs pa ni /
translated: In the Mother, all perfections are completed.

original: sbyin pa la sogs re re la //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs re re la //
translated: In each of generosity and so forth,

original: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
translated: whatever is included in each other,

original: skad cig gcig gis bzod pa yis //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis bzod pa yis //
translated: in one instant, by patience,

original: bsdus pa de 'dir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: bsdus pa de 'dir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: that is included here in the path of seeing.

original: zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa re re la drug drug go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa re re la drug drug go //
translated: In each perfection, there are six.

original: skabs 'dir bsgom lam gyi ting nge 'dzin ni /🔽de nas seng ge rnam bsgyings pa'i //
analyzed: skabs 'dir bsgom lam gyi ting nge 'dzin ni / de nas seng ge rnam bsgyings pa'i //
translated: In this section, the samadhi of the path of cultivation is🔽the samadhi of the lion's display,

original: ting nge 'dzin la zhes pa la sogs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la zhes pa la sogs so //
translated: as stated in the root tantra.

original: thod rgal gyi le'u ste lnga bcu gsum pa'o; ;
analyzed: thod rgal gyi le'u ste lnga bcu gsum pa'o; ;
translated: This is the fifty-third chapter on skipping.

original: // le'u 'di nas mthong lam gyi rtog pa dgu gsum bsgom lam gyi rtog pa dgu bzhi ston /
analyzed: // le'u 'di nas mthong lam gyi rtog pa dgu gsum bsgom lam gyi rtog pa dgu bzhi ston /
translated: From this chapter onward, it explains the nine conceptions of the path of seeing and the nine conceptions of the path of cultivation.

original: de la mthong lam gyi ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rtog pa ni /
analyzed: de la mthong lam gyi ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rtog pa ni /
translated: The conception of the side of reversal on the path of seeing is

analyzed: srid dang zhi bar ltung phyir dang // rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //
translated: And because of inferior realization,🔽And because of lacking complete acceptance,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang // lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang dag //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang // lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang dag //
translated: And because of the incompleteness of the aspects of the path,🔽And because of going by the power of another,🔽And because of the perversion of the purpose,

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // ched du bya ba log pa dang // nyi tshe ba sna tshogs nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // ched du bya ba log pa dang // nyi tshe ba sna tshogs nyid //
translated: And because of the various limits,🔽And because of confusion about the basis and engagement,

original: gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhe bya ba la //
analyzed: gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhe bya ba la //
translated: And because of following after,

original: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid 'di //
translated: This is the nature of the nine conceptual thoughts.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can de //
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can de //
translated: That is the basis for the side of reversal.

original: nyan thos la sogs yid las 'byung //🔽zhes pa la //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs yid las 'byung //🔽zhes pa la //
translated: It arises from the minds of śrāvakas and so on.

original: srid dang zhi bar mi ltung ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhi la mthun par 'jug go'i dpe dang / rtogs pa dman pa nyid ni rin po che sna bdun dang bral na 'khor los sgyur ba'i ming mi thob pa'i dpe dang // yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ni khyim thab med pa'i bud med 'phyon ma rnams kyis tshogs pa'i dpe dang /
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar mi ltung ba ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhi la mthun par 'jug go'i dpe dang / rtogs pa dman pa nyid ni rin po che sna bdun dang bral na 'khor los sgyur ba'i ming mi thob pa'i dpe dang // yongs su 'dzin pa med pa ni khyim thab med pa'i bud med 'phyon ma rnams kyis tshogs pa'i dpe dang /
translated: Lack of complete acceptance is like the example of a group of prostitutes without a husband.🔽Lack of completeness of the aspects of the path is like the example of a hero with complete armor and weapons who cannot be conquered by others.

original: lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang ba ni go mtshon tshang pa'i dpa' bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i dpe dang / gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba ni mkhar gyi rgyal po rnams 'khor los sgyur ba'i drung du nang nub 'gro ba'i dpe dang / ched du bya ba log pa ni chu rnams gang g'a dang /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang ba ni go mtshon tshang pa'i dpa' bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i dpe dang / gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba ni mkhar gyi rgyal po rnams 'khor los sgyur ba'i drung du nang nub 'gro ba'i dpe dang / ched du bya ba log pa ni chu rnams gang g'a dang /
translated: Going by the conditions of others is like the example of the kings of the forts going to the cakravartin in the morning and evening.

original: 'grogs na rgya mtsho chen po rdol ba'i dpe dang / nyi tshe ba ni thabs rkyang pa @256a * //
analyzed: 'grogs na rgya mtsho chen po rdol ba'i dpe dang / nyi tshe ba ni thabs rkyang pa @256a * //
translated: The opposite of the object of intent is like the example of the rivers flowing into the Ganges and the ocean.🔽The limited is like the example of a single method.

original: lag pa g-yon pa dang 'dra ba'i dpe dang / sna tshogs nyid ni chu klung rnams rgya mtshor phyin na ro gcig tu 'gyur ba'i dpe dang / gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa ni 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po'i rjes su rin po che sna bdun 'brang ba'i dpe yum gyi rjes su pha rol tu phyin pa lnga 'brang ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yin la /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa dang 'dra ba'i dpe dang / sna tshogs nyid ni chu klung rnams rgya mtshor phyin na ro gcig tu 'gyur ba'i dpe dang / gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa ni 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po'i rjes su rin po che sna bdun 'brang ba'i dpe yum gyi rjes su pha rol tu phyin pa lnga 'brang ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yin la /
translated: The example of the left hand, the example of the river's variety becoming of one taste upon reaching the ocean, and the example of the confusion of place and entry, that is, the five perfections following the perfection of wisdom, are for the bodhisattva.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba ni nyan thos kyi yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba ni nyan thos kyi yin no //
translated: The example of the seven jewels following the universal monarch is for the sravaka, who is devoid of the perfections.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po /
translated: The first conception of grasping

original: 'dzin pa dang ni gtong ba dang / yid la byed dang khams rnams ni //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang ni gtong ba dang / yid la byed dang khams rnams ni //
translated: grasping and giving up, mental activity,🔽the three realms,🔽dwelling, attachment,🔽the imputation of the entity of phenomena,🔽attachment, the antidote,

original: gsum char nye bar 'brel pa dang // gnas dang mngon par zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la //
analyzed: gsum char nye bar 'brel pa dang // gnas dang mngon par zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la //
translated: and the impairment of going as one wishes

original: 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //
translated: are to be understood as the first grasping.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: In this verse,

original: 'dzin pa dang gtong ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gtong ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: the concepts of grasping and releasing do not grasp or release anything from form to omniscience.

original: yid la byed pa'i rtog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yid la mi byed do//
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rtog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yid la mi byed do//
translated: The concept of mental activity does not mentally engage with anything from form to omniscience.

original: khams gsum dang nye bar 'brel pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yid la byas na khams gsum dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: khams gsum dang nye bar 'brel pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yid la byas na khams gsum dang 'brel lo //
translated: The concept of being related to the three realms is related to the three realms when one mentally engages with anything from form to omniscience.

original: gnas kyi rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi gnas so //
analyzed: gnas kyi rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi gnas so //
translated: The concept of dwelling is that the bodhisattva who practices in the womb does not dwell on anything from form to omniscience.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa chos de rnams la ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa chos de rnams la ma chags pa'o //
translated: The concept of clinging is not being attached to those phenomena.

original: chos kyi dngos po btags pa'i rtog pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po btags pa'i rtog pa /
translated: The concept of the imputed reality of phenomena

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / des chos thams cad sgrub pa dang / des chos 'dzin par ma btags pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / des chos thams cad sgrub pa dang / des chos 'dzin par ma btags pa'o //
translated: is not imputing the perfection of wisdom, establishing all phenomena by that, or apprehending phenomena by that.

original: chags pa'i rtog pa ni de tsho'i skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i rtog pa ni de tsho'i skyon med pa'o //
translated: The concept of attachment is the faultlessness of those.

original: gnyen po'i rtog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du gzugs she'am /
analyzed: gnyen po'i rtog pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du gzugs she'am /
translated: The antidote concept does not conceive of form up to omniscience as form,

original: 'di ni gzugs so zhe'am /

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa med na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang dmigs pa ma mchis pa lags sam gyi lan /

analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang dmigs pa med pa de nyid dmigs pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at characteristics,🔽The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at the two extremes,🔽The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at the two truths,🔽The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of self,

original: ngo bo nyid nges pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ;
translated: The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of identity,🔽The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of pride,🔽The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of conceit,🔽The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of ignorance,🔽The two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of grasping at the two kinds of obsc

original: / chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis na sems dang po bskyed pa thabs sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi sems can yongs su smin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa lags /
analyzed: / chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis na sems dang po bskyed pa thabs sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi sems can yongs su smin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa lags /
translated: If all phenomena are unreal, how can the mind that is first generated, the method of generosity, and so on up to omniscience, bring sentient beings to full maturity and purify a buddha realm?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la dngos po med pa de nyid kyi phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la dngos po med pa de nyid kyi phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Because form and so on up to omniscience are unreal, bringing sentient beings to full maturity and purifying a buddha realm are the essence.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes mi 'thad zhus pa'i lan /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes mi 'thad zhus pa'i lan /
translated: The response to the question, “It is not tenable that the wisdom of omniscience exists in the absence of all phenomena.”

original: yum la spyod pa'i tshe sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyod kyang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed pa de dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med pa yid la mi byed pa de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: yum la spyod pa'i tshe sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyod kyang mi rtog mtshan mar mi byed pa de dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med pa yid la mi byed pa de nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: When practicing the mother, even though one practices generosity and so on up to omniscience, not conceptualizing and not taking them as signs, not paying attention to whether they exist or do not exist is itself the wisdom of omniscience.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med na bden pa gnyis mi 'thad do zhus pa'i lan /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med na bden pa gnyis mi 'thad do zhus pa'i lan /
translated: Question: If all phenomena are unreal, the two truths are untenable.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi kun rdzob de ka dngos po med pa ni don dam mo //🔽yang dag par bstan pa'i le'u ste lnga bcu lnga pa'o /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi kun rdzob de ka dngos po med pa ni don dam mo // yang dag par bstan pa'i le'u ste lnga bcu lnga pa'o /
translated: Reply: The relative, from form to omniscience, is unreal, and that is the ultimate.

original: // / gsol pa /
analyzed: // / gsol pa /
translated: This is the fifty-fifth chapter of The Precious Treasury of the Basic Space of Phenomena, demonstrating authentic teaching.

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa gang lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa gang lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Question: What is the conduct of awakening?

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar stong zhes bya bar spyod de /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar stong zhes bya bar spyod de /
translated: Reply: The conduct is to engage with the notion that everything from form to omniscience is empty.

original: ci nas blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ci nas blo rnam pa gnyis su mi 'gyur ba ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application is to do so in such a way that one’s mind does not become dualistic.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa la sangs rgyas mi 'thad do zhus pa'i lan /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa la sangs rgyas mi 'thad do zhus pa'i lan /
translated: Question: If all phenomena are unreal, buddhahood is untenable.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med par thugs su chud pa ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med par thugs su chud pa ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: Reply: The realization that all phenomena are unreal is buddhahood.

original: chos dkon mchog ni chos thams cad dngos po med na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar skye 'gag dang 'khor 'das ma mchis par 'gyur ro zhus pa'i lan /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog ni chos thams cad dngos po med na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar skye 'gag dang 'khor 'das ma mchis par 'gyur ro zhus pa'i lan /
translated: Question: If all phenomena are unreal, it follows that from form to omniscience there is no origination or cessation, no samsara or nirvana.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar skye 'gag med pa la sogs pa de nyid chos yin ;
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar skye 'gag med pa la sogs pa de nyid chos yin ;
translated: The reality of form up to omniscience is the Dharma, which is without origination and cessation.

original: de cis na ;
analyzed: de cis na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gnyis la spyod pas na dge lnga bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gnyis la spyod pas na dge lnga bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: Because childish ordinary beings practice the two.

original: // / tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams mi dge / dge 'dun ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis gsungs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi don rtogs nas bsnyen bkur ba'o //🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur ba'i @259a * //
analyzed: // / tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams mi dge / dge 'dun ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis gsungs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi don rtogs nas bsnyen bkur ba'o // dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur ba'i @259a * //
translated: The Saṅgha is the one who, having realized the meaning of the twelve branches of the scriptures taught by the spiritual friend, serves and respects them.

original: le'u ste lnga bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: le'u ste lnga bcu drug pa'o /
translated: The chapter on serving and respecting the spiritual friend is the fifty-sixth.

original: // / thabs bcas ni sbyin pas sems can rnams ser sna las zlog pa'o //
analyzed: // / thabs bcas ni sbyin pas sems can rnams ser sna las zlog pa'o //
translated: The method is to turn sentient beings away from stinginess through generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i le'u ste lnga bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i le'u ste lnga bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: The chapter on generosity is the fifty-seventh.

original: // / tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams mi dge ba las zlog pa'o //
analyzed: // / tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams mi dge ba las zlog pa'o //
translated: Through morality, sentient beings are turned away from nonvirtue.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhis sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhis sems can gyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi la spyod pa'o //
translated: Through the four perfections, one practices the four perfections for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi thabs kyi le'u ste lnga bcu brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi thabs kyi le'u ste lnga bcu brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the fifty-eighth chapter of The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines, called “Skill in Means.”

original: // / thub pa'i rtogs pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo bas dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa bzhis byang chub mi thob par spros pa med pa ni thub
analyzed: // / thub pa'i rtogs pa ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo bas dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa bzhis byang chub mi thob par spros pa med pa ni thub
translated: The realization of the Sage is the absence of conceptual elaboration, since enlightenment is not attained through the four—entity, non-entity, both, and neither—because the Sage does not move from the non-entity nature of things, from form to omniscience.

original: pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: The Sage’s realization is the absence of conceptual elaboration.

original: phyin ci log ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du rtag ces bya ba dang mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa spros pa yin pas de tsho ni byang chub sems dpa' mi spro'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du rtag ces bya ba dang mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa spros pa yin pas de tsho ni byang chub sems dpa' mi spro'o //
translated: Since conceptual elaboration is the conceptualization of form and so on up to omniscience as permanent, impermanent, and so on, the bodhisattva does not engage in conceptual elaboration.

original: de cis na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni spror med pa ste dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de cis na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni spror med pa ste dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because form and so on up to omniscience are not conceptual elaborations, because they are non-entities.

original: lam bcas ni chos thams cad dngos po med na rgyun zhugs la sogs pa 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams ji ltar mchis pa lags kyi lan /
analyzed: lam bcas ni chos thams cad dngos po med na rgyun zhugs la sogs pa 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams ji ltar mchis pa lags kyi lan /
translated: If all phenomena are non-entities, how can there be noble beings such as stream-enterers?

original: chos nyid brtsan par byas nas rgyun zhugs la sogs pa'i lam dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid brtsan par byas nas rgyun zhugs la sogs pa'i lam dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Having made the true nature firm, one should train in the path of stream-entry and so forth, which are not substantial.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the factors of awakening.

original: gnyen po ni chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la ji ltar bslab par bgyi'i lan /
analyzed: gnyen po ni chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la ji ltar bslab par bgyi'i lan /
translated: If all phenomena are insubstantial, how should one train in the factors of awakening?

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar chos 'dul ba 'di la ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa la sogs par shes pa ni byang chub kya phyogs so //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar chos 'dul ba 'di la ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa la sogs par shes pa ni byang chub kya phyogs so //
translated: The knowledge that from form up to omniscience is neither conjoined nor not conjoined with this Dharma and Vinaya is the factors of awakening.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bgyi ba gang lags kyi lan /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bgyi ba gang lags kyi lan /
translated: What is the counteragent?

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la nyon mongs pa rnams dang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba'o//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la nyon mongs pa rnams dang gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba'o//
translated: The knowledge that the afflictions from form up to omniscience are neither conjoined nor not conjoined with the noble persons is the noble Dharma and Vinaya.

analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid lags na /
translated: “If all phenomena are emptiness,

original: byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyad de /
translated: how can bodhisattvas practice the six pāramitās up to omniscience

original: sems can la chos ston pa lags /
analyzed: sems can la chos ston pa lags /
translated: and teach the dharma to sentient beings?

original: stong pa la ni sems can ma mchis /
analyzed: stong pa la ni sems can ma mchis /
translated: There are no sentient beings in emptiness.

original: sems can ma mchis pas gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du ma mchis lags so zhus pa'i lan /
analyzed: sems can ma mchis pas gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du ma mchis lags so zhus pa'i lan /
translated: Since sentient beings do not exist, from form to omniscience do not exist.

original: sems can med pas stong pa bco brgyad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can med pas stong pa bco brgyad du rig par bya'o //
translated: Since sentient beings do not exist, the eighteen emptinesses should be known.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du bdag nyid kyis stong pa rig nas gzhan la stong pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du bdag nyid kyis stong pa rig nas gzhan la stong pa nyid du ston te /
translated: Having known that form to omniscience is empty by its very nature, one teaches emptiness to others.

original: dper na / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas sprul pa mang po sprul te /
analyzed: dper na / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas sprul pa mang po sprul te /
translated: For example, if a buddha emanation emanates many emanations,

original: la la sbyin pa nas la la rnam mkhyen gyi bar la bkod na gang yang bkod pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: la la sbyin pa nas la la rnam mkhyen gyi bar la bkod na gang yang bkod pa yod snyam mam /
translated: and some are established in generosity and some in omniscience, would there be any established?

original: de bzhin du gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du ma bcings ma grol /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du ma bcings ma grol /
translated: Similarly, from form to omniscience are neither bound nor liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba gang yin pa de gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ma yin te /
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba gang yin pa de gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ma yin te /
translated: That which is neither bound nor liberated is not form to omniscience.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena from form to omniscience are pure.

original: de ltar shes na chos kyi dbyings la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar shes na chos kyi dbyings la 'gal ba med do //
translated: If one knows it in that way, there is no contradiction in the dharmadhatu.

original: gnod pa med do //
analyzed: gnod pa med do //
translated: There is no harm.

original: zhus lan gnyis pa gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan /
analyzed: zhus lan gnyis pa gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan de bzhin nyid kyang gzhan /
translated: The second reply: “Form and so on up to omniscience are not one thing and suchness another.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma yin na /
translated: The perfect limit is not another.

original: las rgyu 'bras mi 'thad de /
analyzed: las rgyu 'bras mi 'thad de /
translated: If that is so, then the cause and effect of karma are untenable.

original: chos kyi dbyings la rnam par dag pa ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes pa la /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la rnam par dag pa ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes pa la / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Because there is no purity in the dharmadhātu.”

original: las rgyu 'bras kun rdzob tu gsungs kyi /
analyzed: las rgyu 'bras kun rdzob tu gsungs kyi /
translated: The reply: “The cause and effect of karma are taught conventionally,

original: don dam par ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.”

original: zhus lan gsum pa bsgoms pa dang ma bsgoms pas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag char phye nas bstan pa ma yin na /
analyzed: zhus lan gsum pa bsgoms pa dang ma bsgoms pas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag char phye nas bstan pa ma yin na /
translated: The third reply: “If the distinctions of the stream enterer and so on are not taught by distinguishing those who meditate and those who do not,

original: kun sbyor gsum spangs pa'i phyir rgyun zhugs @261b thob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar rtogs par bgyi zhus pa'i lan /
analyzed: kun sbyor gsum spangs pa'i phyir rgyun zhugs @261b thob po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar rtogs par bgyi zhus pa'i lan /
translated: how should one understand the statement ‘Because the three fetters are abandoned, the stream enterer is attained’ and so on?”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas mtshan nyid med par khong du chud pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas mtshan nyid med par khong du chud pa'i tshe /
translated: The reply: “When the stream enterer and so on understand that conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are without characteristics,

original: bdag nyid dge ba'i lam la spyod cing gzhan ma la 'god pa'i dpe ni sprul pa de dge ba spyod kyang de'i ro myang ba ni med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid dge ba'i lam la spyod cing gzhan ma la 'god pa'i dpe ni sprul pa de dge ba spyod kyang de'i ro myang ba ni med do //
translated: The example of how one practices the path of virtue oneself and then establishes others in it is that although the emanations practice virtue, they do not experience the taste of it.

original: mtshan dpe'i le'u ste drug cu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: mtshan dpe'i le'u ste drug cu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the sixty-third chapter on the major and minor marks.

original: // / le'u 'di nas kun nas nyon mongs pas rnam par byang ba rtogs pa dang / bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'i phrin las dang gnyis las /
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas kun nas nyon mongs pas rnam par byang ba rtogs pa dang / bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'i phrin las dang gnyis las /
translated: From this chapter onwards, there are two topics: the realization of complete purification through affliction and the activity of establishing sentient beings in nirvana just as one has done oneself.

original: dang po la gsum ni /
analyzed: dang po la gsum ni /
translated: The first has three parts.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti asks,

original: ji ltar chos rnams mtshan nyid med par rtogs lags /
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnams mtshan nyid med par rtogs lags /
translated: How is it that phenomena are realized to be without characteristics?

original: lan sprul pa ni nyon mongs pa dmigs pa bcu gcig gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyod pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: lan sprul pa ni nyon mongs pa dmigs pa bcu gcig gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyod pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: The reply is that just as the emanations do not engage in the eleven afflictions that focus on form up to omniscience,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa gang la yang mi spyod na chos kyi tshul rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa gang la yang mi spyod na chos kyi tshul rtogs pa yin no //
translated: in the same way, if the bodhisattvas do not engage in anything at all while practicing the mother, they realize the way of phenomena.

original: gnyis pa gsol pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa gsol pa /
translated: The second question is,

original: phung po lnga sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: phung po lnga sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: If the five aggregates are like an emanation,

original: sprul pa la ni phung po lnga kun nas nyon mongs rnam par byang ba 'gro ba lnga ma mchis na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i mthur 'gyur lags /
analyzed: sprul pa la ni phung po lnga kun nas nyon mongs rnam par byang ba 'gro ba lnga ma mchis na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i mthur 'gyur lags /
translated: since the five aggregates of an emanation are neither defiled nor purified, and do not go to the five destinies, how can they be the power of a bodhisattva?”

original: lan byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: lan byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The reply is: “When a bodhisattva is practicing the conduct of awakening,

original: 'gro ba lnga la sogs pa la dmigs te ;
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga la sogs pa la dmigs te ;
translated: focusing on the five destinies and so forth,

original: sprul pa lta bur shes so //
analyzed: sprul pa lta bur shes so //
translated: he knows them to be like an emanation.

original: mthong ngo // rtogs so //
analyzed: mthong ngo // rtogs so //
translated: He sees them and realizes them.

original: gsol pa sprul pa lta bur rtogs lags na gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa sprul pa lta bur rtogs lags na gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: ” The question is: “If they are realized to be like an emanation, for whose sake do bodhisattvas practice generosity and so forth up to omniscience, and purify a buddhafield and bring sentient beings to full maturity?”

original: lan gal te sems can rnams rang rang gis sprul pa lta bur ma shes pa'i don du sems can rnams kyi don mdzad do //
analyzed: lan gal te sems can rnams rang rang gis sprul pa lta bur ma shes pa'i don du sems can rnams kyi don mdzad do //
translated: The reply is: “They act for the sake of sentient beings so that they will not know the five destinies and so forth to be like an emanation.”

original: gsum pa chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu la sogs pa lags na sems can rnams ci la gnas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams yum la spyod cing sems can rnams gyen du bskyod pa lags /
analyzed: gsum pa chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu la sogs pa lags na sems can rnams ci la gnas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams yum la spyod cing sems can rnams gyen du bskyod pa lags /
translated: Third, if all phenomena are like dreams and so forth, on what do sentient beings dwell that bodhisattvas engage in the mother and cause sentient beings to rise up?

original: lan sems can rnams ni ming dang mtshan ma med pa la zhen pa lags /
analyzed: lan sems can rnams ni ming dang mtshan ma med pa la zhen pa lags /
translated: The reply is that sentient beings cling to names and signs.

original: de'i log rtogs 'gegs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i log rtogs 'gegs pa'o //
translated: This is the refutation of their misconception.🔽Engaging in the welfare of sentient beings just as one does oneself has two parts.

original: bdag nyid ji bzhin sems can gyi don byed pa la gnyis las dang po gsol pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid ji bzhin sems can gyi don byed pa la gnyis las dang po gsol pa /
translated: The first is the request:

original: chos thams cad ming dang mchan mar bas la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ming dang mchan mar bas la /
translated: All phenomena are devoid of names and signs.

original: chos su rtogs pa las byung ba lags na byang chub sems dpa' @262a * //
analyzed: chos su rtogs pa las byung ba lags na byang chub sems dpa' @262a * //
translated: Since they arise from the realization of phenomena, when bodhisattvas

original: yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: engage in the mother,

original: bdag gzhan dge la spyod cing sems can rnams theg pa gsum la gzhol ba lags /
analyzed: bdag gzhan dge la spyod cing sems can rnams theg pa gsum la gzhol ba lags /
translated: how do they engage in virtue for themselves and others and cause sentient beings to engage in the three vehicles?

original: lan thal ba ni gal te dngos po'am dngos po'i mtshan ma gcig yod na ni /
analyzed: lan thal ba ni gal te dngos po'am dngos po'i mtshan ma gcig yod na ni /
translated: The reply is that if there were a single thing or sign of a thing,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattvas engage in the mother,

original: bdag gzhan dge ba la spyod cing sems can rnams theg pa gsum la gzhol ba la sbyor bar mi 'gyur bar thal ba las /
analyzed: bdag gzhan dge ba la spyod cing sems can rnams theg pa gsum la gzhol ba la sbyor bar mi 'gyur bar thal ba las /
translated: It would follow that they would not engage in virtue themselves or in encouraging others to do so, but this is not the case.

original: ldog pa dngos po dang dngos po'i mtshan ma med pas na byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: ldog pa dngos po dang dngos po'i mtshan ma med pas na byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Because there are no entities or attributes, when bodhisattvas practice the mother,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rang rdzogs par byas nas gzhan dge ba la sbyor te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar rang rdzogs par byas nas gzhan dge ba la sbyor te /
translated: they perfect the six transcendent perfections and all the other elements leading to enlightenment up to and including the distinct attributes of a buddha, in a manner free of attributes, and they encourage others to practice virtue.

original: gal te chung ngu na skra'i rtse mo cha shas bzhag pa tsam cig yod kyang byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽mtshan ma med pa dran pa med pa yid la byed pa med par sangs rgya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chung ngu na skra'i rtse mo cha shas bzhag pa tsam cig yod kyang byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe / mtshan ma med pa dran pa med pa yid la byed pa med par sangs rgya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were even the slightest attribute, such as the tip of a hair,

original: sems can rnams kyang 'jog par mi 'gyur bar thal ba las /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang 'jog par mi 'gyur bar thal ba las /
translated: bodhisattvas would not attain buddhahood in a manner free of attributes, free of thoughts and free of mental activity, and it would follow that they would not encourage beings to practice virtue.

original: de las zlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las zlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is not the case, so it is the opposite of that.

original: gsol pa chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis pa la sogs pa lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis pa la sogs pa lags na /
translated: He asked, If all phenomena are signless, etc.

original: 'di dag ni dmigs pa bcu gcig 'phags pa'i gang zag go zhes ji ltar 'brang bar bgyi'i lan /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dmigs pa bcu gcig 'phags pa'i gang zag go zhes ji ltar 'brang bar bgyi'i lan /
translated: How can it be said, 'These are the eleven objects of observation for the āryas'?

original: mtshan ma med pa la yang gzhan la chos de rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la yang gzhan la chos de rnams kyang gzhan zhig yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that signlessness is one thing and the phenomena of the āryas are another?

original: gsol pa de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa de lta ma lags so //
translated: He replied, No, it is not like that.

original: mtshan ma med pa nyid du rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa nyid du rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa yin nam /
translated: Are the stream enterers, etc. signlessness?

original: gsol pa de ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa de ma lags so //
translated: He replied, No, it is not like that.

original: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad mtshan ma med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad mtshan ma med par rig par bya ste /
translated: By this approach, you should know that all phenomena are signless.

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel lo //
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel lo //
translated: From the perfections up to omniscience, the roots of virtue increase.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam thar sgo gsum la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam thar sgo gsum la spyod pas /
translated: Because bodhisattvas practice the three doors of liberation,

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la slob pa yin no //
translated: they train in form up to omniscience.

original: zhus lan gnyis pa /
analyzed: zhus lan gnyis pa /
translated: The second reply

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos de dag la bslabs na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrug par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos de dag la bslabs na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrug par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: If one trains in those phenomena that are mutually different, will that not disturb the dharmadhātu?

original: lan chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang med pas /
analyzed: lan chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang med pas /
translated: Reply: Since there are no phenomena that are not included in the dharmadhātu,

original: dmigs pa bcu gcig la sogs pa chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa bcu gcig la sogs pa chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi dbyings la bslab par bya'o //
translated: one should train in the dharmadhātu by way of the inseparability of all phenomena, such as the eleven topics.

original: gsol pa chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags @262b na ;
analyzed: gsol pa chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags @262b na ;
translated: Question: All phenomena are the dharmadhātu.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pas /
translated: How should bodhisattvas who are practicing in the mother

original: ji ltar gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la med pa la bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la med pa la bslab par bgyi /
translated: train in the nonexistence of form up to omniscience?

original: tha dad med pa la tha dad du bslabs na phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: tha dad med pa la tha dad du bslabs na phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ram /
translated: If one trains in the differences of what is not different, will that not be a mistake?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan ma yin /
translated: Form up to omniscience is not one thing,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang gzhan ma lags so //
translated: and the dharmadhātu is not another.

original: de'i lan gzugs dang rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i lan gzugs dang rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang ma mthong ste /
translated: Since the answer is not different from form up to omniscience, when bodhisattvas practice the mother, they do not see any phenomena that are not included in the dharmadhatu.

original: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su shes nas ming med pa la ming gi brdas ston te 'di ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings su shes nas ming med pa la ming gi brdas ston te 'di ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Knowing that all phenomena are the dharmadhatu, they teach with names what is without names, saying, “This is form up to omniscience.”

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis rdzas kyi rnam pa gyi na zhig la brten te gzugs kyi bye brag sna tshogs glang po nas sangs rgyas kyi sku'i yan lag rdzogs pa'i bar du bstan na /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis rdzas kyi rnam pa gyi na zhig la brten te gzugs kyi bye brag sna tshogs glang po nas sangs rgyas kyi sku'i yan lag rdzogs pa'i bar du bstan na /
translated: For example, a magician creates various forms, from an elephant to a complete body with all the limbs of a buddha, based on a substance such as a stick.

original: de la sems can byis pa'i ngang tshul can dag de la ngo mtshar du 'dzin /
analyzed: de la sems can byis pa'i ngang tshul can dag de la ngo mtshar du 'dzin /
translated: Childlike beings are amazed by that.

original: skyes bu mkhas shing gsal ba mgo skor du go //
analyzed: skyes bu mkhas shing gsal ba mgo skor du go //
translated: But a wise and clear-minded person understands it to be a deception.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang ma mthong yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe chos kyi dbyings su ma gtogs pa'i chos gang yang ma mthong yang /
translated: In the same way, when bodhisattvas are practicing the mother, they do not see any phenomena that are not included in the expanse of reality.

original: thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par byed kyang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par byed kyang /
translated: However, through their skill in means, they bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sems can mi dmigs par sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du bdag kyang spyod gzhan yang spyod du 'jug chos kyi dbyings dus gsum du 'gyur ba med pa sems can rnams la ston to //
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs par sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du bdag kyang spyod gzhan yang spyod du 'jug chos kyi dbyings dus gsum du 'gyur ba med pa sems can rnams la ston to //
translated: Without observing sentient beings, they practice generosity and the other perfections up to omniscience themselves and they encourage others to practice them. They reveal to sentient beings the expanse of reality, which is unchanging throughout the three times.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi le'u ste re bzhi pa'o /🔽// / le'u 'di nas phrin las lnga las /🔽dang pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni zhus pa /🔽sems can dang sems can du gdags pa dmigs su ma mchis na su'i don du byang chub sems dpa' yum sgom pa lags /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi le'u ste re bzhi pa'o /🔽// / le'u 'di nas phrin las lnga las /🔽dang pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni zhus pa /🔽sems can dang sems can du gdags pa dmigs su ma mchis na su'i don du byang chub sems dpa' yum sgom pa lags /
translated: This is the forty-fourth chapter, on “Equality.”

original: lan thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: lan thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams la yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'god pa'i thabs la mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe / sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: When bodhisattvas practice the mother,

original: sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'god cing drug po de nyid rang bzhin gyis stong zhing mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'god cing drug po de nyid rang bzhin gyis stong zhing mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: from the time they first arouse bodhicitta, they establish sentient beings in the six transcendent perfections and those six perfections themselves are empty by nature and unobservable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi mdzad pa ni dag ba nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la bdag nyid gnas shing sems can gzhan 'god @263a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi mdzad pa ni dag ba nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la bdag nyid gnas shing sems can gzhan 'god @263a * //
translated: The deeds of the path to buddhahood are that they themselves abide in the path from the purity up to omniscience and they establish other sentient beings in it.

original: do ; / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi mdzad pa la zhus lan gnyis las /
analyzed: do ; / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi mdzad pa la zhus lan gnyis las /
translated: The two questions and answers on the deeds of emptiness of nature are as follows.

original: dang po ni gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can dang chos dang chos ma yin pa yang ma dmigs na /
analyzed: dang po ni gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la ni sems can dang chos dang chos ma yin pa yang ma dmigs na /
translated: The first is, if all phenomena are empty of nature, then in emptiness of nature sentient beings, phenomena and nonphenomena are not observed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du 'jug la /🔽lan de de bzhin te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na chos de rnams ma dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi don du 'jug la / lan de de bzhin te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na chos de rnams ma dmigs so //
translated: How do bodhisattvas engage in the pursuit of omniscience?

original: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhig ma yin na ni /
translated: If all phenomena were not empty of inherent existence,🔽then bodhisattvas would not, having stood in the emptiness of inherent existence,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas te sangs rgyas nas rang bzhin stong pa nyid du mi ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la gnas te sangs rgyas nas rang bzhin stong pa nyid du mi ston te /
translated: become fully enlightened and teach the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: rab 'byor gyis gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, form up to omniscience is empty of inherent existence.

original: de bas na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya bar chos ston to //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya bar chos ston to //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the Dharma is called “the emptiness of inherent existence.”

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i go ba ni 'jig par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i go ba ni 'jig par mi 'gyur /
translated: The understanding of “the emptiness of inherent existence” does not destroy

original: phyis med par 'gro ba ma yin /🔽'phel 'grib med /
analyzed: phyis med par 'gro ba ma yin / 'phel 'grib med /
translated: and does not go to nonexistence later.🔽It does not increase or decrease,

original: skye 'gag med /
analyzed: skye 'gag med /
translated: does not arise or cease,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med de yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas pa 'gro 'ong med pa de la gnas nas bla na med pa'i byang chub la 'jug pa med pa'i tshul gyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med de yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas pa 'gro 'ong med pa de la gnas nas bla na med pa'i byang chub la 'jug pa med pa'i tshul gyis 'jug ste /
translated: There is no defilement and no purification. It is not located in a place or a direction. It is without coming or going. It is entered into by not entering into the unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong bar mthong nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong bar mthong nas /
translated: Having seen that all phenomena are empty by nature,

original: sgrib pa'i chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: one does not see any phenomena of obscuration.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis nas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis nas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar du mi dmigs na /
translated: If one does not observe the twelve deeds of a person up to the eighty minor marks in the emptiness of nature,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la dngos por the tshom lta ga la 'ong /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la dngos por the tshom lta ga la 'ong /
translated: how could one doubt the unsurpassed enlightenment as a thing?

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas 'khor rnam pa bzhi la chos bstan yang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa thob pa med pa bzhin du phyin ci log gi skyes bu phyin ci ma log pa la 'god do //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas 'khor rnam pa bzhi la chos bstan yang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa thob pa med pa bzhin du phyin ci log gi skyes bu phyin ci ma log pa la 'god do //
translated: For example, although a tathāgata’s emanation teaches the Dharma to the four assemblies, there is no attainment of stream-entry, and so on. Similarly, a mistaken person establishes an unmistaken person.

original: gang la phyin ci log med pa de la bdag nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med do //
analyzed: gang la phyin ci log med pa de la bdag nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med do //
translated: Whoever is free from error is free from self up to omniscience.

original: gang la gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang la gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid de /
translated: Whoever is free from form up to omniscience is free from intrinsic nature.

original: de la gnas shing phyin ci log tu gyur pa sems can gyi 'du shes gzugs kyi 'du shes zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes las 'grel to //
analyzed: de la gnas shing phyin ci log tu gyur pa sems can gyi 'du shes gzugs kyi 'du shes zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes las 'grel to //
translated: Abiding in that, one is freed from the perception of sentient beings, the perception of form, and the perception of the contaminated.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos nas @263b sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du don dam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos nas @263b sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du don dam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The factors of awakening up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are not ultimate.

original: 'dus ma byas ma skyes pa 'byung ba med pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma skyes pa 'byung ba med pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: The unconditioned, unborn, and non-arisen is intrinsic emptiness.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste /
translated: That is the awakening of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: bdag nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med do //
analyzed: bdag nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du med do //
translated: It is free from self up to omniscience.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa las lam gyi don du byang chub la 'jug pa med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid yongs su shes pa las lam gyi don du byang chub la 'jug pa med /
translated: The bodhisattva, from the full understanding of emptiness of intrinsic nature, does not enter into enlightenment for the sake of the path.

original: de ni snga phyi bar gsum du rang bzhin gyis mi stod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni snga phyi bar gsum du rang bzhin gyis mi stod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that he is not empty of intrinsic nature in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: The bodhisattva perfects all paths.
