original: sems can yongs su smin ba dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin ba dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byas nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Having ripened sentient beings and purified a buddhafield, he attains manifest, complete buddhahood.

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshul rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshul rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not fall from the perfection of emptiness of intrinsic nature, the way of all buddhas of the three times.

original: zhus lan gnyis pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod cing /
analyzed: zhus lan gnyis pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod cing /
translated: The second reply is that the bodhisattva practices emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan yang zhes 'grel bar mi bgyid /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan la rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan yang zhes 'grel bar mi bgyid /
translated: He does not say that form up to omniscience is one thing and emptiness of intrinsic nature is another.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen nyid kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen nyid kyang rang bzhin stong pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: It is astonishing to say that form and even omniscience are emptiness by nature.

original: de'i lan gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan ma yin rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang gzhan ma yin rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The reply is that form and so on are not one thing and emptiness by nature another.

original: gal te gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rang bzhin stong pa ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rang bzhin stong pa ma yin na ni /
translated: If form and so on were not emptiness by nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong par khong du chud nas sangs rgyas mi rgya bar thal ba las /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong par khong du chud nas sangs rgyas mi rgya bar thal ba las /
translated: it would follow that the buddhas would not become enlightened by realizing emptiness by nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni 'jig pa'am rtag tu gnas pa'am 'gro sa med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ni 'jig pa'am rtag tu gnas pa'am 'gro sa med de /
translated: But emptiness by nature is not something that is destroyed or that remains forever or that goes somewhere else.

original: gzhan du na 'jig rten rnams ni rmongs shing phung po la mngon par zhen pas skye rga na 'chi'i sdug bsngal las mi grol lo //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'jig rten rnams ni rmongs shing phung po la mngon par zhen pas skye rga na 'chi'i sdug bsngal las mi grol lo //
translated: Otherwise, since beings are confused and strongly attached to the aggregates, they would not be liberated from the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas practice the perfection of emptiness by nature.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar stong ngam mi stong zhes rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar stong ngam mi stong zhes rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: They do not disturb the form and so on up to omniscience as empty or non-empty.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'di ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro /
translated: Why is that?🔽The emptiness of nature does not disturb this form and so on up to omniscience.

original: 'di ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar stong pa nyid do zhes rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: It does not disturb this emptiness of form and so on up to omniscience.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni nam mkha' 'khrug @264a * //🔽par mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni nam mkha' 'khrug @264a * // par mi byed do //
translated: For example, space does not disturb space.

original: de bzhin du gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang stong pa nyid 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang stong pa nyid 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, form and so on up to omniscience do not disturb emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang de rnams 'khrug par mi byed de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang de rnams 'khrug par mi byed de /
translated: Emptiness also does not disturb them.

original: gnyis ka dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are unobservable.

original: gnyis zad kyi mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis zad kyi mdzad pa ni /
translated: The action of the exhaustion of the two:

original: gal te chos thams cad ma mchis lags na bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ma mchis lags na bdag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: If all phenomena do not exist, I would generate the mind of unsurpassed enlightenment and become a perfect buddha.

original: gnyis su 'byed pa la ni byang chub ma mchis so //
analyzed: gnyis su 'byed pa la ni byang chub ma mchis so //
translated: There is no awakening in the division into two.

original: lan de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lan de de bzhin no //
translated: The reply is, “So it is.”

original: gnyis la spyod pa la byang chub med do //
analyzed: gnyis la spyod pa la byang chub med do //
translated: Awakening is not in the practice of duality.

original: byang chub ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyan  gyi bar la mi spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyan  gyi bar la mi spyod do //
translated: Awakening does not practice with form up to omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub ni bdag gam bdag gir bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni bdag gam bdag gir bya ba med pa ste /
translated: Awakening is not a self or something that belongs to a self.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la bdag gam bdag gir bya ba med do /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la bdag gam bdag gir bya ba med do /
translated: Form up to omniscience is not a self or something that belongs to a self.

original: byang chub 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa gong la yang mi spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa gong la yang mi spyod do //
translated: Awakening does not practice with the grasping or nongrasping of anything up to omniscience.

original: gsol pa 'o na byang chub ci la spyod lags /
analyzed: gsol pa 'o na byang chub ci la spyod lags /
translated: ” He asked, “Well then, what does awakening practice with?”

original: lan mgo bsgre ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am mi 'dzin pa gang la spyod /
analyzed: lan mgo bsgre ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am mi 'dzin pa gang la spyod /
translated: The reply is, “Does a magical creation of the Tathāgata practice with the grasping or nongrasping of a dream of a worthy one?”

original: lan dgra bcom pa la nyal ba ma mchis na rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am mi 'dzin pa gang yang mi spyod do //
analyzed: lan dgra bcom pa la nyal ba ma mchis na rmi lam gyi blo 'dzin pa'am mi 'dzin pa gang yang mi spyod do //
translated: The reply is, “Since a worthy one does not sleep, he does not practice with the grasping or nongrasping of a dream.”

original: brda'i mdzad pa ni gsol pa byang chub 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa gang la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: brda'i mdzad pa ni gsol pa byang chub 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa gang la yang mi spyod /
translated: The symbolic action is that one does not engage in any way with the request, with the retention or nonretention of enlightenment.

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la yang mi spyod na /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la yang mi spyod na /
translated: One does not engage with form up to omniscience.

original: spyir lugs kyis ni phar phyin nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas /
analyzed: spyir lugs kyis ni phar phyin nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas /
translated: In general, according to the system, having perfected the perfections up to omniscience, one becomes a buddha.

original: phar phyin nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ma rdzogs na sangs rgya bar mi nus so ;
analyzed: phar phyin nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ma rdzogs na sangs rgya bar mi nus so ;
translated: If one does not perfect the perfections up to omniscience, one cannot become a buddha.

original: / lan phar phyin nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ma rdzogs na sangs mi rgya rdzogs na sangs rgya zhes pa de bas gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar de yang rang bzhin la gnas te sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: / lan phar phyin nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ma rdzogs na sangs mi rgya rdzogs na sangs rgya zhes pa de bas gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar de yang rang bzhin la gnas te sangs rgya'o //
translated: Since one does not become a buddha without perfecting the perfections up to omniscience, and one becomes a buddha by perfecting them, form and so on up to omniscience abide in the nature and are buddhas.

original: rang bzhin de yang nye bar zhi ba ste /🔽'phel 'grib med /🔽skye 'gag med /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang nye bar zhi ba ste / 'phel 'grib med / skye 'gag med /
translated: That nature is also completely pacified.🔽It is neither increased nor decreased.🔽It is neither produced nor stopped.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med /
translated: It is neither afflicted nor purified.

original: thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa med de /
translated: It is neither attained nor realized.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du sangs rgya'i don dam par ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du sangs rgya'i don dam par ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du ma yin no //
translated: In the ultimate sense, however, the Buddha is not form, and so on up to: the Buddha is not omniscience.

original: de bas na sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de bas na sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Therefore, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment

original: byang chub la spyod kyang sems dang sems can @264b dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub la spyod kyang sems dang sems can @264b dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so //
translated: he practices the career of the Bodhisattva, but he does not apprehend the thought, nor beings, nor Buddhas, nor Bodhisattvas.

original: mgo bsgre ba ni rab 'byor dgra bcom pa thob ces pa de dag dmigs par 'gyur ram //
analyzed: mgo bsgre ba ni rab 'byor dgra bcom pa thob ces pa de dag dmigs par 'gyur ram //
translated: “Subhuti, is it possible to apprehend the Arhatship of the Arhats?”

original: gsol pa ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, Lord.”

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis bstan pa lags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis bstan pa lags so //
translated: “It is taught as a conventional expression of the world.”

original: don de bzhin du gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang 'jig rten tha snyad du btags pa'o //
analyzed: don de bzhin du gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar yang 'jig rten tha snyad du btags pa'o //
translated: In the same way, form, etc. to: the knowledge of all modes are mere conventional expressions of the world.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos gang yang 'phel 'grib bam phan gnod gang yang mi dmigs te chos kyi rang bzhin nye bar gzung na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la ma dmigs na //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos gang yang 'phel 'grib bam phan gnod gang yang mi dmigs te chos kyi rang bzhin nye bar gzung na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin la ma dmigs na //
translated: The Bodhisattva does not apprehend any dharma as increasing or decreasing, as beneficial or unbeneficial, if he apprehends the dharma-element.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
translated: So what need is there to mention that the bodhisattvas will not focus on anything from the first generation of bodhichitta up to omniscience?

original: de ltar byang chub la spyod cing sangs rgyas te sems can gyi don byed do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub la spyod cing sangs rgyas te sems can gyi don byed do //
translated: Thus, they will practice the path to enlightenment, attain buddhahood, and benefit sentient beings.

original: chos nyid 'khrug pa med pa'i le'u ste re lnga pa'o /
analyzed: chos nyid 'khrug pa med pa'i le'u ste re lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifty-first chapter of The Precious Treasury of the Basic Space of Phenomena, demonstrating that the nature of phenomena is without disturbance.

original: // / le'u 'di nas mi dmigs pa dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phrin las gnyis ston pa las /
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas mi dmigs pa dang sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phrin las gnyis ston pa las /
translated: From this point onward in this chapter, the discussion concerns two topics: the enlightened activity of nonreferential focus and the activity of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: dang po la zhus lan bdun ni gsol pa /
analyzed: dang po la zhus lan bdun ni gsol pa /
translated: The first of these topics is addressed in seven sets of questions and answers.

original: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rdzogs par bgyis kyang sangs mi rgya lags sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar rdzogs par bgyis kyang sangs mi rgya lags sam /
translated: The first question is, “Do bodhisattvas not attain buddhahood even though they perfect the paramitas and omniscience?”

original: lan byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe thabs mkhas pas sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyod kyang /
analyzed: lan byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe thabs mkhas pas sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyod kyang /
translated: The reply is that when bodhisattvas are engaged in the conduct associated with the mother, they are skilled in means and so engage in generosity and the rest of the paramitas up to omniscience.

original: de dag kyang mi dmigs de las gzhan du'ang mi spyod na /
analyzed: de dag kyang mi dmigs de las gzhan du'ang mi spyod na /
translated: However, they do not focus on these and do not engage in them in any other way.

original: byang chub kyi lam thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, they will attain the path of enlightenment.

original: yum la de ltar spyod na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgya'o //
analyzed: yum la de ltar spyod na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sangs rgya'o //
translated: If you practice in that way with the mother, you will awaken to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: zhus lan gnyis pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: zhus lan gnyis pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: The second question is, when bodhisattvas practice with the mother,

original: byang chub kyi lam la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam la brtson par bgyid pa lags /
translated: how do they strive on the path to enlightenment?

original: de'i lan gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
analyzed: de'i lan gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la mi sbyor mi 'byed de /
translated: The answer is that they do not join form to anything up to and including omniscience, nor do they separate them.

original: gang sbyar bar bya ba'am dbye bar bya ba ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang sbyar bar bya ba'am dbye bar bya ba ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is to be joined or separated has no essence.

original: zhus lan gsum pa ni gang sbyar ba'am dbye bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma mchis na /
analyzed: zhus lan gsum pa ni gang sbyar ba'am dbye bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ma mchis na /
translated: The third question is, if there is no essence to be joined or separated,

original: yum la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: yum la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: how should we train with the mother?

original: yum la ma bslabs na sangs rgya bar mi nus lags so //
analyzed: yum la ma bslabs na sangs rgya bar mi nus lags so //
translated: If we do not train with the mother, we will not be able to awaken to buddhahood.

original: de'i lan de de bzhin te thabs la mkhas pa yin gyi 'on te ma dmigs na /
analyzed: de'i lan de de bzhin te thabs la mkhas pa yin gyi 'on te ma dmigs na /
translated: The answer is, “That is so. It is skillful means. But if you do not apprehend anything,

original: 'di ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro zhes ci zhig gzung /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro zhes ci zhig gzung /
translated: what will you apprehend, saying, ‘This is form up to and including omniscience’?

original: sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni gzung du med pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ni gzung du med pa ste /
translated: From generosity up to and including omniscience are not apprehended.

original: slob pa dang byang chub dang sangs rgyas nas so so'i skye @265a * //
analyzed: slob pa dang byang chub dang sangs rgyas nas so so'i skye @265a * //
translated: It is said that the three times are the time of the learner, the time of enlightenment and the time of buddhahood.🔽

original: ba'i bar ro zhes yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: ba'i bar ro zhes yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could there be any existence from the stage of ordinary being up to enlightenment and buddhahood?

original: zhus pa bzhi pa ni chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa la so so'i skye bo nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du dmigs su ma mchis lags /
analyzed: zhus pa bzhi pa ni chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa la so so'i skye bo nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du dmigs su ma mchis lags /
translated: The fourth question is: “All phenomena are unreal, and from ordinary being up to buddhahood they are unobservable.

original: lan ji ltar gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la byis pa so so'i skye bos mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de ltar yod par 'gyur tam /
analyzed: lan ji ltar gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la byis pa so so'i skye bos mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de ltar yod par 'gyur tam /
translated: ” The reply is: “Are form and so on up to omniscience as they are conceived by ordinary beings existent?

original: yod dam yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: yod dam yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: Are they existent, or will they become existent?

original: gsol pa de rnams phyin ci log lags kyi de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa de rnams phyin ci log lags kyi de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: ” The request is: “Those are mistaken, but they do not exist.

original: lan chos thams cad dngos po med pa la phyin ci log gi dbang gis dngos por bzung ba de byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas de las bzlog nas byang chub la 'jog go //
analyzed: lan chos thams cad dngos po med pa la phyin ci log gi dbang gis dngos por bzung ba de byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas de las bzlog nas byang chub la 'jog go //
translated: ” The reply is: “In the case of all phenomena being unreal, due to the power of mistake they are apprehended as real. Bodhisattvas, through skill in means, reverse that and establish them in enlightenment.

original: zhu ba lnga pa ni byang chub la 'jug pa'i thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags /
analyzed: zhu ba lnga pa ni byang chub la 'jug pa'i thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags /
translated: ” The fifth question is: “What is that skill in means for engaging in enlightenment?

original: lan byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe chos gang la thogs pa'i dngos po'am zhum pa'am /
analyzed: lan byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe chos gang la thogs pa'i dngos po'am zhum pa'am /
translated: Reply: When a bodhisattva is practicing in the presence of his mother, he does not see any phenomenon that is an entity that is obstructed, or that is discouraged,

original: sgyid lug pa'am /🔽tshi chad nas le lor gyur pa'i dngos po ma mthong ste /
analyzed: sgyid lug pa'am / tshi chad nas le lor gyur pa'i dngos po ma mthong ste /
translated: or that is lazy,🔽or that is indolent and becomes slothful.

original: sems can rnams rmongs pas phung po khams skye mched rten 'brel la mngon par zhen pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams rmongs pas phung po khams skye mched rten 'brel la mngon par zhen pas /
translated: Because sentient beings are confused, they are attached to the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and dependent origination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par yang dag par rjes su mthong nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par yang dag par rjes su mthong nas /
translated: Bodhisattvas see all phenomena to be devoid of characteristics.

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po lta bu'i lus kyis phar phyin drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po lta bu'i lus kyis phar phyin drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog ste /
translated: With a body that is like an illusion-maker, they turn away from the factors that are incompatible with the six perfections.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la bkod do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la bkod do //
translated: They establish them in the stream enterer and so forth.

original: zhus pa drug pa ni sems can gtan ma mchis na ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sbyor zhing /
analyzed: zhus pa drug pa ni sems can gtan ma mchis na ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sbyor zhing /
translated: The sixth question is, if sentient beings do not exist at all, how can they be caused to engage in the six perfections and

original: rgyun zhugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du thob par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: rgyun zhugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du thob par 'gyur lags /
translated: how can they attain the state of a stream enterer and so forth up to omniscience?

original: lan kun rdzob kyi brdas de tshe ston pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di nyid la gdags kyang mi dmigs na rgyun zhugs pa la sogs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: lan kun rdzob kyi brdas de tshe ston pa ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' tshe 'di nyid la gdags kyang mi dmigs na rgyun zhugs pa la sogs pa lta ci smos /
translated: If they are not perceived, what need is there to mention stream enterers and so on?

original: zhus pa bdun pa ni chos gcig gam tha dad kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: zhus pa bdun pa ni chos gcig gam tha dad kyang mi dmigs /
translated: The seventh question is whether the one or the different are not perceived.🔽If the three realms, the conditioned and the unconditioned, and the designation of sentient beings are not perceived, then all sentient beings, who are bound, liberated, completely afflicted, and completely purified, are not perceived to be different from the continuum of karma.

original: khams gsum dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / sems can du gdags pa mi dmigs na sems can bcings grol kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam byang las kyi rgyud tha dad pa las dang nyon mongs rnam par smin pas bdag gam sems can thams cad rgyun chad par mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: khams gsum dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / sems can du gdags pa mi dmigs na sems can bcings grol kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam byang las kyi rgyud tha dad pa las dang nyon mongs rnam par smin pas bdag gam sems can thams cad rgyun chad par mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Are all sentient beings or the self not perceived to be severed by the ripening of karma and affliction?

original: de'i lan sngon sems can 'gro ba lnga sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' yod pa phyis med par 'gyur ba @265b med de /
analyzed: de'i lan sngon sems can 'gro ba lnga sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' yod pa phyis med par 'gyur ba @265b med de /
translated: The answer is that previously sentient beings existed in the five realms with buddhas and bodhisattvas, but later they do not exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni byung rung ma byung rung de bzhin nyid la sogs par gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni byung rung ma byung rung de bzhin nyid la sogs par gnas te /
translated: Whether or not the tathagatas arise, they abide in suchness and so on.

original: de la byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis phung po khams la sogs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de la byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis phung po khams la sogs pa lta ci smos /
translated: How much less could there be a person who acts, or the aggregates, elements, and so on?

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba nas dgrol ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba nas dgrol ba lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be liberation from the five destinies of cyclic existence?

original: byang chub sems dpas sngon gyi sangs rgyas la yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de thos nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sngon gyi sangs rgyas la yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa de thos nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having heard that the essence of the buddhas of the past is empty of essence,

original: sems can phyin ci log gi skye bo rnams drang ba'i phyir byang chub la 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can phyin ci log gi skye bo rnams drang ba'i phyir byang chub la 'jug go //
translated: enters into enlightenment in order to lead astray those beings who are mistaken.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po rnams sprul pa zhig gis srog chags mang po sprul te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan po rnams sprul pa zhig gis srog chags mang po sprul te /
translated: For example, suppose that some magicians conjured up many living beings,

original: bza' ba dang bca' bas tshim par byas nas /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' bas tshim par byas nas /
translated: and having conjured them up, satisfied them with food and drink,

original: bdag gis bsod nams mang du spel lo zhes yang yang du brjod na /
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams mang du spel lo zhes yang yang du brjod na /
translated: and then said again and again, “We have increased our merit greatly.”

original: des tshim par byas pa'am bsod nams mang du 'phel ba yod dam /
analyzed: des tshim par byas pa'am bsod nams mang du 'phel ba yod dam /
translated: Would they have satisfied them or increased their merit greatly?

original: ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: ma mchis lags so //
translated: No they would not.

original: lan byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: lan byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, from the time when he first begins his career,

original: sbyin pa nas ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad kyang lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang / sems can de lta bu btul ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa nas ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyad kyang lam yongs su rdzogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang / sems can de lta bu btul ba gang yang med do //
translated: Although they practice generosity and the other perfections and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, there is no one who has completed the path, purified a buddhafield, or brought sentient beings to full maturity.

original: zhus len gnyis pa lus can rnams yong su smin par byed pa'i phrin las ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: zhus len gnyis pa lus can rnams yong su smin par byed pa'i phrin las ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: The second question and answer concerns the activity of bringing beings to full maturity.

original: sems can yongs su smin pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa'i byang chub bgyi lam gang lags /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyid pa'i byang chub bgyi lam gang lags / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhuti asks, “What is the path to enlightenment that brings sentient beings to full maturity and purifies the buddhafield?”

original: sbyin pa nas ma 'dres pa'i bar ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa nas ma 'dres pa'i bar ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin te /
translated: The Buddha replies, “The path of the bodhisattva is from generosity to the distinctive qualities.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa po la sogs pa'i gang zag drug gis sems can pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bral ba dag mthong na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa po la sogs pa'i gang zag drug gis sems can pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bral ba dag mthong na /
translated: When the six kinds of people, the generous and so on, see other sentient beings who are devoid of the six perfections,

original: khyod ci'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: khyod ci'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la mi spyod /
translated: they should ask themselves, ‘Why don’t you practice the six perfections and so on?’

original: de dag rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: bdag cag rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag rkyen dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because we do not have the conditions.”

original: gang zag drug pos smras pa /
analyzed: gang zag drug pos smras pa /
translated: The sixth person said,

original: phar phyin drug gi rkyen /
analyzed: phar phyin drug gi rkyen /
translated: “The conditions for the six perfections are

original: zas 'dod pa la zas zhes pa nas mi'i yod byad gang yang rung ba'i bar du sbyin gyi /🔽phar phyin drug la sogs pa la spyod cig ces pa nas yon dag spel gtongs  kyi phar phyin drug ste /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa la zas zhes pa nas mi'i yod byad gang yang rung ba'i bar du sbyin gyi / phar phyin drug la sogs pa la spyod cig ces pa nas yon dag spel gtongs  kyi phar phyin drug ste /
translated: giving food to those who want food, and so on up to giving any human necessities whatsoever.🔽Give those and practice the six perfections and so on.”

original: le'u re drug pa'o /
analyzed: le'u re drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixth chapter, on the increase of offerings.

original: // / le'u 'di nas mdzad pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang mngon par ma zhen pa dang / byang chub thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag @266a * //
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas mdzad pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang mngon par ma zhen pa dang / byang chub thob pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag @266a * //
translated: The four deeds from this chapter on are the bodhisattva path, nonattachment, attaining enlightenment, and purifying the buddhafield.

original: pa'o ; / byang chub sems dpa'i lam ni sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro //
analyzed: pa'o ; / byang chub sems dpa'i lam ni sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar ro //
translated: The bodhisattva path is from generosity up to omniscience.

original: gsol pa / gal te chos thams cad stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa / gal te chos thams cad stong pa lags na /
translated: He said, “If all phenomena are empty,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa bcu gcig rgyun zhugs la sogs pa 'di dag ces bslabs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa bcu gcig rgyun zhugs la sogs pa 'di dag ces bslabs na /
translated: then when bodhisattvas train in the eleven references, such as stream enterer and so on,

original: spros par mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: spros par mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: Will they not become elaborate?

original: len byis pa so so'i skye bos chos 'di dag stong par mi shes pas mngon par ma zhen pa'i mdzad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yum la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba ma gtogs par gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar mi dmigs
analyzed: len byis pa so so'i skye bos chos 'di dag stong par mi shes pas mngon par ma zhen pa'i mdzad pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yum la spyod pa'i tshe chos thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba ma gtogs par gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar mi dmigs
translated: Since ordinary, childish beings do not understand that these phenomena are empty, when bodhisattvas engage in the conduct of the mother, they do not observe anything from form to omniscience except for the act of non-fixation.🔽They think, “Sentient beings, practice generosity and so forth up to omniscience, but do not become conceited by it, for there is nothing substantial there at all.”

original: te / ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir sems can rnams la sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen la spyod cing des rlom sems sum byed cig / de la snying po gang yang med do zhes nas phar phyin drug la mi gnas /
analyzed: te / ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir sems can rnams la sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen la spyod cing des rlom sems sum byed cig / de la snying po gang yang med do zhes nas phar phyin drug la mi gnas /
translated: They do not abide in the six perfections.

original: bsam gtan bzhi nas mngon shes drug gi bar dang / de mnyam par gzhag pa dang / rnam pa gang gis mnyam par gzhag pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi nas mngon shes drug gi bar dang / de mnyam par gzhag pa dang / rnam pa gang gis mnyam par gzhag pa la mi gnas /
translated: They do not abide in the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the six clairvoyances, or in equipoise, or in the aspects by which they are equipoised.

original: nyan rang gi byang chub thob kyang mi gnas te /
analyzed: nyan rang gi byang chub thob kyang mi gnas te /
translated: They do not abide in the attainment of the enlightenment of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung nas sa bcu'i bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung nas sa bcu'i bar du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa sems gzhan gang yang ma bskyed do //
translated: From the time of first generating the Thought up to the tenth stage, he does not generate any other thought than the knowledge of all modes.

original: byang chub thob pa'i mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub thob pa'i mdzad pa ni /
translated: The deed of attaining enlightenment:

original: gsol pa / chos thams cad ma skyes lags na /
analyzed: gsol pa / chos thams cad ma skyes lags na /
translated: He asks, “If all things are unproduced,

original: byang chub ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi /
translated: how is enlightenment to be accomplished?”

original: de'i lan chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin yang de lta bu mi shes pa'i don du /
analyzed: de'i lan chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin yang de lta bu mi shes pa'i don du /
translated: The answer is that, although all things are unproduced, for the sake of those who do not know that,

original: byang chub kyi lam gyi sems can rnams 'khor ba las thar par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam gyi sems can rnams 'khor ba las thar par byed do //
translated: he liberates beings from cyclic existence by means of the enlightenment path.

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang / gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa la gnas nas byang chub thob par byed pa med pa ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang / gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa la gnas nas byang chub thob par byed pa med pa ma yin gyi ;
translated: It is not that there is no enlightenment to be attained by abiding in the produced, the unproduced, both, or neither;

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis byang chub thob par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis byang chub thob par bstan pa'o //
translated: but enlightenment is taught to be attained by worldly convention.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'i mdzad pa ni gsol pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'i mdzad pa ni gsol pa /
translated: The deed of purifying a buddhafield:

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi /
translated: If all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic nature, how can a bodhisattva purify a buddhafield?

original: de'i lan byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas lus ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyangs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag par byed do //
analyzed: de'i lan byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa nas lus ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyangs nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag par byed do //
translated: The answer is that from the first generation of the mind of awakening, bodhisattvas purify their physical and verbal negative tendencies and thus purify their buddhafield.

original: de la gnas ngan len ni mi dge ba bcu dang phar phyin drug gi mi mthun phyogs dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / nyan rang gi byang chub la 'dod pa bskyed cing mngon du @266b byed pa dang / gzugs nas rga shi'i bar gyi 'du shes dang /
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len ni mi dge ba bcu dang phar phyin drug gi mi mthun phyogs dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / nyan rang gi byang chub la 'dod pa bskyed cing mngon du @266b byed pa dang / gzugs nas rga shi'i bar gyi 'du shes dang /
translated: In this regard, negative tendencies are the ten nonvirtues, the counteragents to the six perfections, being devoid of the elements that lead to enlightenment, and so on, and generating and actualizing the wish for the enlightenment of the listeners and solitary realizers.🔽The concepts of form up to and including aging and death,

original: khams gsum dang / dmigs pa bcu gcig gi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: khams gsum dang / dmigs pa bcu gcig gi 'du shes ni gnas ngan len no //
translated: the three realms, and the eleven referential objects are negative tendencies.

original: gnas ngan len sbyong ba gsum ni bdag phar phyin drug la spyod cing gzhan yang skul ba dang / zhing spyod gnyis pa ni mchod pa rnam pa lngas sbyong ba dang / gsum pa ni snyoms 'jug gsum /
analyzed: gnas ngan len sbyong ba gsum ni bdag phar phyin drug la spyod cing gzhan yang skul ba dang / zhing spyod gnyis pa ni mchod pa rnam pa lngas sbyong ba dang / gsum pa ni snyoms 'jug gsum /
translated: The second pair, the field and the practice, is to purify by means of the five kinds of offerings and to dedicate the merit to the attainment of buddhahood for the benefit of all beings.

original: byang phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun rnam thar sgo gsum la sems can thams cad dgod pa /
analyzed: byang phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun rnam thar sgo gsum la sems can thams cad dgod pa /
translated: The third pair is to establish all sentient beings in the three doors of perfect liberation, that is, in the thirty-seven elements that lead to enlightenment.🔽Until one has acquired all these qualities, one will not attain buddhahood, but will continue to accumulate merit and wisdom and to purify one's buddhafield.

original: nam chos de dag thams cad dang ldan par ma gyur gyi bar du sangs mi rgya bar bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi tshogs sogs shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag par byed de de ci nas kyang ngan song gsum dug gsum mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi /🔽bag la nyal dang kun nas ldang bas phyin ci log tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid cing /
analyzed: nam chos de dag thams cad dang ldan par ma gyur gyi bar du sangs mi rgya bar bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi tshogs sogs shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag par byed de de ci nas kyang ngan song gsum dug gsum mi rtag pa la sogs pa bzhi /🔽bag la nyal dang kun nas ldang bas phyin ci log tu gdags pa'i ming yang mi srid cing /
translated: And in that buddhafield, it will be impossible for the three poisons, the four errors, the four kinds of erroneous inversion, the latent tendencies and the overt manifestations to be labeled as such.

original: shing rlung gis btab pa'am phyi nang gi dngos po dag la rnam thar gsum dang / skye 'gag med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //🔽gang stong pa de la mtshan ma med do //
analyzed: shing rlung gis btab pa'am phyi nang gi dngos po dag la rnam thar gsum dang / skye 'gag med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong ngo // gang stong pa de la mtshan ma med do //
translated: The sounds of the three doors of liberation, of the absence of arising and ceasing, and of the absence of any nature, as well as the sounds of all phenomena being empty of all phenomena, are heard.🔽The sounds of the absence of signs and the absence of wishes are heard.

original: gang mtshan ma med pa de la smon pa med do zhes bya ba'i sgra nyin mtshan du rgyun mi 'chad par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: gang mtshan ma med pa de la smon pa med do zhes bya ba'i sgra nyin mtshan du rgyun mi 'chad par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: In this way, they purify the buddha realms day and night.

original: de sangs rgyas dang sems can rnams la legs pa brjod cing mtshan thos pa de dag thams cad byang chub tu nges te /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas dang sems can rnams la legs pa brjod cing mtshan thos pa de dag thams cad byang chub tu nges te /
translated: They praise the buddhas and sentient beings, and all those who hear their names will be destined for awakening.

original: chos yin min gyi the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: chos yin min gyi the tshom mi za'o //
translated: They will not doubt whether phenomena are virtuous or not.

original: sems mi dge ba'i rtsa bas non pa /
analyzed: sems mi dge ba'i rtsa bas non pa /
translated: They will not be overcome by unvirtuous roots.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ma zin pa rtag chad kyi lta bar ltung nas log par 'dzin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ma zin pa rtag chad kyi lta bar ltung nas log par 'dzin te /
translated: They will not fall into the views of permanence and annihilation, and they will not hold wrong views.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos yin pa la min /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos yin pa la min /
translated: They will not doubt whether the Buddha and the Dharma are virtuous.

original: min pa la yin zhes zer zhing dkon mchog spangs pas /
analyzed: min pa la yin zhes zer zhing dkon mchog spangs pas /
translated: And they say that what is not the Three Jewels is the Three Jewels, and they abandon the Three Jewels.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song du 'gro ba de dag thugs rje chen pos bkrol nas byang chub la nges par sbyor ro //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song du 'gro ba de dag thugs rje chen pos bkrol nas byang chub la nges par sbyor ro //
translated: After they die, they go to the lower realms. The Great Compassionate One liberates them and definitely joins them to enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag pa'i le'u ste re bdun pa'o /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag pa'i le'u ste re bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the pure buddha fields, the thirty-seventh chapter of the Dharma teaching of “The White Lotus of the Good Dharma.”

original: // / le'u 'di nas mdzad pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas mdzad pa bzhi ste /
translated: From here on there are four deeds:

original: nges pa dang sems can don dang / sangs rgyas bsten la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: nges pa dang sems can don dang / sangs rgyas bsten la sogs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: certainty, the benefit of sentient beings, relying on the Buddha, and so on, and the branches of enlightenment.

original: de la dang po nges pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po nges pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed pa la sogs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu nges pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first, certainty, is the bodhisattvas’ certainty in unsurpassed enlightenment, beginning with the generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: gsol pa / byang chub sems dpa' nges pa ngan song gsum la sogs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gsol pa / byang chub sems dpa' nges pa ngan song gsum la sogs par 'gyur ram /
translated: It is asked: “Do bodhisattvas become the three lower realms and so on?”

original: de'i lan mgo bsgre ni nyan rang gi byang chub ngan song @267a * //
analyzed: de'i lan mgo bsgre ni nyan rang gi byang chub ngan song @267a * //
translated: The answer to that is: “Just as the enlightenment of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas does not become the three lower realms,

original: du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: in the same way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' phar phyin drug la spyod pa ni mi khom pa'i gnas brgyad la sogs par ltung ba'i gnas med do //🔽sems can don tshad med kyi mdzad pa la ni drug las /🔽dang po gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phar phyin drug la spyod pa ni mi khom pa'i gnas brgyad la sogs par ltung ba'i gnas med do // sems can don tshad med kyi mdzad pa la ni drug las / dang po gsol pa /
translated: Bodhisattvas who practice the six transcendent perfections have no grounds for falling into the eight states lacking opportunity and so forth.🔽🔽🔽🔽

original: sems dang po bskyed pa mi khom pa'i gnas brgyad du mi skye na /🔽sangs rgyas nyid kyang byol song du skye ba'i rabs bstan na de'i tshe dge ba gang du thal /🔽de'i lan byang chub sems dpa' mi dge ba'i las kyis ngan song du skyes pa ma yin gyi /🔽ched du bsams shing sems can don du lus blangs kyang sdug bsngal mi gos so //🔽zhus lan gnyis pa dge ba'i chos gang la gnas shing de lta bu'i ngan 'gro'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽de'i lan dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas de lta bu'i lus 'dzin to //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa mi khom pa'i gnas brgyad du mi skye na /🔽sangs rgyas nyid kyang byol song du skye ba'i rabs bstan na de'i tshe dge ba gang du thal /🔽de'i lan byang chub sems dpa' mi dge ba'i las kyis ngan song du skyes pa ma yin gyi /🔽ched du bsams shing sems can don du lus blangs kyang sdug bsngal mi gos so //🔽zhus lan gnyis pa dge ba'i chos gang la gnas shing de lta bu'i ngan 'gro'i lus yongs su 'dzin pa lags /🔽de'i lan dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas nas de lta bu'i lus 'dzin to //
translated: Bodhisattvas who practice the six transcendent perfections have no grounds for falling into the eight states lacking opportunity and so forth.

original: zhus lan gsum pa dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ji ltar ngan song du 'gyur lags /
analyzed: zhus lan gsum pa dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa ji ltar ngan song du 'gyur lags /
translated: The third question is, “How can one who has perfected all virtuous qualities possibly be reborn in the lower realms?”

original: de'i lan mgo bsgre ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa sems can gyi don du ngan song du skyes nas sems can gyi don byed kyang ngan song gi sdug bsngal gyis gos pa med pa de bzhin du sprul pa bzhin
analyzed: de'i lan mgo bsgre ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa sems can gyi don du ngan song du skyes nas sems can gyi don byed kyang ngan song gi sdug bsngal gyis gos pa med pa de bzhin du sprul pa bzhin
translated: The answer to this is that just as the Thus-Gone One, who has perfected all virtuous qualities, takes birth in the lower realms for the sake of sentient beings and acts for their benefit without being tainted by the sufferings of the lower realms,

original: du byang chub sems dpas sems can don byed kyang rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: du byang chub sems dpas sems can don byed kyang rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattvas act for the benefit of sentient beings without conceptualization.

original: sgyu ma'i rta glang bzhin du gsod pa la sogs pa byung yang sdug bsngal med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rta glang bzhin du gsod pa la sogs pa byung yang sdug bsngal med do //
translated: Just as there is no suffering in the appearance of horses and elephants in an illusion, there is no suffering in the appearance of killing and so forth.

original: zhus lan bzhi pa de lta bu'i lus len kyang sdug bsngal gyis mi gos pa'i thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags /
analyzed: zhus lan bzhi pa de lta bu'i lus len kyang sdug bsngal gyis mi gos pa'i thabs la mkhas pa de gang lags /
translated: The fourth question is, “What is the skillful means by which one can take on such a body without being tainted by suffering?”

original: de'i lan yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gos pa med de /
analyzed: de'i lan yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gos pa med de /
translated: The answer is that one practices the mother, the perfection of wisdom, without being tainted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad stong pas gang gis reg pa dang / gang la reg pa de thams cad dmigs su med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pas gang gis reg pa dang / gang la reg pa de thams cad dmigs su med do //
translated: Since all phenomena are empty, neither that which touches nor that which is touched can be observed.

original: zhus lan lnga pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la spyod kyi chos gzhan la mi spyod dam /
analyzed: zhus lan lnga pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la spyod kyi chos gzhan la mi spyod dam /
translated: The fifth question is whether one practices only the perfection of wisdom and not the other perfections.

original: de'i lan phar phyin gyi khongs su ma chud pa'i chos gang yang med do //
analyzed: de'i lan phar phyin gyi khongs su ma chud pa'i chos gang yang med do //
translated: The answer is that there is no phenomenon that is not included within the perfections.

original: zhus lan drug pa shes phyin ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
analyzed: zhus lan drug pa shes phyin ngo bo nyid kyis stong na /
translated: The sixth question is whether the perfection of wisdom is empty by its very essence.

original: ji ltar khongs su 'du lags /
analyzed: ji ltar khongs su 'du lags /
translated: If so, how can it include everything?

original: de la ni khongs su chud pa dang ma chud pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: de la ni khongs su chud pa dang ma chud pa ma mchis so //
translated: The answer is that it does not include anything or exclude anything.

original: de'i lan chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid yin pa la yin par rtogs pas khongs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lan chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid yin pa la yin par rtogs pas khongs su chud pa'o //
translated: The answer is that all phenomena are emptiness, and by realizing that they are, they are included.

original: sangs rgyas bsten sogs kyi phrin las ni chos @267b thams cad stong pa la mngon shes drug gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsten sogs kyi phrin las ni chos @267b thams cad stong pa la mngon shes drug gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur zhing /
translated: The activity of attending to the buddhas and so on is to attend to the buddhas of the worlds of the ten directions with the six kinds of preternatural knowledge in the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bgyid pa lags /
translated: It is the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: de'i lan phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas la sogs pa btags pa thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas nyi tshe ba'i stong par mi 'gyur par mngon shes drug gis sems can gyi don byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i lan phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas la sogs pa btags pa thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas nyi tshe ba'i stong par mi 'gyur par mngon shes drug gis sems can gyi don byed pa ni /
translated: The reply to that is that since all the imputations of buddhas and so on in the worldly realms of the ten directions are empty of a nature, one engages in benefiting sentient beings with the six superknowledges without becoming a limited emptiness.

original: lha'i spyan gyis chos thams cad stong par mthong zhing gnas nas mngon par bsgrub po //
analyzed: lha'i spyan gyis chos thams cad stong par mthong zhing gnas nas mngon par bsgrub po //
translated: With the divine eye one sees all phenomena as empty and accomplishes them in that state.

original: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa de nyid kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ste de dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song zhing /
analyzed: de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa de nyid kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ste de dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song zhing /
translated: With that very pure divine eye one sees the worldly realms of the ten directions and goes to them by means of one's miraculous powers.

original: sbyin pa nas ma 'dres pa'i chos kyi bar dang / theg pa gsum gyis sems can gyi don byed cing sems can phar phyin drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ldan pa ston to //
analyzed: sbyin pa nas ma 'dres pa'i chos kyi bar dang / theg pa gsum gyis sems can gyi don byed cing sems can phar phyin drug gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ldan pa ston to //
translated: One benefits sentient beings with the three vehicles and demonstrates to sentient beings who possess the factors incompatible with the six perfections the six perfections.

original: de lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can gang dag skyes pa mthong nas /
analyzed: de lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can gang dag skyes pa mthong nas /
translated: With the divine eye he sees sentient beings born in the world systems of the ten directions.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song zhing sems can de dag gi sems khong du chud par byas nas mthun par phar phyin drug dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bar gyi chos ston to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis de dag tu song zhing sems can de dag gi sems khong du chud par byas nas mthun par phar phyin drug dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bar gyi chos ston to //
translated: By means of his miraculous powers he goes there, and having understood the minds of those sentient beings, he teaches them the Dharma in a way that is appropriate, from the six perfections up to the four noble truths and the four noble lineages.

original: des lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis lha'i sgra thos te /
analyzed: des lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis lha'i sgra thos te /
translated: With the divine ear, he hears the divine sounds.

original: des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag gi chos mnyan te thos nas de bzhin nyid du 'dzin to //🔽bzung nas sems can rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas nges 'byung gi bar gyi chos ston to //
analyzed: des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag gi chos mnyan te thos nas de bzhin nyid du 'dzin to // bzung nas sems can rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas nges 'byung gi bar gyi chos ston to //
translated: He listens to the Dharma of as many buddhas as there are in the world systems of the ten directions. Having heard it, he retains it.🔽Having retained it, he teaches sentient beings the Dharma from the six perfections up to the four noble truths and the four noble lineages.

original: de rnams kyi rnam grangs shes pa des sems can rnams kyi sems shes nas sbyin pa nas nges 'byung gi bar gyi chos ston to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam grangs shes pa des sems can rnams kyi sems shes nas sbyin pa nas nges 'byung gi bar gyi chos ston to //
translated: With that knowledge of synonyms, he teaches sentient beings the Dharma from generosity up to the four noble lineages.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa des sngon gyi sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang sems can gyi gnas rjes su dran pa de dag la sbyin pa nas nges 'byung gi bar gyi chos ston to //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa des sngon gyi sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang sems can gyi gnas rjes su dran pa de dag la sbyin pa nas nges 'byung gi bar gyi chos ston to //
translated: With the recollection of past lives, they teach beings the Dharma, from generosity to liberation, recalling the lives of past buddhas, hearers and sentient beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byed /🔽sems can rnams la sbyin pa nas nges 'byung gi bar du chos ston to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byed / sems can rnams la sbyin pa nas nges 'byung gi bar du chos ston to //
translated: With their miraculous powers, they serve the buddhas of the ten directions.🔽They teach beings the Dharma, from generosity to liberation.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon shes des sems can rnams la sbyin pa nas nges 'byung gi bar gyi chos ston kyang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon shes des sems can rnams la sbyin pa nas nges 'byung gi bar gyi chos ston kyang /
translated: With their superknowledge of the extinction of defilements, they teach beings the Dharma, from generosity to liberation.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis mi gos pa'i dpe ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas dgos pa thams cad byed kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis @268a * //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis mi gos pa'i dpe ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas dgos pa thams cad byed kyang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis @268a * //
translated: The example of not being affected by happiness or suffering is

original: mi gos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi gos pa bzhin no //
translated: like a magical emanation of the Tathagata performing all necessary actions but not being affected by happiness or suffering.

original: byang chub yan lag gi mdzad pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub yan lag gi mdzad pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste dge ba'i chos sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod kyang de la mi rtog cing de yongs su gtong ba'i tshe /
translated: The activity of the branches of enlightenment is that, beginning from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment, one practices the transcendent perfection of generosity of the virtuous dharmas, but one does not conceptualize that and when one gives it away,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is empty of inherent nature,

original: sbyin bdag dang / btang ba dang / len par mi rtog cing /
analyzed: sbyin bdag dang / btang ba dang / len par mi rtog cing /
translated: one does not conceptualize a giver, a gift, or a recipient.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi lam mo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas bdag kyang 'khor ba las sgrol zhing gzhan yang sgrol ba 'di ni dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi lam mo //
translated: And by the transcendent perfection of generosity, one liberates oneself from saṃsāra and also liberates others. This is the virtuous dharma, the path to enlightenment.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i le'u ste re brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i le'u ste re brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-eighth chapter on bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: // / le'u 'di nas mdzad pa gnyis las /
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas mdzad pa gnyis las /
translated: In this chapter, there are two activities.

original: las rnams chud mi za ba ni //
analyzed: las rnams chud mi za ba ni //
translated: The activity of the non-expiration of karma is as follows.

original: gsol ba chos de rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na sangs rgyas kyi chos gang lags /
analyzed: gsol ba chos de rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chos lags na sangs rgyas kyi chos gang lags /
translated: The request: If those dharmas are the bodhisattva dharmas, what are the buddhadharmas?

original: de'i len sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar thob par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin la /
analyzed: de'i len sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar thob par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin la /
translated: The bodhisattva’s Dharma is to attain from generosity to omniscience.

original: thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: Attainment is the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: gsol ba chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la dmyal ba nas sangs rgyas kyi dbye ba med pa dang / las dang las kyi rnam smin med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsol ba chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la dmyal ba nas sangs rgyas kyi dbye ba med pa dang / las dang las kyi rnam smin med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The question is, if all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, there would be no distinction from hell to buddhahood, and there would be no karma and ripening of karma.

original: de'i lan dngos po la las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa'i bya ba med kyang /
analyzed: de'i lan dngos po la las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa'i bya ba med kyang /
translated: The reply is, although there is no karma and ripening of karma in reality,

original: sems can rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par ma shes pas ngan par spyad pas ngan song /
analyzed: sems can rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par ma shes pas ngan par spyad pas ngan song /
translated: sentient beings, not knowing that they are empty of their own characteristics, engage in negative actions and are reborn in the lower realms.

original: legs par spyad pas mtho ris su skye'o //
analyzed: legs par spyad pas mtho ris su skye'o //
translated: By engaging in positive actions, they are reborn in the higher realms.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du spyad nas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar du spyad nas sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva, having practiced from generosity to omniscience, benefits sentient beings.

original: gsol pa sangs rgyas nas 'gro ba rgyud lnga nas dge sdig yod par gzigs sam ma gzigs /
analyzed: gsol pa sangs rgyas nas 'gro ba rgyud lnga nas dge sdig yod par gzigs sam ma gzigs /
translated: The question is, does the Buddha see the existence of virtue and evil in the five classes of transmigrating beings or not?

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs na dngos por 'gro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs na dngos por 'gro //
translated: If the Buddha sees with his Buddha-eye, it becomes substantial.

original: ma gzigs na las dang las kyi rnam smin ji lta bu lung bstan lags kyi lan /
analyzed: ma gzigs na las dang las kyi rnam smin ji lta bu lung bstan lags kyi lan /
translated: If he does not see, how can he explain the karmic actions and their ripening?

original: sems can rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par ma shes pas bden par bzung ba la de mi bden par bstan nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par ma shes pas bden par bzung ba la de mi bden par bstan nas /
translated: Since sentient beings do not understand that they are empty of their own characteristics, they grasp at them as real.

original: gzugs nas rga shi'i bar dang / dmigs pa bcu gcig mi bden par bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs nas rga shi'i bar dang / dmigs pa bcu gcig mi bden par bstan to //
translated: Having shown that they are not real, he taught that the eleven topics, from form to aging and death, are not real.

original: bden pa'i mdzad pa zhus lan gsum las /
analyzed: bden pa'i mdzad pa zhus lan gsum las /
translated: The third question and answer is about the activity of truth.

original: dang po chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: dang po chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na /
translated: First, if all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics,

original: sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams ji ltar grol bar mdzad /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nas sems can rnams ji ltar grol bar mdzad /
translated: how do the buddhas liberate sentient beings?

original: de'i lan chos thams cad bden bzhir bstan nas 'grol lo //🔽zhus len gnyis pa bden pa bzhis grol lam /
analyzed: de'i lan chos thams cad bden bzhir bstan nas 'grol lo // zhus len gnyis pa bden pa bzhis grol lam /
translated: The answer is that they are liberated by teaching all phenomena as the four truths.

original: bden pa bzhi shes pas grol la /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi shes pas grol la /
translated: The second question and answer is about whether one is liberated by the four truths.

original: de'i lan bden pa dang bden pa shes pa las grol ba ma yin @268b gyi ;
analyzed: de'i lan bden pa dang bden pa shes pa las grol ba ma yin @268b gyi ;
translated: The answer is that one is not liberated by the truths or by knowing the truths.

original: bden pa bzhi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is the sameness of the four noble truths.

original: zhus lan gsum pa mnyam pa nyid de gang lags kyi lan /
analyzed: zhus lan gsum pa mnyam pa nyid de gang lags kyi lan /
translated: The third reply is the reply to the question, “What is that sameness?”

original: chos nyid bdun rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid bdun rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the seven realities are empty of their own marks.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i le'u ste re dgu pa'o /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i le'u ste re dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the thirty-ninth chapter on the nonexistence of things and nonthings.

original: // / le'u 'di nas phyin ci log spangs pa dang / de'i gzhi med pa'i phrin las gnyis las /
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas phyin ci log spangs pa dang / de'i gzhi med pa'i phrin las gnyis las /
translated: This chapter is about the abandonment of error and the basis of that, which is the absence of activity.

original: dang po ni chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis /
analyzed: dang po ni chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis /
translated: The first of these is the question, “If all phenomena do not exist

original: sangs rgyas dang sems can gang gis kyang ma bgyis na las 'dis ni dmyal ba dang lha'i bar du skyes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang sems can gang gis kyang ma bgyis na las 'dis ni dmyal ba dang lha'i bar du skyes so //
translated: and are not made by buddhas or sentient beings, then by this karma, they are born in the hells up to the gods.”

original: las 'dis 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams su ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: las 'dis 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams su ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: “How do these karmas become the noble beings?”

original: dngos po ma mchis pa rnams la ni las dang bya ba dang byed pa dang 'bras bu ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa rnams la ni las dang bya ba dang byed pa dang 'bras bu ma mchis lags so //
translated: “In the nonexistence of things, there is no karma, action, agent, or result.”

original: de'i lan dngos po ma mchis pa de rnams med kyang byis pa so so'i skye bos ma shes pas phyin ci log las byung ba'i las sna tshogs byed pas dmyal ba nas sangs rgyas gyi  bar du lus sna tshogs 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i lan dngos po ma mchis pa de rnams med kyang byis pa so so'i skye bos ma shes pas phyin ci log las byung ba'i las sna tshogs byed pas dmyal ba nas sangs rgyas gyi  bar du lus sna tshogs 'grub bo //
translated: The reply to that is: “Those non-entities do not exist, but because childish ordinary beings do not understand that, they engage in various actions that arise from error. Therefore, various bodies are produced, from hell beings up to buddhas.”

original: khyod dngos po med na las dang 'bras bu dang / dmyal ba nas sangs rgyas kyi bar mi 'thad do zer ba ni /
analyzed: khyod dngos po med na las dang 'bras bu dang / dmyal ba nas sangs rgyas kyi bar mi 'thad do zer ba ni /
translated: “If entities do not exist, karma and effects and everything from hell beings up to buddhas are untenable.”

original: khyed de tsho dngos po med pa ma yin snyam mam /
analyzed: khyed de tsho dngos po med pa ma yin snyam mam /
translated: “Do you think that those do not exist?”

original: gsol pa de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa de lta ma lags so //
translated: “No, that is not the case.”

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa phyin ci log gi dbang gis bstan gyi de la dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa phyin ci log gi dbang gis bstan gyi de la dngos po med pa'o //
translated: “Hell beings and so on are taught through the power of error, but they do not exist.”

original: phyin ci log gi gzhi med pa'i phrin las ni chos thams cad dngos po med na kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam byang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi gzhi med pa'i phrin las ni chos thams cad dngos po med na kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam byang mi 'thad do //
translated: “If the basis of error does not exist and all phenomena are nonentities, then thoroughly afflicted and completely pure phenomena are untenable.”

original: de'i lan skyes bu mkhas pa la ngas dper bshad kyi /
analyzed: de'i lan skyes bu mkhas pa la ngas dper bshad kyi /
translated: “The reply to that is: ‘I will explain a simile to you, wise one.

original: 'khrul pa'i dpe drug ni rmi lam dang brag ca dang / mi g-yor dang smig rgyu dang sprul pa rnams las gang byas pas mtho ris dang ngan song du skye zhing rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du 'khor 'das kyi dngos po thams cad gzhi ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dpe drug ni rmi lam dang brag ca dang / mi g-yor dang smig rgyu dang sprul pa rnams las gang byas pas mtho ris dang ngan song du skye zhing rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du 'khor 'das kyi dngos po thams cad gzhi ma grub pa'o //
translated: The six examples of delusion are dream, echo, mirage, magical creation, and apparition. Just as whatever is done in these six examples does not cause birth in the higher realms or the lower realms and does not cause purification, so all things of cyclic existence and nirvana are not established as a basis.

original: kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam byang med pa'i le'u ste bdun cu pa'o /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs dang rnam byang med pa'i le'u ste bdun cu pa'o /
translated: This is the seventieth chapter, on the Absence of Defilement and Purification.🔽In this chapter, the three deeds of teaching the inseparability of purification, the accumulations, the conditioned, and the unconditioned are presented. The first of these is the deed of teaching the absence of defilement and purification in the correct view and the incorrect view.

original: // / le'u 'di nas rnam par byang ba dang tshogs dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dbyer med pa bstan pa'i mdzad pa gsum las dang po yang dag mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam byang ma mchis na /
analyzed: // / le'u 'di nas rnam par byang ba dang tshogs dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dbyer med pa bstan pa'i mdzad pa gsum las dang po yang dag mthong ba dang ma mthong ba la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam byang ma mchis na /
translated: If there is no defilement and purification in the correct view and the incorrect view,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam byang gsungs pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam byang gsungs pa gang lags /
translated: what is the purification taught by the Bhagavat?

original: de'i lan chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid chos nyid brgyad ni rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i lan chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid chos nyid brgyad ni rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: The answer is that the eight dharmas of the equality of all dharmas are purification.

original: tshogs kyi mdzad pa ni chos thams cad 'khrul pa'i dpe dang 'dra @269a * //
analyzed: tshogs kyi mdzad pa ni chos thams cad 'khrul pa'i dpe dang 'dra @269a * //
translated: The activity of the assembly is that all phenomena are like the example of delusion.

original: par dngos po dang rdzas su ma mchis lags na /🔽sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la gnas nas byang chub tu sems bskyed /🔽de'i lan khyod kyis brjod pa'i chos de rnams 'khrul pa'i dpe drug lta bu ma yin snyam mam /
analyzed: par dngos po dang rdzas su ma mchis lags na / sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la gnas nas byang chub tu sems bskyed / de'i lan khyod kyis brjod pa'i chos de rnams 'khrul pa'i dpe drug lta bu ma yin snyam mam /
translated: Since they do not exist as things and substances,

original: yang gsol ba chos de rnams 'khrul pa'i dpe drug lta bu lags na /
analyzed: yang gsol ba chos de rnams 'khrul pa'i dpe drug lta bu lags na /
translated: after abiding in generosity and so on up to omniscience, generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: de rnams ni yang dag pa ma lags /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa ni sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyad kyang sangs rgyas bar mi nus lags sam /🔽de'i lan sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyis sangs mi rgya'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni yang dag pa ma lags / yang dag pa ma yin pa ni sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar la spyad kyang sangs rgyas bar mi nus lags sam / de'i lan sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyis sangs mi rgya'o //
translated: Are these not correct?🔽Is it that if one practices generosity up to omniscience, one cannot become a buddha if it is not correct?🔽The answer is that one does not become a buddha by generosity up to omniscience.🔽

original: khyod de rnams kyis sangs rgyas snyam mam /🔽sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi 'dus byas pas ni sangs rgyas bar mi nus te /
analyzed: khyod de rnams kyis sangs rgyas snyam mam /🔽sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi 'dus byas pas ni sangs rgyas bar mi nus te /
translated: Do you think that they are the Buddha?🔽You cannot become a buddha through conditioned phenomena, from generosity to omniscience.🔽

original: 'on kyang lam skyed par byed kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang lam skyed par byed kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not for the sake of attaining the result that the path is generated.

original: de rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The non-arising, non-occurrence, and non-character of those is nirvana.

original: 'on kyang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas dge ba'i chos sbyin pa nas ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du sgyu ma lta bu shes nas lam rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung nas dge ba'i chos sbyin pa nas ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du sgyu ma lta bu shes nas lam rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: However, from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment onward, having understood that virtuous dharmas from generosity up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha are like an illusion, the path is completed.

original: phar phyin nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dang / de ltar spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khrul pa'i dpe drug dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: phar phyin nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar dang / de ltar spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khrul pa'i dpe drug dang 'dra bas /
translated: Thus, from the perfections up to omniscience, and the bodhisattvas who practice in that way are like the six examples of error.

original: sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gzung du med pas gzung du med pa'i chos rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gzung du med pas gzung du med pa'i chos rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: Since generosity up to omniscience are not apprehended, they do not realize the non-apprehended dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattvas practice in the mother,

original: sems can gyi don du phar phyin drug la spyod cing byed pa'i skyes bu med pa la yod par 'du shes pa'i sems can 'grol ba ni thabs yin no zhes so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du phar phyin drug la spyod cing byed pa'i skyes bu med pa la yod par 'du shes pa'i sems can 'grol ba ni thabs yin no zhes so //
translated: The method is to liberate sentient beings who perceive the existence of a person who practices and engages in the six perfections for the benefit of sentient beings, when in fact there is no such person.

original: gsol ba kun rdzob bam don dam par sangs rgyas lags /
analyzed: gsol ba kun rdzob bam don dam par sangs rgyas lags /
translated: Question: Are the buddhas conventional or ultimate?

original: lan 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la sangs rgyas zhes bstan gyi /
analyzed: lan 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la sangs rgyas zhes bstan gyi /
translated: Reply: The buddhas are taught in terms of worldly convention.

original: yang dag par na 'dis 'di lta bu zhig sangs rgyas zhes pa ni dmigs pa ste thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med pa /
analyzed: yang dag par na 'dis 'di lta bu zhig sangs rgyas zhes pa ni dmigs pa ste thob pa med cing mngon par rtogs pa med pa /
translated: In reality, there is no such thing as a buddha that can be observed, attained, or realized.

original: spros pa med cing spros pa thams cad dang bral ba mnyam pa nyid ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: spros pa med cing spros pa thams cad dang bral ba mnyam pa nyid ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: The equality that is free from elaborations and all conceptual elaborations is buddhahood.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dbyer med pa'i phrin las kyi mdzad pa lnga las /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dbyer med pa'i phrin las kyi mdzad pa lnga las /
translated: The five deeds of activity that are inseparable from the conditioned and unconditioned are as follows.

original: dang po de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi yum la dbang bsgyur ba ma lags sam /
analyzed: dang po de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi yum la dbang bsgyur ba ma lags sam /
translated: First, is it not the case that the tathāgatas have mastery over the mother of all phenomena?

original: lan ni chos thams cad kyang gzhan @269b la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: lan ni chos thams cad kyang gzhan @269b la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The answer is that all phenomena are not other than the Thus-Gone Ones.

original: so so'i skye bo nas sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid la khyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nas sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid la khyad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no difference between the suchness of ordinary beings and the suchness of buddhas.

original: zhus lan gnyis pa /
analyzed: zhus lan gnyis pa /
translated: The second question and answer:

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la khyad ma mchis na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la khyad ma mchis na /
translated: If there is no difference in the equality of all phenomena,
