original: ji ltar dkon mchog gsum 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji ltar dkon mchog gsum 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur lags /
translated: how can the Three Jewels appear in the world?

original: lan dkon mchog kyang gzhan chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: lan dkon mchog kyang gzhan chos mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The answer is that the Three Jewels are not other than the equality of phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la chos rnams rnam par dgod par mdzad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa nyid las kyang mi g-yo la chos rnams rnam par dgod par mdzad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: The Thus-Gone One does not waver from the equality of phenomena, yet he arranges the teachings. This is the power of the Thus-Gone One.

original: zhus lan gsum pa de bzhin gshegs pa chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba de bzhin du so so'i skye bo la sogs pa thams cad kyang chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba lags sam /
analyzed: zhus lan gsum pa de bzhin gshegs pa chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba de bzhin du so so'i skye bo la sogs pa thams cad kyang chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba lags sam /
translated: The third question and answer: Just as the Thus-Gone One does not waver from the equality of phenomena, do all beings, from ordinary beings onward, not waver from the equality of phenomena?

original: lan de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid brgyad gang yin pa de nyid so so'i skye bo la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: lan de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid brgyad gang yin pa de nyid so so'i skye bo la sogs pa thams cad kyi chos nyid do //
translated: The reply is that the dharmatā of the thus-gone ones is the dharmatā of all ordinary beings and so forth.

original: zhus lan bzhi pa so so'i skye bo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar gyi chos nyid mnyam pa nyid lags na /
analyzed: zhus lan bzhi pa so so'i skye bo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar gyi chos nyid mnyam pa nyid lags na /
translated: The fourth question is, “If the dharmatā of ordinary beings up to the thus-gone ones is the same,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gcig la gcig 'dus pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gcig la gcig 'dus pa /
translated: how is it that the characteristics of form up to omniscience are different from each other, and how is it that one is included in the other?🔽Having trained in the dharmatā of form up to omniscience, one perfects the six pāramitās and ripens sentient beings.”

original: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi chos nyid gzhan dang gzhan la bslabs nas phar phyin drug rdzogs nas sems can smin par bgyid pa lags zer ba'i lan ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi chos nyid stong pa nyid ma yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi chos nyid gzhan dang gzhan la bslabs nas phar phyin drug rdzogs nas sems can smin par bgyid pa lags zer ba'i lan ni gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi chos nyid stong pa nyid ma yin snyam mam /
translated: The reply is, “Do you think that the dharmatā of form up to omniscience is not emptiness?”

original: gsol ba de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol ba de lta ma lags so //
translated: The reply is, “No, it is not.”

original: stong pa nyid la gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi mtshan nyid de yod snyam mam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gzugs nas rnam mkhyen gyi bar gyi mtshan nyid de yod snyam mam /
translated: “Do you think that the characteristics of form up to omniscience exist in emptiness?”

original: ma lags so //
analyzed: ma lags so //
translated: “No, they do not.”

original: de lta bas na chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la so so'i skye bo nas 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams med /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la so so'i skye bo nas 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams med /
translated: Therefore, the reality of phenomena is not ordinary beings, and it is not the noble beings.

original: so so'i skye bo nas 'phags pa'i gang zag las gud na'ang de med par rig par bya'o //🔽zhus lan lnga pa chos nyid de 'dus byas lags sam ;
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nas 'phags pa'i gang zag las gud na'ang de med par rig par bya'o // zhus lan lnga pa chos nyid de 'dus byas lags sam ;
translated: It should be understood that it is not separate from ordinary beings and noble beings.

original: 'dus ma byas lags /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas lags /
translated: The fifth reply: Is that reality conditioned or unconditioned?

original: lan ni gnyis ka ma yin te /
analyzed: lan ni gnyis ka ma yin te /
translated: The reply: It is neither.

original: 'dus byas las gud na yang 'dus ma byas med /
analyzed: 'dus byas las gud na yang 'dus ma byas med /
translated: Unconditioned phenomena are not separate from conditioned phenomena.

original: don dam pa la lus ngag dang yid med /
analyzed: don dam pa la lus ngag dang yid med /
translated: Ultimate reality is not the body, speech, or mind.

original: de gsum las gud na'ang don dam pa med de /
analyzed: de gsum las gud na'ang don dam pa med de /
translated: It is not separate from those three.

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa ni don dam pa ste /🔽byang @270a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa ni don dam pa ste / byang @270a * //
translated: Ultimate reality is the sameness of all phenomena.

original: chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattvas practice the mother,

original: don dam pa las kyang mi g-yo la byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: don dam pa las kyang mi g-yo la byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod do //
translated: they do not move from ultimate reality, yet they engage in bodhisattva activity.

original: don dam pa'i rnal 'byor gyi le'u ste don gcig pa'o /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rnal 'byor gyi le'u ste don gcig pa'o /
translated: This was the chapter on the yoga of ultimate reality, the first chapter.

original: // / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdzad pa las zhus lan drug las /
analyzed: // / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdzad pa las zhus lan drug las /
translated: The Six Questions and Answers on the Deeds of Nirvana

original: dang po gsol pa /
analyzed: dang po gsol pa /
translated: First Question

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa stong pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa stong pa ste /
translated: What is the sameness of all phenomena? It is emptiness.

original: byed pa dang bya ba ma mchis kyang byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa don dam pa las mi g-yo lags /
analyzed: byed pa dang bya ba ma mchis kyang byang chub sems dpa' yum la spyod pa don dam pa las mi g-yo lags /
translated: Although there is no agent or action, how is it that bodhisattvas engage in conduct for the sake of sentient beings without wavering from the ultimate?

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can gyi don bgyid lags //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can gyi don bgyid lags //
translated: How do they benefit sentient beings through the four means of gathering?

original: lan ni don dam la ci yang med kyang sems can rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ma shes pa byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis su 'du shes pa dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang rten 'brel dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi 'du shes dang phral nas mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god do //
analyzed: lan ni don dam la ci yang med kyang sems can rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ma shes pa byed pa'i skyes bu bcu gnyis su 'du shes pa dang / phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang rten 'brel dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi 'du shes dang phral nas mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god do //
translated: The Answer: Although nothing exists in the ultimate, sentient beings do not understand natural emptiness. They are gathered into twelve types of persons, and their perceptions of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, the conditioned, and the unconditioned are removed, and they are established in nirvana.

original: zhus lan gnyis pa /
analyzed: zhus lan gnyis pa /
translated: Second Question

original: gsol ba cis stong pa lags /
analyzed: gsol ba cis stong pa lags /
translated: What is emptiness?

original: lan 'du shes thams cad kyis stong ste /
analyzed: lan 'du shes thams cad kyis stong ste /
translated: The Answer: It is empty of all perceptions.

original: sprul pa cig sprul na de stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po gang yang med pas 'di ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa cig sprul na de stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po gang yang med pas 'di ni sprul pa'o //
translated: If one emanation is emanated, there is no entity that is not emptiness. Therefore, this is an emanation.🔽

original: 'di ni stong pa'o zhes dmigs su med do //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa'o zhes dmigs su med do //
translated: If one emanation is emanated, there is no entity whatsoever that is not emptiness. Therefore, it is not possible to apprehend this as an emanation and that as emptiness.

original: zhus lan gsum pa phung po lnga yang sprul pa'o //
analyzed: zhus lan gsum pa phung po lnga yang sprul pa'o //
translated: The third reply: The five aggregates are also emanations.

original: zhus lan bzhi pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas sangs rgyas kyi bar yang sprul pa lags sam ;
analyzed: zhus lan bzhi pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi nas sangs rgyas kyi bar yang sprul pa lags sam ;
translated: The fourth question: Are the supramundane dharmas, from the four establishments of mindfulness up to the buddhas, also emanations?

original: lan ni nyan thos rang rgyal byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa las dang nyon mongs pa'ang sprul pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni nyan thos rang rgyal byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa las dang nyon mongs pa'ang sprul pa'o //
translated: The reply: The hearers, solitary realizers, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas, as well as karma and mental afflictions, are emanations.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa spang ba thams cad kyang sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa spang ba thams cad kyang sprul pa'o //
translated: Even the stream enterers’ abandonment of all is an emanation.

original: zhus lan lnga pa sprul pa dang ma sprul pa de gang lags /
analyzed: zhus lan lnga pa sprul pa dang ma sprul pa de gang lags /
translated: The fifth question: What is emanated and what is not emanated?

original: de'i lan skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos thams cad sprul pa /
analyzed: de'i lan skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos thams cad sprul pa /
translated: The reply: All phenomena that arise and cease are emanations.

original: ma skyes ma 'gags pa mi mnyam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma sprul pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes ma 'gags pa mi mnyam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma sprul pa'o //
translated: Unequal nirvana, which is unborn and unceasing, is not emanated.

original: zhus lan drug pa nyan thos la sogs pa gang gis kyang mdzad pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de gang lags /
analyzed: zhus lan drug pa nyan thos la sogs pa gang gis kyang mdzad pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de gang lags /
translated: Question 6: What is the emptiness of essence that is not made by anything, such as the Sravakas?🔽Reply: If it were the case that something

original: de'i lan sngon dngos po yod par gyur la /
analyzed: de'i lan sngon dngos po yod par gyur la /
translated: that existed earlier

original: phyis dngos po med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: phyis dngos po med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: became nonexistent later,🔽or if it were the case that it had its own essence

original: rang gi dngos po'am /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po'am /
translated: Or,🔽

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med na /
translated: that it had the essence of something else,

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos nyid gcig yod par 'gyur re skan no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos nyid gcig yod par 'gyur re skan no //
translated: then there would be something called “the emptiness of essence.”🔽This is the seventy-second chapter, on the demonstration that reality is

original: chos nyid mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'i le'u ste bdun cu don gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: chos nyid mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'i le'u ste bdun cu don gnyis pa'o /
translated: unchanging.

original: // / stong phrag brgya pa'i rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / stong phrag brgya pa'i rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the treatise entitled “Explanation of the Hundred🔽Stanzas.”

original: // /'di ni kha che'i pandi ta dha rma shr'is mdzad do zhes grag go /
analyzed: // /'di ni kha che'i pandi ta dha rma shr'is mdzad do zhes grag go /
translated: It is said that this was composed by the Kashmiri paṇḍiṭ Dharmāśoka.
